loans.name: Topi Group

texts.en:
Sospeter K., who is in his early thirties, is single. He has been a photographer for two years.  He works from 8:00am to 10:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sospeter's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He hopes for a loan to buy a printer. His dream is to one day make his business big and famous.

Sospeter will share this loan with his loan group, "Topi", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Sospeter is 1st on the left in a blue shirt and holding a book.  Another group member, Max N., was unfortunately behind a big leaf, so a part of his face is not seen.

loans.use: To buy a printer

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad R. is from the village of San Sebastian, Ramon, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Trinidad is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Trinidad owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Trinidad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Trinidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Trinidad from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Luciola

texts.es:
Luciola tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y vive junto a sus hijos en el sector José Barsallo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zonas urbanas marginales que carecen de servicios básicos.

Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta especialmente de plátano y granadilla. Desde hace 15 años tiene instalado un pequeño puesto que está ubicado entre la Av. Venezuela y la Calle Uruguyay cerca al mercado del mismo distrito. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes la fruta fresca los cuales adquiere en el mercado mayorista de Moshoqueque. 

Luciola desea adquirir un lote de fruta (plátano y granadilla) además de otras frutas que le permita ofrecer variedad e incrementar sus ingresos Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luciola is 62 years of age.  She is a widow and lives with her children in the José Barsallo sector of the district of José Leonardo Ortiz, one of the most populated districts of the Lambayeque region, characterized principally by a high poverty index since the people live generally in marginal urban zones that lack basic services.  

She is dedicated to the sale of fruit especially bananas and passion fruit.  For the past 15 years she has had a small stall located along Venezuela Avenue and Uruguyay street close to the market of the same district.  Every day she offers her clients the fresh fruit which she acquires in the wholesale market of Moshoqueque.  

Luciola desires to acquire a lot of fruit (bananas and passion fruit) as well as other fruits that will allow her to offer variety and to increase her income.  Because of this she has found it convenient to request a loan of 200 new soles from Edpyme Alternative.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fruit.

loans.name: Ketty Carmen

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ketty, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 9 y 6 años  de edad, el mayor de ellos estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Es un muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo en su negocio por el bien de toda la familia, el se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de utensilios de cocina, como por ejemplo platos, ollas, cucharas, entre otras muchas cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, el se desplaza en su carro a otras ciudades para realizar sus ventas, nos cuenta que muchas veces ella también  lo acompaña sobre todo cuando hay ferias en esos lugares ya que en esos días las ventas son muy buenas.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio va a comprar ollas, platos, cubiertos, entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos le dan rápido y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Unión y Solidaridad' (Unity and Solidarity) community bank meet in San Pablo parish, in the city of Portoviejo. Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí, and it has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

This is where we meet Kitty, age 34.  She is married and has three children, ages 14, 9, and 6.  The oldest is in high school, and the two younger children are in elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a very good housewife who will, for the good of the whole family, use the loan to help her husband in his business.  He sells all types of kitchen utensils like plates, pots, spoons and many other items.  He sells door to door.  He goes to other cities in his car to make his sales.

She tells us that she goes with him a lot, especially when there are fairs at these locations.  She does so because those are the days when sales are very good.

She will use the loan to stock the business more.  She will buy pots, plates, and cutlery, among other things.  She has been in the communal bank for three cycles.  She likes it because the loans are given quickly and without so many requirements.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils like pots, plates, and cutlery, among other things.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 45-year-old married woman with five children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She takes care of the family with the help of her husband, and their desire is to educate their children until they attain a degree as a minimum qualification. 

She has had a retail shop for four years, and the business is profitable despite the hardship of limited funds for capital. Her vision is to have a wholesale business. Harriet needs the loan to buy sodas, Omo (detergent) and flour for selling.

loans.use: To buy sodas, Omo (detergent) and flour

loans.name: Cuanicuti Group

texts.es:
La señora Judith es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora ella es originaria del Distrito Federal, pero se fue a vivir desde hace 15 años a la población de Zitacuaro Michoacán por que a su esposo le ofrecieron un mejor trabajo en esa población. Ella esta casada con el señor Ernesto el cual es Chef, ellos tienen dos hijos un joven de 17 años estudiante de preparatoria y una niña de 8 años estudiante de primaria. ella se dedica hacer banquetes para fiestas como quince años, bautizos, presentaciones, bodas, cumpleaños etc. y repostería para vender a sus clientes, ella hace piernas de pavo, lomos, pavos, ensaladas, sopas, pastas, postres, comenta que quien le enseño hacer todo esto fue su esposo ya que el se había quedado sin trabajo y decidieron hacer este negocio ellos dos. Comenta que ella hace cada tercer día empanadas rellenas de comida o de mermeladas, bisquets, pays, y ya le gente le manda hacer pedidos. Comenta que ella esta pidiendo un préstamo para comprar la materia prima para hacer sus comidas y sus postres para venderlos, dice que surte todos los productos en diferentes tiendas de su población, también comenta que desgraciadamente no ha podido crecer su negocio tan rápido ya que las rentas son muy caras y ya hay mucha competencia en su población. La meta que tiene Judith es hacer un local propio en cual pueda poner su negocio estable y así tendría más clientes.
Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Araceli, Manuel, Decire, Minerva, Fabiola, Blanca, Melina, Nadia, Enriqueta y ven a ocupar sus prestamos para invertir en sus actividades económicas como papelería, venta de cosméticos por catalogo, venta de ropa usada, tienda de ropa nueva, zapatos por catalogo, tienda de abarrotes etc.
texts.en:
Judith is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman.  She is originally from Distrito Federal but 15 years ago she moved to the town of Zitacuaro, in Michoacán, because her husband was offered a better job in that town.  Judith is married to Ernesto who is a chef.  They have two children: a young boy of 17 who is in high school and an 8 year-old girl who is in elementary school.

Judith's business is catering for events such as 15th birthday celebrations, christenings, society debuts, weddings, birthdays etc.  She also bakes pastries to sell to her customers.  She prepares turkey legs, fillet steaks, turkeys, salads, soups, pastas and desserts.  She tells us that it was her husband who taught her how to do all this since he had lost his job and they decided to set up this business between the two of them.

Judith tells us that every three days she makes empanadas, jellies, biscuits and pies, and people also make orders with her.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy the raw materials she needs to make the food and desserts that she sells.  She says that she stocks up with products in the different stores in her town.  She also says that, unfortunately, she has not been able to grow her business so quickly because her rent is very expensive and there is a lot of competition in her town.

Judith's goal is to own her own premises where she can set up a stable business and thereby have more customers.  The other members of her group are called Araceli, Manuel, Decire, Minerva, Fabiola, Blanca, Melina, Nadia and Enriqueta.  They will invest their loans in their respective business activities which include a stationery store, selling cosmetics through a catalog, selling used clothes, a [new] clothes store, selling shoes through a catalog and running a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her catering business

loans.name: Mario Arístides

texts.es: Mario Arístides de 62 años, vive con su esposa de 65 años ambos tienen dos hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y uno de ellos se encuentra estudiando en la Universidad el otro ya logró sacar su carrera gracias a los esfuerzos que día a día realizan sus padres. Hace muchos años que  Mario se dedica al comercio y esta actividad es la que le ha dado los ingresos para sacar a delante a su familia. Cuenta con una pequeña  ferretería en la cual vende herramientas y utensilios básicos. Es un hombre lleno de energía que a pesar de su avanzada edad no se da por vencido y sigue trabajando junto a su querida esposa para lograr mejorar su condición de vida. Gracias a Dios ha logrado dar el estudio a sus dos hijos y es ésto lo que lo motiva a seguir adelante, es un hombre que le gusta recibir los frutos de su esfuerzo. Mario cuenta con mucha clientela ya que gracias a su carisma a logrado ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos. El sueña con ampliar su negocio, con tener mayores opciones de herramientas para sus clientes y aumentar el nivel de ventas para que de esta manera logre obtener mayores ingresos y poder ofrecerle a su esposa una vida más confortable. Esto lo ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para comprar variedad de herramientas manuales, herramientas de jardín,  utensilios eléctricos, pintura,  etc. De esta manera espera lograr  el sueño que tanto anhela.
texts.en:
Mario Arístides, age 62, lives with his 65 year old wife.  They have two adult children.  One of them is studying at the University, and the other one managed to get a career, thanks to his parents’ daily efforts.

Mario has been a merchant for many years.  This business activity has given him the income to get his family ahead.  He has a small hardware business where he sells tools and basic supplies.  He is a man who is full of energy who does not give up.  He keeps working together with his beloved wife in order to manage to improve their living conditions.

Thank God that he has managed to give his two children an education.  That is what motivates him to move forward.  Mario has a lot of customers.  Thanks to his charisma he has managed to win his neighbors’ confidence.  He dreams of expanding his business and having more tool options for his customers.  He also dreams of increasing sales in order to get more income and being able to give his wife a more comfortable life.

This has driven him to request this loan from INTEGRAL.  He will use the loan to buy a variety of hand tools, gardening tools, electrical supplies, and paint, etc.  That way he hopes to achieve his dream that he so desires.

loans.use: to buy a variety of hand tools, gardening tools, electrical supplies, and paint, etc.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en: Carlito, 54 years old, is married and blessed with 4 children. He is engaged in food vending business and his primary activity is butcher shop. He sells pork meats in his village. He is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase hogs to sell as meat. His net income is 6,000 PHP a month. He would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of his business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to sell as meat

loans.name: Joselo

texts.en:
Joselo owns a well-known health center that provides acupuncture services, massage therapy, nutritional courses and other innovative health services. He graduated from the Swedish Institute School of Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine and has been working in this field since 1998. He decided to open his own business last year and was shocked by how fast it took off. The community he serves has quickly learned of his services and he strives to make acupuncture an affordable healing method for anyone who is interested. 

With this loan from ACCION USA, Joselo will purchase health equipment and make some small decorative upgrades in the office to improve its ambiance.

loans.use: to purchase health equipment and make small decorative upgrades in the office

loans.name: Kibasi Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Eric is a 31 year-old married man with four children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He is the bread winner of the family and his dream is to have enough income-generating projects to eliminate poverty from his home.

His main challenge has been limited funds to meet the increasing demand, and his dream is to have a wholesale shop.  Eric needs the loan to buy  beans, sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: To buy beans, sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is a 35-year-old, married man with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal Uganda. His dream is to buy a plot of land in a trading center and also educate his children up to university.

Steven grows tomatoes on a large scale and has been doing so for 5 years amidst hardships of seasonal changes and product price fluctuations. None the less, he longs to clear more land and plant more tomatoes since the venture has proven to be worthwhile. Steven needs the loan to clear land for tomato growing.

loans.use: to clear land for tomato growing

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Imelda has a retail shop that sells fruits (like avocados) and vegetables (like squash). She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

Imelda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Imeld hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Fazila

texts.ru:
Фазила трудолюбивая, умная и добросовестная девушка. Она занимается откармливанием скота дома вместе с братом. Когда её брат ездит за покупками скота, в это время она ухаживает и откармливает скота. Она откармливает их в течение 20 дней, а потом продает на выгодную цену на базар. Фазила хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль для того, чтобы улучшить свое жилищное условие. Она запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота. Она заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за поддержку и поощрение.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Fazila is a hard-working, smart and conscientious young woman.  Together with her brother, she is involved in fattening up livestock.  She looks after and feeds livestock, when her brother leaves to buy livestock.  She fattens up livestock for 20 days and then sells it at a profitable price at the market.  Fazila wants to expand her business and maximize her profit in order to improve her living conditions.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of livestock.  She thanks all creditors in advance for the support and help.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is 46 years old, married and the father of five children. Since 1980, he has made a living by owning and running a store where he soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has 31 years of experience in this field and a deep understanding of the needs of his customers. His store is in a very good area with lots of customers passing by. 

It is common at all levels of this society for people to have multiple businesses, which is why Abbass also does body work on cars. He enjoys this business and hopes to improve and expand it as much as he can by opening a suitable garage and buying all the necessary equipment. Until he can afford the capital he needs to do this, Abbass has decided to apply for a loan to buy a new van to work on that he can use as a bus to generate additional income. He is applying for this loan, his third, from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, after repaying his first two loans completely and on time and thereby becoming a borrower in very good standing.

Abbass is aiming to earn more profits so that he can provide a better life to his family and and open a repair garage.

loans.use: To buy a small van to work on and use as a bus.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La señora Dionicia  vive en una localidad en la  que las personas  trabajan con el bordado de mantas, ella  vive en unión libre con el señor  Manuel y con quien  procreo sietes hijos de los cuales ya todos están casados.

       Ella se dedica a  la compra y venta de mantas como son blusas y camisas, así es como ellos trabajan desde hace treinta años y cuatro meses y le va bien ya que ha tenido un gran rendimiento  en su negocio.

     Ella se inspiro en esta actividad ya que sus papas también se dedicaban a lo mismo y de la edad de veinte años comenzó a practicarlo formalmente y cuando se caso siguió practicando hasta la fecha ya que es con lo que ha sacado adelante a su familia.

     Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda seguir trabajando hasta que dios le preste vida y así también la sigan poyando  con el préstamo.
texts.en:
Dionicia lives in a community whose residents embroider fabric.  She lives in a common law relationship with Manuel and has seven children with him; all are now married.

She sells embroidered blouses and shirts.  They’ve been working this way for thirty years and four months.  She does well since the business has produced good results.

She was inspired into this activity because her parents also did this and she started at the age of 20 for formally do it.  When she got married she continued doing it up to the present; this is how she’s supported her family.

What she most desires with this small activity is to be able to continue to work while God gives her life and also that she will continue to be supported with the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric and embroidery thread.

loans.name: Gulomchon

texts.ru: Гуломчон  Миникулов умный, целеустремленный человек. 6 лет он занимается  автоперевозкой. Он  примерный семьянин, женат, у него 4 детей. Гуломчон  перевозит товары с одного региона на другой. Эта деятельность приносит  хорошую прибыль семейному бюджету. Гуломчон хочет получить займ на сумму 3000$ США для приобретения запчастей машины, эта покупка поможет в получении большей прибыли и принесет пользу населению для качественной перевозки товаров. Гуломчон надеется на вашу поддержку и заранее благодарит вас.
texts.en: Gulomchon is a smart and goal-oriented person.  He has been involved in auto transportation for six years.  He is an exemplary family man, married and has four children.  Gulomchon transports goods from one region to another.  This business yields a good profit for the family budget.  Gulomchon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of spare auto parts.  This purchase would help with making a big profit and would be useful for residents when it comes to quality goods transportation.  Gulomchon hopes that you will support him and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Jamshid

texts.ru: Джамшед холост. Занимается услугами такси на протяжении семи лет. Этот вид бизнеса очень востребован, услуги такси требует тщательного ухода за автомашиной. Постоянная замена автозапчастей, замена масла, проведение техосмотра автомашин требует больших средств. Ведь таксист отвечает за жизнь своего пассажира. Наступает зима и следует заменить старые покрышки на новые, так как зимой дороги скользкие и постоянный гололед. Он хочет приобрести новые покрышки для автомашины, гарантировав этим жизнь и комфорт своих клиентов. Он надеется получить займ и продолжить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Jamshid is single.  He is involved in providing taxi services for seven years.  This type of business is in high demand, and taxi services require diligent car care.  Constant replacement of auto parts, oil changes, going through auto inspections require significant funds because a taxi driver is responsible for the life of his passengers.  The winter is approaching, and Jamshid needs to replace old tires with the new ones because roads are slippery and frozen in the winter.  He wants to buy new tires for his car, guaranteeing life and comfort for his passengers.  He hopes to get this loan and continue his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his car

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, tiene más de 28 años en este negocio. Aprendió esta actividad con la ayuda de su esposo y además con ciertos ahorros que Alicia realizaba, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues le han sido de gran ayuda y además le brindan lo necesario con su negocio. El motivo del crédito lo utilizara para la compra pastillas, vitaminas, suplementos, inyecciones, entre otros.
texts.en: Alicia has worked selling natural medicines for more than 28 years.  She learned this business with the help of her husband and then she used some of her savings to start.   Alicia has received previous loans and the money has been a big help for her business.   This loan will be used to purchase vitamins, supplements, ointments and other natural medicines.

loans.use: supplements, vitamins and other natural medicines.

loans.name: Francis Erick

texts.en:
Francis Erick is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 
Francis Erick provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has run this business for five years. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy tools and to pay for maintenance.
Francis Erick has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans et elle mère de 6 enfants et  2 autres enfants sont à sa charge.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 06/03/2009.
Fatou fait parti du groupe de solidarité Takku liguey .
Elle vient de bénéficier  d'un prêt de 200000 francs cfa et avec ce prêt elle va acheter de la marchandise tels que le mil le maïs des chaussures prêt fabriqués et parfums destinés à la revente.
Avec les bénéfices qu'elle va réaliser elle compte aider son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire et sanitaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatou is married, 40 years old, a mother to six children and takes care of two other children.
She has been a member of Banc Villageois since March 6, 2009.
Fatou is a member of the solidarity group, Takku liguey.
She has just received a loan of 200,000 cfa francs. She is going to purchase merchandise for resale such as, millet, corn, ready-made shoes and perfumes.
With her profits, she intends to help her husband with the household expenses such as their children's schooling and health needs.

loans.use: to purchase millet, shoes, and chickens for resale.

loans.name: Kimuga W.g Group

texts.en:
Angeline is the facilitator of the Kimuga W. group. Angeline and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Angeline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Angeline joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Angeline had a good maize yield, harvesting 13 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Angeline was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Angeline will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kimuga W. group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Angeline with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, blusas, polos y chompas, ella vende en las ferias que se realiza en el distrito de Urubamba y también vende comida en el mercado de Urubamba, el sueño de la socia es poder tener un puesto donde pueda vender la ropa y también vender la comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas al por mayor y también comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, verduras y carne al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank, “Sayhua 3.” The bank is located in the Urubamba district, of the Urubamba province and Cusco department. 

The member is Ms. Luz Marina. She is 26 and has a partner and has two children. She alternates her daily activities, one being a business of buying and selling clothing. She sells pants, blouses, polos, and sweaters. She sells in the fairs that take place in the Urubamba district. She also sells food in the Urubamba market. Her dream is to be able to have a stall where she can sell her clothes and also sell food. She requests the loan to purchase wholesale pants, sweaters, polos, and blouses, and also to purchase wholesale ingredients to cook such as chicken, vegetables, meat. 

She is happy to receive the loan and commits to carrying out the payments of the loan.

loans.use: purchase wholesale pants, sweaters, polos, and blouses, as well as wholesale ingredients to cook such as chicken, vegetables, meat.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past year, Teddy has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy braids for the hair, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and take care of her parents. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a tailoring business. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Teddy's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save her money.

loans.use: to buy braids for the hair.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Vivian buys green and ripe bananas and then peddles them. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of bananas to sell.

Vivian is a new member of HSPFI. In the future,Vivian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ann Maa Thakurani Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2013, Ann Maa Thakurani SHG was formed with 13 women from a small village in Nayagarh district, Odisha. Laxmipriya was selected as the leader of the group. The lady standing with her hand raised in the photograph is Laxmipriya. With the initiative of Laxmipriya, they are doing monthly savings and solving their problems among the group. They are also taking part in the village decision-making meeting. 

Laxmipriya is a 26-year-old lady living with her one daughter, one son and her husband. Her husband is involved in agriculture activities. He has seven years of experience in this activity. Because of the increasing price of fertilizers and pesticides, they are unable to use fertilizers and pesticides as required and they are not able to pay the labour charges. So, Laxmipriya has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the labor charges. Laxmipriya says that this loan can help her to increase her family income and she can provide study materials that her children need.

Laxmipriya wants to say "Thank You" on behalf of her group to Kiva and its lenders for this kind support they are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor charges.

loans.name: Juliantina

texts.en:
Juliantina is a 46-year-old lady who runs a school. She has been in this business for three years, and currently, she offers baby, middle and top class levels. Her business is able to generate an income of about 43,000 Kenya shillings.

She is married, and they are blessed with three children, aged 21, 11 and 9 years old.

She has applied for her first loan that she wants to use to add more chairs to her school and be able to cater for many more students.

In the future, she would like to be able to expand the school and be able to offer education to many more children, as that is her passion.

loans.use: To add more chairs to the school

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is 39 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 15 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been doing for the past 7 years. With the loan from kiva, he would like to pay the workers who harvested beans. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and buy cows for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested beans.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, 60, is married and has three dependent children, one of whom is studying in a university. She lives in Kampong Thom province, where she has been growing rice and cashew for main source of income for 42 years. Sometimes, Thy works for others for a fee to supplement income. Her farming business is threatened by pest and drought.
Thy now is requesting a loan from VisionFund to pay for tuition fees for her son. She hopes that this loan will enable her son to study Bachelor of Management and to have good job for his living.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees for her son to study Bachelor of Management.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Suami Dolores

texts.en: Iâ€™ve had my shop for the past seven years. Iâ€™ve managed to administer it and increase my number of clients.  It is my only source of income so I take care of my sales. I am a single mother of two. One of my sons is in school and the other is two years old. I think if I invest more capital in restocking my store Iâ€™ll get more earnings

loans.use: Buying bread, candy, corn flakes, milk, spaghetti, sauce, salt, corn flour, medicines, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients and equipment

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: "I changed to this business ten (10) years ago and I have no cause to regret it. I am 27 years old. My numerous customers always give me satisfaction," says Mrs. Nkechi P. E.. She needs the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drugs and provisions

loans.name: Ibadali

texts.en:
Ibadali has been in this business for 15 years. He was born in 1960 in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He is married and has 3 children. 
He needs a loan of $475 to buy sprays which are used on the trees in his orchard.

loans.use: To buy  sprays to use on the trees in his orchard

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: "LAPO has been a source of joy to my business," says Mrs. Mercy E., who is married with 2 children, and 45 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, and is secretary of her union in LAPO.  She has 6 years experience in her business. She sells planks and wishes to expand her business with the above loan

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Rosa Abad

texts.en: This 51-year-old woman, mother of seven children, is a very hard-working and positive person. Rosa lives in Don Juan, a pretty remote community of Yamasá. Her husband works for a little company that makes blocks. She owns a colmadito, a very small grocery store. She sells basic goods like rice, vegetable oil, floor, spaghetti, juice, bread and so forth. She started her business two years ago in order to deal with the family's financial issues. She also sells charcoal (obtained by heating wood), since in her community not all the people have sufficient means to use gas. Women in Don Juan use the charcoal to soften up peas, because peas take a long time to be well-cooked and that consumes a lot of gas. The entrepreneur requests a loan to wholesale purchase the goods she usually sells in her business, as she is short of supply. Given this loan, she'll be able to help her husband support the family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase goods like rice, floor, spaghetti, juice, vegetable oil, etc. to increase inventory.

loans.name: Tuli

texts.en: Tuli is 23 years old and single. She lives with her parents and through the years they have worked hard weeding and clearing an area so it would be suitable to cultivate crops. She heard of SPBD through other women of the village, and she decided to join. This is Tuli's first loan and she will spend it buying weed-killing chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and other gardening supplies. With the help of her brothers, she will make good use of their new tools so as to work faster and more efficiently.

loans.use: To buy supplies and tools for her farm

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina N. is a tailor who also is in the business of photocopies. She wants a loan to finish her building. She has 3 children.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to finish her building

loans.name: Sharafat

texts.en: Sharafat is a 43-year-old local resident in the town of Saatli. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. She breeds cattle together with her husband. They have been engaged in this business for 20 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other diary products. Cattle breeding is traditional in this region, where there are no other jobs. Sharafat wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $600.

loans.use: To increase her number of cattle

loans.name: Anthonia's Tujittume Group

texts.en:
Ester E. is 30 years old, married, with three children, ages 4 to 11. She and her husband also take care of four other children. In 1999, Ester began selling soft drinks, and she works from 8am to 6pm at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rice at wholesale price.

loans.name: Manuel Leoncio

texts.es:
Mr. Manuel P. is a 50 year old man who is a driver by profession. He has a 18 year old son. He is single and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Sur. While he works his son takes charge of caring for the house.

He needs the loan in order to replace the roof of his house due to the coming winter and doesn't want to have problems from water leaks in the house. Don Manuel's dream is to have a respectable house to be able to eave to his son who is currently a student.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

Don Manuel P. es un señor de 50 años de edad cuya profesión es Conductor. Tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad, es soltero y habita en el barrio Laureles Sur. Mientras él se encuentra trabajando es su hijo quien se encarga de cuidar la casa por el día.

Necesita el préstamo para cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación, debido a la llegada del invierno y no quiere tener problemas por filtro de agua en su casa de habitación. El sueño de don Manuel es llegar a tener una casa digna para poder dejarla a su hijo quien actualmente se encuentra estudiando.

loans.use: To replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is a sixty five year old widow and mother of five children. Since she became a single parent, she has been very supportive of her children. She has sold used clothing at a local market for the past fifteen years. From her business, she has been able to pay for two children to complete teacher training school.

She has insufficient capital to buy larger quantities of used clothing to sell. With this loan, she would buy more bales of used clothing to increase her stock and the variety of clothing. She hopes to raise enough income to pay for two children to finish senior school this year.

She belongs to the community called Nso Nyame ye ("It is possible with God") Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing to increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Ty P., 41, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her five children. She goes to the market to sell Khmer cake and daily makes around $1.50. Her husband is a farmer who also makes around $1.50 each day, and the family is also supported by three of the children who work in the garment factories. The rise of rice prices in Cambodia has made business difficult for Ty P. and she is asking for a loan of $800. With the loan monies, she would like to purchase a horse and a horse cart to run her business after she is done helping with the farming. She sees the possibility for expanding her business with the addition of a horse and cart and believes that these tools can increase her income. An income increase would be a great benefit to Ty P. and her family, allowing her family to meet its needs and to raise its standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a horse and horse cart

loans.name: Sort

texts.en:
Mrs. Sort S. sells sweets and fruits in her village market in the Tramses Village of Pursat Province. She is a widow, and she lives with her one daughter. In fact, her daughter (pictured) helps her to sell her goods.

Due to an increase in demand for her goods, she is now requesting a loan in the amount of $150 to purchase more ingredients (so that she can make sweets to sell) and fruits. In this way, the loan proceeds will enable her to sell more goods and to thereby increase her income.

loans.use: To meet the increase in demand for her goods by purchasing more fruits and other ingredients in order to make sweets to sell

loans.name: Mohammad Haleem

texts.en:
Mohammad Haleem is 50 years old. He is married and has 5 children. He has a construction supplies shop that he has been involved in for more than 20 years. He has already 28000 Afghani invested in his shop and also one of his sons is working with Haleem. His shop is located in a good area in Kabul and he has a good number of customers, but he wants to import more supplies from Pakistan.

Therefore, he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani with a term of 18 months to import more supplies and bolster his business. He would like to enlarge his shop and make a good monthly income to support his family.

Haleem is very happy with this loan. He hopes to work hard and marry off his son. It is one of his best wishes in his life to see his son married. He would like to thank AFSG and Kiva who make this opportunity to help human for human possible.

loans.use: To import more supplies

loans.name: Las Pampitas Group

texts.en:
The Las Pampitas group is maD. up of eleven women and two men who know each other from their neighborhood, in the tropical Santa Cruz D. la Sierra region of eastern Bolivia. The group members are involved in a variety of different businesses: Martha does laundry, Cielo and Angel sell drinks, Nancy owns a pig farm, Yonny and Maria del Carmen sell prepared meals, Maria Ruby sells dulce D. leche, Sonia sells sandals, Leonela does embroidery, Susana owns a bakery, Maria Eugenia sells hamburgers, and Claudia sells Yambal cosmetic products. The women have various levels of experience working in their respective areas, anywhere from two to twenty-four years.

Most of the group members plan to use the loan to buy more merchandise to sell or materials/ingredients to make their respective products. Most of them have previous experience with group loans at other financial institutions.

loans.use: Buy bulk merchandise to resell

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
This is group that consists of three members; Ren is the group leader. Mrs. Ren L. is 28 years old. She sells vegetables in front of her home in Sretkeut village. Her customers are her neighbors. She is married to Mr. Sor Lam, 37, who is a construction worker. Sor always leaves home in the morning and returns in the afternoon. He can earn about US$5.00 per day from his business. Ren, however, is facing difficulties in transporting her vegetables; consequently, she decided to ask for US$150 to purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

Mrs. Raiy L. is 29 years old and is also a vegetable seller. She decided to ask for US$150 to buy a secondhand motorcycle, which she will use for vegetable transportation.

Mrs. Lok L., 28, sells vegetables in the market. She wants to increasing her income; consequently, she is requesting a loan of US$150, with which she will purchase more vegetables for resale. They all live in Kantang Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: Purchasing a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa N. received a high school education. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband sells yams.

Yaa has been selling clothing and fabrics since 2002, and she also has a grocery store at Praso market in Elmina, Ghana. She is responsible for paying utility bills and other expenses. She will use her loan to buy more fabrics and clothing to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Buy more fabrics and clothing to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos, actualmente está viviendo en la casa de su suegra. Desde que se comprometió estaba sólo al cuidado de sus hijos, pero hace como 10 meses le ofrecieron traspasar la tienda su cuñada, desde entonces está ligada al mundo del comercio de abarrotes y verduras en general, no se arrepiente al haber tomado esa decisión, y ya está adquiriendo clientela para su negocio. Su esposo trabaja haciendo servicio de transporte en motocarro y le ayuda en los momentos cuando ella tiene que ir al mercado y comprar los productos para su bodega, por esa parte no tiene dificultad, tiene anhelos de luchar muy duro para la rentabilidad de su negocio. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y es puntual en sus pagos. Con la cantidad solicitada incrementará la mercadería de su bodega.
texts.en:
Isabel is 29 years old and lives with her husband with whom she has two children. They currently live in her in-law's house. When she got engaged, she was only in charge of taking care of the children, but about 10 months ago, her in-laws offered her the chance to work in her sister-in-law's small store. Since then, she has been tied to the world of sales, helping to sell groceries and vegetables, and she doesn't regret the decision for a second, as she continues to increase her customer base. Her husband makes a living running a transportation service and helps her when she needs to go to the market to buy products for the store. She is anxious to fight hard for the profitability of her business. This is her 5th loan from Prisma Microfinance and she has always made her payments on time. With this money, she will increase the amount of merchandise available in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of merchandise in her store

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 25 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos en edad escolar, y vive con su conviviente que es mecánico y la apoya  mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de chorizos en un puesto del mercado, desde hace un año atrás, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una magnifica atención a sus clientes para que regresen a comprarle y la recomienden, además, le es rentable porque se encuentra en un punto estratégico del mercado por donde pasa mucha gente y casi no tiene competencia del mismo producto, estas ganancias permiten que poco a poco mejore su nivel económico. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP. Y utilizará el dinero para la construcción de un kiosco para vender con mayor comodidad sus chorizos.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 25-year-old mother of two school-aged children living with her partner who is a mechanic and very supportive. For the past year she has worked selling chorizos (sausages) at a market. She enjoys providing excellent customer service so her clients will return as well as recommend her to others. The business is profitable as she is strategically located within the market with a lot of foot traffic and few competitors of the same product. The profits have allowed her to slowly improve her economic status. This is the first time she has applied for an MFP loan. She will use the money to build a kiosk to better sell her chorizos.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Turakul

texts.en:
Turakul D. is 47 years old. He learned his profession of farming from his father when he was young. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more. In addition, he also buys and sells cattle to raise more profit.

With his previous loans, he purchased two more cattle. He sold them already and purchased two calves which he is rearing to sell. Today he wants to expand his business and buy more cattle and fertilizer for his land. He is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni which he promising to repay within 8 months. From the profit of his business Turakul wants educate his children at the university. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Luy

texts.en:
S. is 38 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She earns a living by raising pigs in a stall next to her house. She raises two lots of pigs per year and sells them to the slaughterer every six months, and is earning an average of US$ 3 a day.

S. is married with two sons, who are still under her care. Her husband, Diem, age 48, is a local rice farmer. S. hopes to run a new suitable business; thus, she is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike that will be used to transport fish to sell at the market.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport fish

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Hường năm nay 45 tuổi, gia đình chị có 2 con trong đó có 1 con đang tuổi đến trường. Chị Hường tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Hiện nay công việc đem alị nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi, kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá và tiền công làm xe ôm của chồng với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Hường mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm các mặt hàng bia, bánh kẹo... về bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị Hường, 45 years old, has two children, one of whom is still in school. Mrs. Hường has participated in the TYM Fund since 1999. Currently, the main sources of income for her family are raising animals and selling groceries, along with the money her husband earns as a motorbike taxi driver. Their total income each month is about 3,000,000 VND (175 USD). In the next round of lending, Mrs. Hường hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND (875 USD) to buy inventory for their grocery shop such as beer, candy, etc.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery shop

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen S. is a 66-year-old widow with six children and resides in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She sells fruit and typically earns US$3 profit per day. She is also supported by three children working in construction. Pen S. would like to take out a loan of US$1200 to reinvest in her fruit stand.

loans.use: To purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Nancy Lucila

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Nancy es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Nancy tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones.
Los sueños de Nancy es tener una tienda de ropa y que sus hijos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Alborada community bank. Nancy, 24, is in a common law marriage and has a son. Nancy has a stall at the 12 de Mayo market. She sells clothes every day. She gets the clothes in Lima. Nancy needs a loan of 1,500 PEN to buy pants. Nancy’s dreams are to have a clothing store and for her children to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope O. is twenty-seven years old and single with no children. He has a store where he rents out chairs, and he also has a studio where he takes photographs. He hopes for a loan to purchase more chairs. He offers his thanks.

loans.use: To  purchase more chairs

loans.name: Ambrosio Irineo

texts.es:
El joven padre de familia señor Ambrosio vive con su esposa  y tres hijos de edad pequeña, el labora para una empresa desde hace tres años como supervisor de línea, obteniendo un muy buen ingreso, su esposa la señora Juanita es enfermera de una maquiladora contando con una antigüedad de 2 años. 
Ellos han ido realizando un proyecto que tienen, el cual es ampliar su vivienda mediante la construcción de un cuarto para mayor comodidad de la familia, pero les esta haciendo falta los acabados exteriores e interiores del cuarto en construcción. Motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Ambrosio, a young father, lives with his wife and three small children. He has worked for a company as a line supervisor for three years. He gets a very good income. His wife, Juanita, is a nurse in a factory. She has been doing this for two years. They are working on a project to expand their house by building a room to make the family more comfortable. However, they are lacking the exterior and interior finishings for the room under construction. That is why they are asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior and exterior finishings

loans.name: Rabia Yasmeen Zafar Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Lubna baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle named “Shahzore”.

Rubina baji and Gulshan baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Rubi baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Nargis baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

Rabia yasmeen baji, wife of Z. I., has lived in a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the last eight years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods.

Rabia baji is a very hardworking lady. She operates a business selling cosmetics and perfumes which she buys from the famous market of Lahore “Shahalmi” and sells to the cosmetics shops. She does this work to earn a good income to manage the financial expenses. She is applying for a loan to grow her business by buying more cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila C. is from the village of Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. She is 44 years old. Petronila is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Petronila owns & operates a weaving business. She sells of nipa (palm ‘grass’) to local community members. Petronila has been engaged in her business for several years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Petronila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Petronila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to be used to purchase other materials needed for the weaving business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Petronila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials.

loans.name: Hul

texts.en: 75% of Cambodian people have been involved farming businesses. Hul S. is the one of these people. She has been farming since she was single. At 30 years of age, she is a good mother of three children. All three of the children are teenagers in school. She is married to Chin Chen, age 32, who works driving a taxi. Hul S. will be using this loan to purchase 0.50 hectares of farmland and she will plant different kinds of crops. This loan will provide her with a new asset.

loans.use: To purchase 0.50 hectaresw of farmland.

loans.name: La Buena Fe Group 11

texts.en:
Edita O. F. is 20 years old and has just recently opened her own business selling new women's and children's clothing. When Edita first began selling clothing eight months ago, she found it difficult to obtain capital to invest in her business. And so, two weeks ago, she opted to take out her first loan from Kiva and Esperanza International.

With this new access to capital and credit, Edita will finally be able to buy larger quantities of merchandise, including women's tops, blouses, and pants and children's clothing. With her new loan, Edita hopes to begin selling women's shoes and sandals as well.

Once her loan is fully funded, Edita will travel several hours by bus (called a guagua) to the larger city of Higuey on the eastern coast to buy her merchandise. She will then sell her wares to her neighbors in the Villa Guerrero neighborhood of El Seybo, which lies in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic.

Revenues from Edita's clothing business will help supplement what her husband earns working for a local construction company, and will also support the family's two children: a 4-year-old son and a 3-month-old daughter.

As of now, the family lives in relatively difficult circumstances: they have no electricity in the home, and the 3-month-old girl currently has an untreated skin infection over much of her body. Furthermore, the family, like the majority of their neighbors in Villa Guerrero, is of Haitian descent, which means it is generally more difficult for them to secure economic and political rights as compared to Dominican citizens.

With these challenges in mind, Edita recognizes the importance of her clothing business to her family's well-being. She has hopes to keep selling more clothing in the future so that her children may eventually attend school and have better lives.

Here, Edita is pictured with her fellow borrowers in La Buena Fe (The Good Faith) Bank of Hope, Group 11. She appears second from the left, along with her daughter. Thank you for supporting the members of La Buena Fe!

loans.use: To buy more new women's and children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 39 years old and is married with three children.  She dedicates herself to selling juices and breakfast sandwiches from her home in the mornings.  Wilma also creates decorated skirts for sale.  Her husband works as an official in the government of Iparia, a town along the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.  
 
Wilma has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Mariscalas.”  She used her very first loan of 200 soles (about $65) to purchase fabric for the skirts that she makes.  Wilma will invest this loan of 1500 soles in purchasing groceries for a shop that she plans to set up in the small community of Curiaca.  Curiaca is also located on the banks of the Ucayali River.
 
Wilma’s two years working with Manuela Ramos and “Las Mariscalas” have enabled her to share her business experiences with other members of her communal bank.  Wilma and the other borrowers communicate well with each other and feel a sense of solidarity as members of “Las Mariscalas.”

loans.use: Products to stock a new grocery shop.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Born in Palestine in 1979, Husam owns a computer store. He sells computer software and does computer maintenance and repairs. Husam is an experienced businessman whose customers are his friends and neighbors. 

Husam needs a loan of $1200 in order to buy an extensive variety of computer supplies that will help him to perform his work better so as to satisfy his clients.

loans.use: To buy computer supplies

loans.name: Borin

texts.en:
Mr. Borin P., 37, and his wife, Mrs. It Oem, 32, have been married since 2000. They have three children, one son and two daughters, all of whom are still young. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Borin has been farming for 10 years, while his wife has been selling fish for 10 years.  The house where the family lives is old and is in need of repair. Therefore, Borin is requesting his first loan of $500 to purchase wooden materials to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase wooden materials to renovate his house.

loans.name: Carlosa

texts.en:
Carlosa L. is a mother of 3 children. She has a barbeque business in Danao, Panglao. She wishes to make her business grow and overcome the crisis in life. She started this kind of business in 2008.

In 2007, she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because of the good program it has. She’s now requesting a loan of Php 6,000 to help finance her business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina L. is from the village of Purok 3 San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Gina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business selling daily use products such as shampoos, detergent soaps & toothpastes in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en: Lesina F. (0) is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu Tualesolo. She is married and has five school-aged children. Lesina owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 400 WST a month. In 2009, Lesina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie C. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Rosalie is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a clothing business and she has a side business as a hog trader. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Rosalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her weekly loan payments and to provide for the needs of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a Palestinian man living in Tulkarem City. Currently he just lives with his wife, as all his children are married and have their own houses. Mohammad is working as a Muezzen/servant for the mosque (in Islam there are five prayers at various times during the day, from dawn until sunset, so there is a Muezzen who calls for the prayers each time using a loudspeaker so everyone can hear him and do their prayers). This is a government job through the Ministry of Awqaf (Islamic Religion). Mohammad's job is the only source of income for him. He requested $2,000 from FATEN to do some renovation to his house, as it is an old building and needs renovation, especially now that winter has started. Mohammad appears in the picture at the FATEN office. Mohammad is wearing one of the Palestinian traditional head covers.

loans.use: Renovations for his house

loans.name: Ego

texts.en:
Ego, age 51, is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She runs a grocery store business in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria, where she lives. In her store, she sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers, and she would like to eventually open a supermarket. Ego is married and has six children.

Ego is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Afras

texts.en: Afras A. has a great passion for breeding sheep and has been in this business for thirteen years. He is 36 years old and married, with two children. Afras would like to expand his business by adding more sheep to his herd. This is because he recently acquired out-of-town orders to supply mutton. Afras is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN in order to buy twelve sheep and fodder. With additional income, Afras will be better able to meet his family's financial needs and especially to provide for the education of his children.

loans.use: Purchase additional sheep and fodder

loans.name: Test

texts.en: test

loans.use: test

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 27 years old and married with two school-aged children. He is a farmer near Kisii in south-western Kenya. James has been farming for four years and sells milk, cabbage and tomatoes at the local market and from the farm. He says that the main challenge to his business is low local pricing for his goods.
James has requested a loan through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, for 70,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this will help him produce enough milk to sell. He believes that he will also then be able to offer employment to others. In the future, he would like to own a pick-up truck in order to transport his products to market.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita C. is from the village of  Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 65 years old. Pepita is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Pepita runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Pepita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities. (Pepita remains in the 5,000 PHP category for her 5th cycle loan.)

In 2005, Pepita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pepita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Pepita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, 48, a resident from Agusan del Sur, is a rice farmer. She manages a rice field which is her main source of living. She has six children to support, the eldest being 28 years old.

Francisca lacks capital and that's why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requested a loan of 14,000 Php. This loan will help her a lot in providing fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, 32, has a business selling a variety of food in her neighborhood. She also has a fishing business. She has four children in her family and she hopes they will graduate from their studies someday.

Regina is now on her seventh loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., with a loan request of 10,000 PHP. This loan will help improve her fishing business and provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: For food ingredients and fishing

loans.name: Raeva Aytbu`s Group

texts.ru:
Айтбу, 48 лет, она замужем и мать 4 детей. Все дети взрослые. С ней вместе проживает ее сын со своей супругой. Супруг  и сын работают строителями, невестка занимается животноводством и реализацией молочной продукции.Клиент откармливает двух доенных коров и двух телок, также реализует молочные продукции. Планирует уехать на пастбище где пасут живность населения. Бизнес был начат с 3-х МРС, клиентка была заинтересована в разведении КРС. Клиент на кредит планирует закупить еще одну доенную корову и увеличить обьем реализации молочной продукции. 

Шарбатхан, 46, вдова. У нее трое детей. Старшая дочь замужем, остальные дети учатся в школе. Клиент в данное время подгатавливает землю для посева хлопчатника. Кредит необходим для закупа семян хлопчатника и минеральные удобрение для орашения.

Гулзаде 28 лет. Ее супруг работает строителем и помогает в бизнесе при запасе корма для живности. Клиент также работает в школе учительницей начальных классов. Кредит юудет использован для закупа доенной коровы для откорма и увеличения поголовья КРС.

Мира, 33, она откармливает доенную корову и телку, также занимается  занимается реализацией молочной продукции. Ее супруг строитель. Старшие дети идут в школу, за младшим сыном присматривает дочь дома. Бизнес был начат с откорма и разведения 3-х КРС, далее заинтересовалась в разведении КРС. Она хочет купить еще одного теленка для разведения и увеличить обьем реализации молочных продукций.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Aytbu is 48 years old. She is married and a mother of 4 children. All of her children are grown. Her son and daughter-in law live with her. Aytbu’s husband and son are construction workers, and daughter-in-law is involved in animal husbandry and sales of dairy products. Aytbu is currently fattening up two dairy cows and two heifers.
