She also sells dairy products. She plans to travel to a pasture where locals take their livestock. Aytbu started the business with 3 small livestock, and the client was interested in breeding cattle. The client plans to use this loan to buy one more dairy cow and increase the volume of dairy products sales. Sharbathan is 46 years old. She is a widow and has three children. The oldest daughter is married, and the other children go to school. Currently, the client is getting the soil ready for sowing of cotton. The loan is needed for the purchase of cotton seeds and mineral fertilizers. Gulzada is 28 years old. Her husband is a construction worker and also helps with the business by stocking livestock feed. The client also works as an elementary grades teacher at a school. The loan will be used for the purchase of a dairy cow for fattening and increasing cattle headcount. Mira is 33 years old. She is fattening up a dairy cow and a heifer and is also involved in selling dairy products. Her husband is a construction worker. The oldest children go to school, and Mira’s daughter looks after the youngest child at home. The business was started with fattening and breeding of 3 cows, and Mira became more interested in breeding cattle. She wants to buy one more calf for breeding and increase the volume of sales of dairy products.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one dairy cow

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo is 39 years old, married with 3 children. Her eldest child is 10 years old while the youngest child is 3 years old. Her children attend school and this gives her joy as a mother. She sells frozen foods like chicken and turkey to earn a living. She is requesting for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania, de  42 años, es una madre de familia muy laboriosa, que vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores.El negocio al que se dedica Tania, es la venta de ropa usada, en un mercado informal que esta ubicado  a media hora de su casa. Tiene varios clientes que saben y conocen el tipo de prendas que vende y no dudan en comprarle, además  una vez por semana viaja a provincia, donde también comercializa. Lo que más le gusta de la venta de ropa usada, es que obtiene el doble de ganancias,  y a sus asiduos clientes les deja las prendas a un menor costo. Es así que lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad, lo que no le agrada mucho es viajar pues debe dejar solos a sus hijos, pero las  rentas que gana en provincia son más alentadores , que en la ciudad.  En adelante tiene planeado instalar un  puesto fijo de venta de ropa, en algún mercado de la ciudad.Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas, pues desea obtener nuevos créditos. Es una socia muy responsable y comprometida por  la organización de su grupo.El dinero solicitado lo invertirá  en el incremento de su negocio, ya que desea  abastecerse de  variedad de prendas usadas para ofrecer  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
42-year-old Tania is a hard working mother who lives with her husband and two children in their own house. She has a second hand clothes business, in a street market about 30 minutes from her house. She has several clients that know her products and don't hesitate in buying from her, and in the top of that she also travels to the city once a week where she sells to stores. What she likes more about the used clothes business is that she gets twice the products for the price, and she's able to sell clothes cheaper to her loyal clients. She's been doing this for the past 8 years, and the only thing she's not too happy about is the traveling because she doesn't like to leave her children, but the money she makes in the city is better than in her hometown. She plans on opening her own clothing store in the city. This is the 6th loan Tania has had with MFP, and she promises to pay it back with the same punctuality as always, so she can apply for more loans. She's a very responsible client and committed to the organization of her group. The money asked will be translated into more clothes and the improvement of her business, as she wants to have more options and quantity of clothes to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Used Clothing for Reselling

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestro socio vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él Sr. Jose; él socio tiene 50 años de edad, el socio es padre separado tiene 3 hijos y el trabaja en la quinta Carmelo, el socio es mozo, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para poder pagar las mensualidades de los estudios superiores de sus hijos.

El  socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose is a member of the Communal Bank “Perolniyoc”. He lives in Urubamba Province, which is part of the Department of Cusco.

Sr. Jose is 50 years old, separated from his spouse, and the father of three children. He works at the Carmelo Estate and is currently single. Jose is requesting a loan to pay the monthly tuition for his children.

He appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for his children's monthly tuition

loans.name: Rammynel

texts.en:
Rammynel O., 29 years old, is from the village of Consuelo, Magsaysay Misamis Oriental. Rammynel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rammynel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a  retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily used products in the local community. Rammynel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rammynel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rammynel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rammynel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is a single woman who, for the last 16 years, has been selling fresh water and food to her neighbors and passersby from her home. She also sells school uniforms as her other source of income. With the Kshs 40,000 loan she is requesting, Arafa wants to purchase a freezer and start another business selling soft drinks. She faces the major challenges of competition and seasonality. Her main goal is to become a wholesaler in the future.

Arafa decided to join Yehu in order to access loans and expand her business. She owns a house with electricity and piped water, and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional household utensils and plastic products for resale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 54-year-old woman who lives with her brother in Vazquez de Coronado, Costa Rica.

Teresita runs a type of corner store which is attached to her home. She sells various products including books, clothing for children as well as for adults, cleaning products and personal hygiene products. She also has a photocopying machine.

Teresita plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of inventory that she will sell in her store. She says that her lack of access to working capital (i.e. loans from formal lending institutions) has hindered her ability to expand her business, gain more clients and increase revenues.

Teresita organizes her day in the following manner: she wakes up early and cleans the house and store. If a client passes by, she opens up (no earlier than 6 a.m.) and the day begins. She stays open all day until 8 p.m.

Teresita’s main goal is to expand her business, fill her store with a variety of products and increase her revenues. A main obstacle for Teresita is that she lives in a rural area with a small population, which makes clients hard to come by.

loans.use: To purchase inventory such as clothing, cleaners and books

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es:
Blanca de 21 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, ella confecciona ropa desde hace años, su esposo es policía retirado ellos tiene tres hijos. 

Comenzando con una maquina de coser vieja pudo tener suficientes clientes para solventar sus gastos. Poco a poco inicio su negocio comenzando a reunir dinero para comprar varias maquinas de coser industriales. Ahora trabaja todos los días en su casa confeccionando pantalones, vestidos, blusas y las vende para una revista colombiana y un periodico llamado "super exito".

Para continuar con su taller de confección de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y hilos, en el futuro quiere trabajar con D-Parti (compañía de ropa del Ecuador).
texts.en:
Blanca, who is 21 years old, lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil. She has made clothing for several years. Her husband is a retired policeman and they have 3 children. Beginning with only an old sewing machine, she was able to retain enough clients to cover her costs. Little by little, she expanded her business, saving money to buy various industrial sewing machines. Now Blanca works every day in her home, making pants, dresses, and blouses. She sells them through a Colombian magazine and a periodical called “Super Exito” (Super Success). To continue with her clothes-making workshop, Blanca needs a loan to buy cloth and thread. In the future, she wants to work with D-Parti (an Ecuadorian clothing company).

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CLOTH, THREAD, AND FASTENERS FOR HER CLOTHING WORKSHOP

loans.name: Pacifico

texts.en:
With his rice farming business and Tilapia (St. Peter fish) production, life has been good to Pacifico G.'s family. He is 54 years-old, married and has four children aged 22, 20, 19 and 17 years.  

However, in order to maximize his business profits, he wants to expand his business. To meet the needed capital requirement for his planned expansion, he has applied for a loan to buy farm materials and Tilapia feed. The additional income generated will be used for his children’s schooling and other possible business opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase farm materials and Tilapia feed.

loans.name: Nyakaina Central. Rukungiri Group

texts.en: M. Enos, 80 years old, is a member of the Nyakaina Central group. He lives in Nyakaina, Rukungiri.  He is a retired teacher who has operated an agricultural farm for over 50 years. He raises cattle and sells milk as his main sources of livelihood alongside cattle fattening and banana sales. He is a married father of seven children and is hard-working.  He looks forward to improving his standard of living as a model farmer in the area.  M. is seeking a loan to help him purchase more cattle and restock his farm, in order to be able to earn more sales revenue out of his milk sales. With the increased revenue, he will be able to cater to his family's needs and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for his farm

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada y tiene 5 hijos todos mayores de edad; el esposo trabaja como albañil percibiendo un salario muy bajo, por lo tanto ella vende carne de cordero para ayudar en el hogar ya que no reciben ayuda de los hijos.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más carne de cordero, venderla y poder aumentar sus ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro desde al año 2006  y tiene un historial de pagos  bueno,  por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Cecilia lives in her own house in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area of the city of La Paz. She is married and has 5 children, all of them grown. Her husband works as a mason, receiving a very low salary. For this reason, she sells lamb meat to help support the household, because they do not receive help from their children. 

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital, buying more lamb meat to sell, so that she can increase her income. 

She has been a client of Impro since 2006, and she has an excellent payment history, allowing her to have access to a new loan.

loans.use: Buying a larger quantity of lamb meat to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.fr: Kavira D.  est  présidente du groupe Nuru, âgée de 31 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants, son mari est  tailleurs. Tous ses enfants étudient. Juste l’après l’éruption du volcan Nyiragongo, qui aurait complètement détruit la ville de Goma en 2002, elle  commença son business  avec son fond propre par la coupe couture, plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Elle installe son atelier au le marché central de Virunga. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner  de tissus dames, tissus pour confection veste pour hommes. En plus, elle ambitionne déménager  et s’installe vers le centre ville pour plus de visibilité et gagner plus des marchés. La cliente Kavira D. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Nuru est  composé de 15 femmes.
texts.en: Kavira D. is the president of the Nuru group. She is 31 years old, married to a tailor, and has 3 children. All of her children are in school. Immediately after the eruption of the Nyiragongo volcano, which would go on to completely destroy the town of Goma in 2002, she started a business with her own funds making dresses. Later, she received a loan of $50 from the microfinance institution Hekima (one of Kiva's field partners). She has set up her workshop at the central market in Virunga. This new loan should serve to supply her with fabric for women's dresses and fabric to make men's jackets. Furthermore, she aspires to move and install herself near the centre of the town to increase her visibility and make more sales. Kavira D. thanks Hekima for its actions on behalf of the poor who are excluded from mainstream banking. It must be noted that the Nuru group is composed of 15 women.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make women's clothing and men's jackets

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20201070035) is a 56-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn 07 (Nhóm 07).


T. is married and has 4 adult children.  To make a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,700,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future.  

She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by her from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị M. (0) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn K. C. (0) is a 39-year-old male who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support his business in the food sector running a food stall.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20201070035) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trung Bạn nhóm 07 (Nhóm 07).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.700.000 VND.  Vào 2007, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị M. (0) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn K. C. (0) là 39 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: make her business larger

loans.name: Ana Karen

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

Para la señora Ana este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y nos cuenta que le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de cumplir. Tiene 21 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres, estudia el cuarto año en un colegio de la localidad.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de damas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, tiene muchas clientes, trabaja  cuatro horas a la semana en la entrega y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra por quincena. Su mercadería la compra en Portoviejo cada quince días  o al mes de acuerdo a los pedidos que tenga y la urgencia de estos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa  interior ya que tiene algunos  pedidos para esta quincena y quiere cumplir con sus clientes. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la seriedad de sus compañeras del Banco. Le gustaría estudiar y ser una gran doctora.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Increíbles (The Unbelievable Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Ana is in her third cycle with the communal bank.  She tells us that she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  She is 21 years old, single and lives with her parents.  She is in fourth year of high school.

She sells ladies underwear door to door.  She has a lot of customers.  She works four hours a week delivering and collecting payment since she sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo every two weeks or monthly according to how many pending orders she has or on how urgent they are.

This loan is to buy underwear since she has some pending orders for this two week period and she wants to comply with her customers.  This is her third cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because her fellow members are committed.  She’d like to study to become a great physician.

loans.use: To buy underwear.

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 6 Group

texts.en:
Eliana is the coordinator of her group Canal de Bendicion 6 (Channel of Blessing).  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children, taking care of them as a single mom.

Eliana is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling fried food, by buying chicken, beef, flour, oil and plantains. She operates a fried food stand where she cooks dinners for sale. She will use the profits to improve her quality of life by building her house out of concrete block, for more security.

loans.use: To buy chicken, beef, flour, oil and plantains.

loans.name: John Kinyua

texts.en:
John Kinyua K. has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 20 years. He is 47 years old, married to Jacinta Wangari, and they have two children.

John was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer for his farm.

In the future, John hopes to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch V. has been in the farming business for a long time. She lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Since 1990, Touch V. has owned and operated her farm to cultivate rice crops, from which she earns a daily income. 

Touch V. is a widowed mother who has given birth to four children, most of whom are employed in various jobs and share their salary with her for the family’s daily expenses. Because this is the harvest season, Touch V. wishes to buy many sacks of rice to add to her stock. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To buy rice while prices are low for future sale

loans.name: Daniel Mbugua

texts.en: Daniel has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last three years. He is 30 years old, married to Jecinta Muthoni and they have one child. Daniel was introduced to KADET by one of the field staff and this will be his second loan. He repaid his first loan of KES 10,000 well and in good time. Daniel plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor. In the future, Daniel hopes to expand his farming, hence increase his farm production.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Osman Kawusu

texts.en: This is 48 year-old Osman.  He is married and has 4 children, aged 18, 8, 5 and 3. He has 1 additional dependent, who lives with him because he is Osman's younger brother's son.  In 1996, Osman established his enamel bowl and bagged rice business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,486,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Osman requires a loan in order to buy additional enamel and to improve his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 297,200. In the future, Osman plans to help his children with their education.   He thanks you for your support

loans.use: To buy additional enamel and bags of rice

loans.name: Julibel

texts.en: Julibel is a married woman who lives in Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a general store and a food vending business. Her husband Reynaldo, who is 49 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have four children who are between 2 and 17 years old. Julibel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Julibel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 7,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children’s education. Julibel is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Hindra Jesus

texts.es: Cliente tiene 25 años es estudiante y trabaja en la Moto que la compro junto con su primo vive en la casa de sus padres junto con sus hermanos es un muchacho emprendedor y con ganas de superacion es soltero no tiene carga familiar.El credito lo solicita para capital de trabajo invertir en la compra y cambio de puertas para poder seguir trabajando y ayudar a sus padres y terminar de estudiar para tener su propio negocio y salir adelante ya que es una persona joven.
texts.en: He is 25 years old and works and he works with a motorcycle rickshaw which was purchased together with his cousin. He lives with his parents in their house together with his siblings. He is an enterprising young man who is eager for self-improvement.  He doesn't have a family of his own. He requests the loan to use as working capital and to invest in the purchase of new doors. He will continue to keep working and helping his parents. He will also finish his studies to have a business of his own in order to support himself.

loans.use: to purchase new doors for his rickshaw

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married and has one adult child. To make a living, Jessica runs a business venture in the retail sector selling a variety of products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.

Jessica has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. Jessica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Jessica is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory to add to her working capital. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Jessica from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase variety store products, household needs such as soap.

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hipolita; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de helados, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m, ella vende en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la puerta del estadio, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de helados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para comprar los helados.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Las Triunfadoras (Triumphal Women) Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas in Quispicanchis province, department of Cusco.

Sra. Hipolita, age 35, is married and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling ice cream. She sells itinerantly from 9:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. in the district of Andahuaylillas at the entrance to the stadium. By means of this business the member has been able to help her children progress.

Sra. Hipolita wants to enlarge her ice cream sales business. She is applying for the loan in order to have the resources to purchase ice cream. She is happy to have the loan and promises to make all the payments on time.

loans.use: to have the resources for purchasing ice cream.

loans.name: Fashmy Haviba

texts.es: Fashmy es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. El sistema que utiliza ella para su venta es de contado y también ofrece crédito a sus más seleccionados clientes con los que tiene un tratamiento preferencial. Su negocio es una pulpería que ofrece productos como golosinas, granos básicos y detergentes entre otros. Cuando inició su negocio solo ofrecía pocos productos y poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta convertirlo en lo que hoy es. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos, avenas, café, fósforos, sopas y enlatados.
texts.en: Fashmy is a married woman with 2 young children.  She takes cash for her sales and also offers financing to some select customers to whom she gives preferential treatment.  She has a general store where she sells products such as candies, basic grains, detergent, and more.  When she began her business she had few products, but little by little she saved so that her store became what it is today.  The loan she is requesting is to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, basic grains, coffee, matches, soups and canned goods.

loans.use: To buy candies. soft drinks, bread, coffee, basic grains, canned goods, matches, soups, etc

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a hard-working mother of two children aged four and seven. Her spouse is a driver and they have no other dependents. Justine lives with her husband and their two children in her own home at Mparo Hoima. Her family's goal is to educate their children. 

She has been operating a retail shop for nine years, however she faces stiff competition. Justine sold her cow in order to get capital for starting the business and she would like her business to grow into a wholesale shop. Justine needs a loan to purchase general store items like sugar, soap, salt & rice.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize, salt, & rice.

loans.name: Carmen Isolda

texts.en: Carmen Isolda is 24 years old.  She has a business selling a variety of clothes.  Through her hard work, her door-to-door selling has been very successful.  She has recently secured a spot in the new market and will use the funds from this loan to open her shop there.    Her goal is to continue to grow her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: open a new shop at the market

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en:
Munhtsetseg is 37 years old and lives with her three children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in someone else's backyard. They live in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her older son, age 18, attends college and her younger daughter, age 16, goes to a local secondary school. 

Munhtsetseg manages a taxi service business in her town. She started her business in 2005. She is a safe and reliable driver who provides comfortable service for her customers. She mainly waits her customers in front of a hotel. She is an honest and hardworking lady who is doing her best to feed her children. She says, "I am using my car for 6 years. All I want is to repair my car with the loan." She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to buy some spare parts to repair her car.

loans.use: to buy some spare parts.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 44 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ethel has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Ethel has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Job Group

texts.es:
El grupo Job los conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Analy quien se dedica a la venta de productos oriflames desde hace 8 años aproximadamente. Ella es madre soltera de dos niños por los cuales ha trabajado arduamente para sacarlos adelante.
Los otros dos integrantes son Lucia de los Ángeles de 28 años quien tiene una pulpería desde hace dos años y Marnie  de 25 años vende ropa de niños, interior…etc.
texts.en: The group "Job" is made up of 3 enterprising and hardworking women.  One of these is Analy, who has had a business selling Oriflame brand cosmetics products for about 8 years.  She is a single mother who has 2 children, and she works very hard to provide for them.  The other members of the group are Lucia de los Angeles, 28, who has a grocery store, and Marnie, 25, who sells children's clothing, underwear and other items.

loans.use: to buy Oriflame brand cosmetics

loans.name: Sandra Aelizabeth

texts.es:
La Señoirita. Sandra es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive por una comunidad aledaña a la parroquia del Valle, este lugar es de clima frió y nos regala una hermosa vista de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes áreas de trabajos.

La Señorita. Sandra tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá labora en una carpintería y su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Nuestra socia labora en el área de la costura, esta actividad lo aprendió trabajando, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde y los sábados medio día.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir para pagar la entrada de una máquina de coser industrial.
 
Su meta es culminar sus estudios universitarios y llegar a ser Licenciada en Educación Física.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the 'Los Talvos' community bank.  She lives in a neighboring community, in El Valle parish.  This is a cold-climate area which affords us a beautiful view of the landscape.  The local people work in commerce, animal raising and farming.  Many people work in the city of Cuenca in various jobs.

Sandra is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  Her dad works in a carpenter's workshop and her mom does the housework.  They own the house in which they live.

Sandra is in the sewing business.  She learned the trade on the job.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 5.00pm.  She works half day Saturdays.

This is Sandra's second loan through her community bank and she will invest it in making a down payment on an industrial sewing machine.

Sandra's goal is to finish her university course and get her degree in Physical Education.

loans.use: to make a down payment on an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene la edad de 60 años, estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria y esta casada con el señor Jose que trabaja como albañil en su comunidad, ellos tuvieron un hijo el cual ya se encuentra casado.

Doña Juana nos platica que como cada dia la situacion economico esta peor, hace mas  de un año decidio iniciar a trabajar vendiendo gelatinas, chiles rellenos y tamales con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad para ganar un poco de dinero extra y asi ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella realiza sus ventas de gelatinas los dias miercoles, los chiles rellenos y tamales nos fines de semana (viernes, sabados y domingo), en el cual necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de leche, gelatina, azucar, vasos desechables, chiles, carne, tomates, cebolla, maiz, huevos, aceite y gas para la elaboracion de su comida y posteriormente salir a vender.

Ella nos dice que solo desea que Dios le diga dando fuerzas para seguir trabajando y asi poder continuar ayudando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Juana is 60 years old, studied until the fifth grade of primary school, and is married to Jose, who works as a bricklayer in their community.  They have one son who is already married.

Juana says that since every day the economic situation is getting worse, more than a year ago, she decided to start selling gelatin, stuffed chiles, and tamales to her friends and neighbors in the community  to earn a little extra money and help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells gelatin on Wednesday and stuffed chiles and tamales on the weekends (Friday, Saturday, and Sunday).  

She is asking for this loan to purchase milk, gelatin, sugar, disposable cups, chiles, meat, tomatoes, onions, corn, eggs, oil, and gas to make her food and later go out to sell it.

She said that she only hopes that God gives her the strength to continue working so that she can continue to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make gelatin, stuffed chiles, and tamales.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru:
Робия трудолюбивая, честная и добросовестная женщина. Она всегда старается сделать всем добро. Она  вдова и любящая мать 1 сына. Она мечтает, устроит своего сына в хорошую школу и она хочет, чтобы её сын стал образованным человеком.  Для содержанию свою семью она начала заниматься приготовлением лепешек с 2002 года со своими родственниками. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить своё жилищное условие. Робия хотела бы получить займ в размере 2300$ США для покупки муку на запас с целью расширения бизнеса. Она заранее благодарна всем кредиторам за поддержку и поощрение. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Robiya is a hard-working, honest and conscientious woman.  She always tries to show kindness to others.  She is a widow and a loving mother of one son.  She dreams of getting her son into a good school and wants her son to become an educated person.  Together with her relatives, she started baking flatbread in 2002 in order to support her family.  She wants to expand her business and improve her living conditions.  Robiya wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2300 for the purchase of flour to stock in order to expand her business.  She is grateful in advance to all of the creditors for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Djeyesse Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 femmes qui constituent le groupe DJEYESSE III sont toutes mariées dans  le village de KOLA SANGOULA,  de la sous préfecture de BLA,  dans l’ex Cercle de BLA , région de SÉGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et au moins 4 enfants. Elles cultivent  du riz de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production les membres du groupe DJEYESSE III  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année et sont à leur premier prêt de campagne. 
FANTA G., assise au milieu avec un foulard noir au coud ,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de BLA ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA ,YANGASSO et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 20500 à 45.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 women who make up the DJEYESSE III group are all married and live in the village of Kola Sangoula,Bla sub-prefecture, in the ex-circle of Bla, Segou region (the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali) They live in traditional families. They are on average 42 years old and have at least 4 children. They grow rice, groundnuts, and gumbo.
In order to ensure a return on their farms and increase their farmable plots of land for a better yield, this year the members of the DJEYESSE III   group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme and this is their first loan.
FANTA G, who is sitting in the middle with a black scarf on her elbow, intends to use her loan to purchase good quality seeds, small tools, and agricultural products for cultivation, exclusively at the big market in the town of Bla. After wintering, the harvest is stored for a certain period of time so that it appreciates in value. It is then sold at the markets in Bla, Yangasso, and the neighbouring towns, retail, (often wholesale), for cash to customers who generally come from the big towns.
The members of the group intend to make a profit after the sale of their products of between 20.500 and 45.000FCFA which will be used for the repayment of the interests of their loan and the family expenditure.

loans.use: Purchase farming products,seeds and small tools.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 39-year-old married man, who lives with his wife and two children. He has owned a bakery since 2003, and has 21 years of experience in this field. He serves the famous traditional Manoucheh with special toppings (cheese, thyme, spicy cheese, meat, etc.). He is talented in his business and his customers enjoy the tasty foods he creates.
Marwan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new updated machine for his bakery, in addition to completing building two additional rooms at his house. This is Marwan's first loan from Al Majmoua. He hopes it will have a great positive effect on his business in addition to his family's social and financial situation. 
Marwan hopes to further expand his business by moving to a bigger place to accommodate eating-in customers.

loans.use: to buy a new updated machine for his bakery.

loans.name: Mwavuli Youth Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya! John is the facilitator of the Mwavuli Youth group. John and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. As with the majority of farmers in Western Kenya, members of Mwavuli Youth Group are farmers who rely on maize as their staple crop. 

John takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, John had an excellent maize yield harvesting six bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land. 

With income from maize sales, John will invest in livestock rearing and save for future use. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. 

In 2012, the members of Mwavuli Youth group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize.

In the photograph above, John is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Candelaria has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP12,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. Candelaria has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Candelaria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам женат имеет одного ребенка. Жена домохозяйка. Ранее он занимался откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. На полученную прибыль он поменял вид бизнеса и стал заниматься продажей женских тканей. Два года как он занимается данным видом бизнеса. Этот вид деятельности он выбрал потому, что здесь больше общения. Он знает, что ткани всегда востребованы для женщин и всегда советуется с женой по выбору и востребованности  их на рынке. На полученный займ он хочет пополнить ассортимент товара и добавить зимние ткани. Он надеется получить займ. Спасибо.
texts.en: Rustam is married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Previously, he was involved in fattening up and selling cattle.  He used the profits to transition to another business and became involved in sales of women's fabrics.  Rustam has been in this business for two years.  He chose this business because it has more interaction.  He know that fabrics are always in demand for women, and he always gets his wife's advise on the choice and demand of fabrics at the market.  Rustam wants to use this loan to refill his merchandise inventory and add winter fabrics.  He hopes to obtain this loan.  Thank you.

loans.use: to buy winter fabrics

loans.name: Juan Octavio

texts.es:
En Telica municipio de León, Juan Octavio es maestro de primaria desde hace 31 años, siendo soltero y con un hijo el cual se esmera por proporcionarle excelentes condiciones de vida. 

Ceprodel está comprometido con los maestros para brindarles condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo y por este motivo es que acudió acá para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como, bloques, zinc, hierro corrugado, zinc liso y arena para realizar mejoras pertinentes en su vivienda mejorando principalmente el techo, para mayor seguridad de su vivienda y por ende de su hijo. 

Espera que el crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y así contribuir al mejoramiento de su hogar y continuar con la bella labor de la educación en su municipio.
texts.en:
In Telica, Leon municipality, Juan Octavio has been a primary school teacher for some 31 years. He is single and has a son for whom he wishes to provide excellent conditions of life.

Ceprodel is committed to offering teachers the necessary conditions for development and for this reason, Juan Octavio came to us to request a loan to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, regular zinc sheets, corrugated iron, smooth zinc sheeting, and sand to carry out pertinent improvements in his house. In particular, he wishes to repair the roof in order to increase his home's security and, especially, that of his son.

He hopes that the loan will be offered and thus, contribute to improving his home and helping him continue his rewarding work in the education of his municipality.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his home, including cement blocks, regular zinc sheeting, corrugated iron, smooth zinc sheets, and sand.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, a mother of two children aged 10 and 4, is a farmer in the area of Nkubu, Central Kenya where for 10 years she has been growing passion fruits, beans, and cabbages, selling to the middlemen within the local market. She laments the high cost of inputs, especially fertilizers and pesticides. She also trades in second-hand shoes and clothes for additional income.

Evangeline has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimoso to buy dairy goats. She says dairy goats are a rich source of milk and have become popular in the area. She will use the income to educate her children and improve their overall standards of living.

Evangeline appreciates the loan services offered by Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Mariana Del Consuelo

texts.es:
Mariana es una mujer tranquila, alegre y muy trabajadora. Es casada, tiene 5 hijos, vive con su familia en San Gabriel en la Provincia del Carchi en el Norte de Ecuador. 

Trabaja sola en la crianza de pollos por tiempo de 12 años, pero quiere y necesita emprender en el negocio de la crianza de cerdos, es por eso que realiza su tercer crédito en Fodemi debido a que necesita invertir en la compra de pollos, compra de cerdos y construcción de corrales lo cual le generará buenas ventas e ingresos.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos dandoles el estudio.
texts.en:
Mariana is a quiet, happy and very hardworking woman. She is married, has five children and lives with her family in San Gabriel in Carchi province in the north of Ecuador.

She has worked raising only chickens for 12 years but she wants and needs to start a business raising pigs as well. Thus she is requesting her third loan from Fodemi since she needs to invest in the purchase of chickens and pigs and in the construction of pens, which will generate good sales and income.

Her dream is to continue working and to improve the quality of life of her children by proving them an education.

loans.use: to buy pigs as well as chickens since she wants to expand her business.

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.ru:
Maleyka zamujem i imeyet 4 detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svyey semyoy. Maleyka 59 let.
 Ona uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Ona seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya pereprodaji. Muj Maleyki boleyet i ne mojet rabotat poeotmu ona odna soderjit semyu. I yey nujno uvelichit mesachniye doxodi dlya lecheniya muja.
texts.en:
Maleyka is married and has four children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) relocated from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with her family. Maleyka is 59 years old.

She has been in the livestock business breeding cows for ten years now. Right now she needs 2000 AZN to buy a cows for resale. Maleyka's husband is ill and cannot work now so she is supporting the family. She also needs to increase her monthly income for her husband's treatment.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson forma parte del Banco comunal “Ilusión 2011” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo provisiones en un local que adaptó en el garaje de su casa.
Se desempeña en éste negocio desde hace 1 año y 6 meses. Trabaja de lunes a domingo durante 12 horas diarias.
Su mercadería la compra a mayoristas, distribuidoras y también proveedores. 
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio.
Sus metas son expandirse con su negocio y que éste prospere, así surtirlo con nueva y mayor cantidad de mercadería. 
Nelson vive junto a su madre y uno de sus sueños son comprarse un vehículo y adquirir su vivienda propia. 
El está muy contento y agradecido de la ayuda que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal al cual pertenece, comenta que es un grupo muy unido, comprometido y responsable.
Por otro lado las capacitaciones le han servido para organizar la contabilidad de su negocio de mejor manera. 
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en: Nelson is a member of the "Ilusión 2011" communal bank from the town of Viña del Mar. He is in sales, more specifically selling groceries in a store adapted in the garage of his home. He has been in this business for one year and six months. He works 12 hours a day from Monday through Sunday. He buys his merchandise from wholesale sellers, distributors and suppliers. With the loan he will purchase merchandise in order to stock up his store. His goals are to expand his business and to see it prosper, and so he needs to stock up with more and newer merchandise. Nelson lives with his mother and one of his dreams is to purchase a vehicle and also a house of his own. He is very happy and thankful for the help he has been given by Fondo Esperanza, because it has allowed him to invest in his business. As for the communal bank he belongs to, he reports that it is a very united, committed and responsible group. Also, the trainings have been useful for him to organize accounting for his business in the best possible way. Viña del Mar is a town and commune located in the central coast of Chile. It is known as the Garden Town due to the gardens and yards belonging to some of the town's old houses. It is also considered to be Chile's tourism capital.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock up his store.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a 68-year-old widower with three adult children.  He has been in the farming business for the past six years with a monthly income of about Kes 8,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Johnson will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will open a retail shop for his son.  His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mr. Chea is a loving father of six children. He permanently lives in Baray district and is in the business of fishing as well as selling firewood. From these businesses, he’s able to earn income of $3.50 per day to cover his daily need. 

As shown in the photo, Chea’s house is old and it sometimes suffers from the weather. Consequently, it doesn’t provide a comfortable living for the family, especially in the rainy season. Chea wants to fix his house and replace some parts that are unusable. This is his second loan from HKL and he will use it to purchase the necessary building materials to fix his house. He’s very happy and grateful to all lenders who continually help his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials to fix his house.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Trabajadoras” se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 15 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción; todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas. Todas se esmeran esperanzadas, para poder dar a sus hijos un mañana distinto del que a ella toco vivir, formándolos para ser hombres y mujeres de provecho para la sociedad.
Una de estas mujeres muy trabajadoras es la señora Maria, quien nos cuenta que se dedica al reciclado de materiales. Comenta que diariamente se levante a trabajar desde muy temprano. Ella recorre por las calles juntando todo tipo de materiales que puedan ser reciclados. Ella nos cuenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plásticos, pues de esa forma al revenderlos en cantidad tiene más ganancias. Agradece  la fundación por la oportunidad que le da, pues no cualquier institución lo haría.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Hard-working Women) communal bank is in their third loan cycle under the Mujeres Emprendadores (Women Entrepreneurs) program of Fundación Paraguaya. It has 15 members from the Asunción area. All the members are carrying out productive activities. 

All are making a great effort, hoping to give their children a different future from the one that they had, and raising them to be men and women who are a benefit to society.

One of these very hard-working women is Maria, who tells us that she collects recyclable materials. She says that every day she gets up to go to work very early. 

She goes through the streets collecting all types of materials that can be recycled. She tells us she is very proud of what she does, as it is respectable work, and above all, honest.

She is applying for the loan to buy plastic containers, as by selling them in quantity, she gets more earnings. She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity they are giving her, as no other institution would do so.

loans.use: To buy plastic containers to sell.

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en: Ghadeer is a 23-year-old married lady. They still have no kids to support; but that didn't stop Ghadeer from doing her own business and making some money. While her husband works as a carpenter, Ghadeer opened a small snacks shop at home selling biscuits, chips, juice and other items. Now she is applying for a youth loan to get new stand for chips and make some shelves to add more types of biscuits and chocolates.

loans.use: to get a new stand for chips and make some shelves to add more types of biscuits and chocolates.

loans.name: Nirupama Group

texts.en:
Nirupama Group was formed in the year 2015 at Siripur, Bhuabaneswar, Khurdha, Odisha, India, with five active, local, self-dependent women, with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of concerned group have their own professions and businesses. Mrs. Nirupama is one of them who has taken a great role for her development and the group members' livelihood improvement. 

The lady standing first person from the left-hand side in the photo is Nirupama. She is about 24 years old and lives with her small family, as she has a husband and only one child. 

Nirupama has been engaged with a small business at her own home since eight years ago. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 9,000 INR. Her opinion is that her income is not sufficient to maintain her family with sufficient surplus for total investment in the business to materialize her dreams. So to get more and more income by expansion of her business, she planned to improve her business over the course of loan. She has taken the loan and will purchase a huge quantity of grocery items such as spice items, rice, sugar, wheat, maize and other shop-related items from the market post disbursement of loan. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for the construction of a house and to provide a better education to her children.

The other four members of her group are also smart at their professions, like vegetable vending, a milk business, a popped rice business, a general store and a transport business, and with this loan, they hope to boost their livelihoods after disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, tea, sugar, wheat, spices, nuts, soap and washing powder

loans.name: Monaf

texts.en: Monaf is a 40-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working since five years ago at her house selling homemade food in order to help her family to meet the needs of life and live in a good way. Today, Monaf is asking a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to ameliorate her business' merchandise and to give the best product to its clients and therefore increase her income. She is very happy and optimistic that she will sell all products and expand her business area. She hopes that, in the future, she might open her own store and attract more customers.

loans.use: to ameliorate her business' merchandise

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en: Marcos is a single father who owns a small store that sells chickens and other meats. He averages about 16 hours of work a day and depends on his family to take care of his daughter. With the money received from the loan Marcos plans to increase his inventory so that he can diversify his products and buy in bulk at lower prices. He plans to use the increased income to provide better health care, education and clothing for his daughter.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Akayivi

texts.en:
Akayivi E. is an energetic woman and the mother of six. She is married to a bike mechanic. Her main business is making and selling corn meal porridge in schools in the morning and then along the road in the evenings. Her husband makes less than she does when it comes to covering household expenses. That’s why Ms. E. helps to make ends meet with her income from selling porridge. A very kind and welcoming woman, she demands cleanliness, which has won her a large and loyal customer base. She has already repaid her initial loan without a problem and plans to bolster her business by seeking more substantial financial means. And so she is requesting a new loan of $600 to build a significant stock of corn. She can then make corn meal porridge upon demand. This will improve her income, as well as living conditions at home.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame E. Akayivi, est une femme dynamique. Mariée à un mécanicien à 2 roues et mère de six enfants, elle a pour activité principale la préparation et vente de bouillie à base du maïs dans les établissements scolaires les matins, et aux abords des routes, les soirs. Le revenu de l’activité de son mari n’est pas aussi important pour prendre en charge tous les besoins du foyer. Pour cette raison, Madame E. Akayivi contribue aux charges avec les revenus de sa vente de bouillie. Très gentille et accueillante, elle est exigeante en matière d’hygiène, ce qui lui procure une abondante et fidèle clientèle. Elle a déjà remboursé son premier crédit sans incident. Elle a l’ambition de renforcer son commerce de bouillie et cherche un moyen financier pour consistant. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $600 qui va lui permettre de constituer un stock consistant de maïs afin de préparer sa bouillie à tout moment. Ceci améliorera ses revenus ainsi que les conditions de vie de son foyer.

loans.use: Making and selling corn meal porridge

loans.name: Ba

texts.en: Both Ba and her husband are 59. They live with their son who has mental illness. Ba’s activity is to raise fish. Ba has a lake of 80 square meters for raising fish. Ba's income, which comes from raising fish, is only $7 per person/month. Now, Ba wants a loan of $75 to expand her fish farm. Ba is going to repay monthly.

loans.use: To raise fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy at wholesale and sell at retail

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo has been a public service transporter for 40 years, and with the income from this activity he supports his two children and wife. He lives in the Villa Cooperativa neighborhood in the city of El Alto. His wife is a door-to-door vendor who also helps her husband with the family income.

The requested loan will be destined for the construction of a small grocery store in their neighborhood, since the door-to-door vending is very dangerous for his wife.

This will be the second loan he has requested from IMPRO; his good payment record from the first loan allows us to approve this request.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Eduardo es transportista de servicio público hace 40 años y con los ingresos de esta actividad cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos y esposa. Vive en la zona de Villa Cooperativa de la Ciudad de El Alto, la esposa es pequeña comerciante ambulante que también colabora con el esposo con los ingresos familiares.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su zona, ya que el comercio ambulante es muy peligroso para su esposa.

Este será el segundo crédito que solicita de IMPRO; el buen antecedente de pagos del primer crédito permite aprobarle la solicitud.

loans.use: Construction of a grocery store.

loans.name: Pabla

texts.en:
Pabla Kings, known as Paublita in her neighborhood, has a grocery store or pulperia in Honduras. She sells a wide variety of items in the pluperia.

She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more items to sell, for example, rice, soap, flour, sugar, candy, bread, and churros. She wants to increase her sales so she can better meet her financial responsibilities.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to sell in grocery store

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina creates finely embroidered products with her artistic hands, working diligently day by day to sustain her family. Thanks to this activity she has been able to keep her family together, with the support of each and every member, and will continue to put forth great effort for their benefit. Today she is applying what her mother taught her as a child, an art she has perfected over the years and her work is in high demand in the local market. She meets embroidery requests from her loyal customers, and also rents out traditional costumes for use during festivals/celebrations. She has a great desire to succeed, and wishes to increase her customer base. For this reason, she asks for a loan to buy thread and fabric to improve her business and increase earnings to maintain her family. Let’s support this hardworking and diligent woman. Your collaboration is very important.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Armandina, realiza trabajos de bordados finamente elaborados con sus artísticas manos, día a día trabaja diligentemente para poder llevar el sustento a su familia.Gracias a esta actividad la ha podido mantener unida porque cuenta con el importante apoyo de cada uno de los integrantes que trabajan para el bienestar de su y seguirá esforzándose con ellos y en beneficio de ellos.Ahora está aplicando lo que un día de niña su madre le enseño y el trabajo con el correr de los años ha ido perfeccionando su técnica de bordado y sus trabajos están siendo cada vez más cotizados en el mercado local, ella atiende pedidos de sus fieles clientes que acuden a su bordaduría familiar, además, no sólo se dedica a adornar los bellos fustanes de las damas de su localidad sino también a alquilar trajes típicos para las festividades que celebra cada comunidad.Ella tiene grandes deseos de superación y desea incrementar su clientela mejorando notablemente sus trabajos, es por ello que solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de hilos y telas para seguir afrontando los gastos de manutención de su familia con las ganancias que genere su actividad.Apoya a una mujer trabajadora y diligente, tu colaboración es muy importante.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread for embroidery business to help meet the dreams of her children.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline M. is a busy woman. She runs two businesses, one selling used clothing and the other raising chickens for sale. But let’s be honest, chickens can raise themselves without too many emotional scars, which leaves Caroline free to focus on the clothes business. It is this business for which she requires a loan of $275, with which she will purchase additional stock in bulk. Caroline is married to husband Dennis, and has three children, Peter, aged 12, Clifford, aged 2, and Dora, aged 1.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fairly used clothing in bulk

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs. Im C., 33, is the mother of two children and works as a fish seller, earning on average around $1.50 each day in profit. Her husband works as a security guard and generally makes around $3.30 per day. All the income she and her husband make is not enough so that she could accumulate savings; it goes to support her family.

In order to raise her income generation, Mrs. Im C. would like to request a loan to purchase her husband a motorcycle that he will use to operate a motor-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase her husband a motorcycle  that he will use to operate a motor-taxi

loans.name: Alifaga

texts.en: I. Alifaga is a 48-year-old trader at the Saatli local bazaar who sells fruits, vegetables, nuts and dried fruits. He has been doing this for thew past eight years. He is married and has three children. He needs 1200 USD to build a good store and continue trading.

loans.use: To build a good store

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela is a member of the "Winning Women" communal bank. She lives in San Martin in the Bellavista region of Peru. She has run an occupational center dedicated to teaching hair dressing and personal care in a property she owns for the past two years.

With the $725 loan, which she plans to repay within six months, she hopes to purchase all the items her pupils need in her various courses, since the classes in her center started in March. They need items such as combs, clippers, curlers, chemicals, hair dyes and makeup, which they can purchase at the center.

Mariela is 46 years old and has five children — four girls, one boy — who are her priD. and joy. She is very happy with this part of her life and hopes to be able to enlarge her business as well, for which she is taking a course to validate the training she already has.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Mariela S. M. D. Paredes es socia del Banco Comunal “ Mujeres Triunfadoras” , vive en el departamento D. San Martín, provincia D. Bellavista, distrito D. Bellavista ella es dueña D. un centro ocupacional , donD. se dedica a la enseñanza D. cortes D. cabello y arreglo personal en un local D. su propiedad ubicado en la Prolongación carretera a San Pablo 2do Piso al frente D. la I.E. 180 en la localidad D. Bellavista, ella ya se dedica a este negocio desD. hace 2 años, Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, desea comprar todos los artículos que necesitaran sus alumnos en las diversas clases que realizaran ya que las clases en su centro D. enseñanza iniciaran en el mes D. marzo, como son estuches D. peines, estuches D. tijeras, rizadores, ácidos, tintes para cabello, y productos D. maquillaje, ya que los alumnos adquieren estos productos en el mismo centro D. enseñanza Ella tiene 46 años, tiene 5 hijos 1 varón y 4 mujeres, los cuales son su orgullo, ella se siente muy feliz con esta meta lograda en su vida y espera poder ampliar mas su negocio, ya que para ello ella esta tomando un curso en un centro D. estudios para poder convalidar los estudios realizados que hasta el momento tiene.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies for her occupational center / Con el prestamo comprara materiales para su negocio

loans.name: Peggy Ysabel

texts.es:
Peggy is a member of the communal bank called La Familia, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali, Peru. She is 30 years old and has 2 children. With the first loan she received, Peggy invested in a business selling sodas. Today she has grown the business and now sells food and drinks, getting up at 6am each day to prepare breakfast for her childen and husband, and she works in her general store during the day. Her husband also works.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase more sodas and the ingredients she needs to prepare the meals and snacks she sells. Peggy is pleased with her work. She is realizing her goals and overcoming obstacles with hard work and courage. Now she can help support her family thanks to her work. She is grateful for the help she has received.

La señora Peggy pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en la Urb. JJ. Muñoz MZ A Lt 23, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Peggy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio de venta de comida y de gaseosas para lo cual se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la venta de sus comidas hasta las 11 am. Con este préstamo de S/. 1 600 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará gaseosas e insumos para la preparación de sus comidas. Peggy se siente muy contenta, esta haciendo realidad sus metas y a superado las adversidades que se le presentaron con esfuerzo y valentía, ahora puede apoyar a su familia gracias a su trabajo, esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que Manuela Ramos le brinda en su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HER GENERAL STORE, AS WELL AS INGREDIENTS SHE NEEDS TO PREPARE THE MEALS AND SNACKS SHE SELLS.

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en:
Natiq R. is a 42-year-old trader who has his own shop in the Saatli region of Azerbaijan where he sells food. Natiq is married and has three children.

Natiq has worked in this particular field for more than 20 years but, until recently, he rented the shop in which he sold his goods. However, he is proud to say that he finally purchased land not long ago and proceeded to build his own shop. Nevertheless, the shop is quite new and is in need of repairs and other improvements. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 in order to purchase more equipment to sell and to make repairs to his shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to make much-needed repairs and improvements to his business' shop.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. P. Thi Tran, 50 years old, joined the Fund in 2004. She saw that joining the Fund means that her family would have the chance to grow financially. In every round of funding, she put the loan towards the livestock business. Although the family’s livestock venture is not very big, it still brings them a steady annual income. Besides raising livestock, in her free time Mrs. Tran weaves baskets to sell for extra money. She has four children, one of which is grown and has established his own family and three who live at home. All her children have jobs and stable incomes; with these multiple incomes the family’s ability to repay the loans is very good. In this round of funding she and the family is requesting 6,000,000 VND to invest in raising pigs. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Phúc 50 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004, chị thấy rằng tham gia vào Quỹ là gia đình chị có cơ hội phát triển kinh tế, các vòng vốn chị đều sử dụng vào mục đích chăn nuôi, việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị tuy không lớn nhưng cũng đem lại thu nhập hàng năm cho gia đình, ngoài việc chăn nuôi những lúc nhàn dỗi chị làm thêm nghề đan thúng cho thu nhập thêm.
