Chị có 4 người con, 1 con đã xây dựng gia đình, 3 con hiện đang sống cùng gia đình các con chị đều có công ăn việc làm thu nhập ổn định, với nhiều nguồn thu nhâp nên việc hoàn trả của gia đình chị rât tốt. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in raising pigs

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.ru:
Anvarjon T. lives in Tursun-zoda city. He is married with four children. He has a higher education and is a professional mechanic. He works in his own store where he sells building materials and has done so for the last 16 years. He would like to increase his product assortment with a loan, which he plans to pay off in 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Тоштемиров Анварджон проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Женат , имеет четверых детей. Имеет высшее образование. По профессии механник. Работает в своем магазине по продаже строй материалов. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 16 лет. Хочет увеличить ассортимент товара , путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Goods delivery

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja is a member of the Community Bank Atinchik, which means "We Can" in quechua.

Maruja is married, 37 years old, and has two children. Maruja studied to be a teacher at the primary level and currently works in an education center of the city of Ayacucho. Maruja sells watches and shoes at wholesale. She delivers them to the stores and sales stands of different markets of the city of Ayacucho and Huanta. She acquires her products from the city of Tacna, where she travels to each month.

Maruja needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of various models of watches. Maruja's dreams are to have her own house, a car, and to see her children study in private universities.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Atinchik que significa Podemos en quechua.

Maruja es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Maruja estudio para ser profesora del nivel primaria y actualmente trabaja en un centro educativo de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Maruja vende relojes, zapatillas al por mayor, reparte a las tiendas, puestos de venta de los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y Huanta, sus productos lo adquiere en la ciudad de Tacna a donde viaja mensualmente.

Maruja necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de relojes de diferentes modelos. Los sueños de Maruja son tener casa propia, un carro y que sus hijos estudien en universidades privadas.

loans.use: Maruja needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of various models of watches.

loans.name: Linda

texts.es: Doña Linda A. tiene 56 años de edad, ella es Secretaria Comercial pero ya no labora formalmente, juntamente con su esposo el Sr. Bayardo Blas quien cuenta con una pensión de vejez, iniciaron  hace  ya cuatro años un pequeño negocio de venta de cereales, a base de Maíz, Trigo, Avena, caco, etc., este producto es de alto consumo en nuestros hogares y tiene una buena demanda, ellos solicitan un crédito para mejorar la vivienda que tienen ubicada en un Barrio pobre de Managua llamado Lomas de Guadalupe, específicamente para levantar un muro y embaldosar 21 Metros cuadrados de su propiedad y poder mejorar las condiciones de vida. Sus sueño es permanecer al lado de su esposo trabajando por una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Linda A. is 56 years old and is a commercial secretary but isn't working formally now. Together with her husband Bayardo Blas, who has a retirement pension, four years ago she started a small business selling grains, such as corn, wheat, oats, cocoa, etc. which are heavily consumed in the region and have a high demand. They are requesting a loan to improve their house that is located in a poor neighborhood of Managua called Lomas de Guadalupe, specifically to put up a wall and tile 21 square meters of the house to improve their living conditions. Her dream is to remain by her husband's side working for a dignified home.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put up a wall and tile the floor of her house

loans.name: Ševala

texts.en: ŠEvala S. comes from Suha, a village near ŽIvinice. She has one school-aged daughter and she gives everything of herself to provide good living conditions for her familly. ŠEvala keeps busy in a greenhouse producing a healthy vegetable. She wants to take a loan from WWI to keep her business running. She needs a loan in amount of 800 KM to buy  onion seeds to plant in the greenhouse. Young onion is a very popular vegetable in spring time in Bosnie, so ŠEvala hopes to earn a good profit and that that will improve her production of healthy food.

loans.use: To buy onion seeds

loans.name: Ayetan

texts.fr:
Née à Anfoin en 1965, Madame T. Ayetan est mariée et mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés dont les charges sont en partie couvertes par les revenus maigres de son activité qui n’est rien d’autre que la vente des produits de première nécessité (sucre, lait,savons, détergents, huiles et autres). Pour augmenter son revenu et mieux faire face à l’éducation de ses enfants Madame T. Ayetan sollicite un appui financier afin de s’approvisionner plus. 
Cet appui ainsi réalisé lui permettra d’augmenter son revenu et mieux faire face à l’éducation de sa famille et améliorer le niveau vie de sa famille. Accordons lui une chance de réaliser ses ambitions.
texts.en:
Born in Anfoin in 1965, Mrs. Ayetan T. is married and the mother of 2 children, both in school, whose school expenses are in part covered by the meager earnings from her business, which is simply the sale of staples (sugar, milk, soap, detergent, oil and so forth). To increase her income and better cope with educating her children, Mrs. Ayetan T. is asking for a loan so that she can add to her inventory.

This loan will allow her to increase her income and be able to pay for the education expenses of her family and improve their standard of living. Let's give her a chance to realize her dreams!

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking her store with merchandise

loans.name: Valentin Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor Valentín trabaja para una empresa reconocida de la ciudad en el área de operador.
El es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, esta solicitando este crédito para la ampliación de su casa en el área de la sala para darle a su casa y familia mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Valentín works for a business that is recognized in the city in the area of telephone operation. He is a very hardworking and responsible person. He is requesting this loan to expand the living room of his house so that he can provide his family with a more comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House expansion

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: La Sr. Fátima tiene 31 años de edad, vive en Villa Reconciliación un barrio de la capital de Managua, casada su esposo es albañil, tiene dos lindos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad lo tiene estudiando en un colegio de la capital, los planes para su pequeña familia es mejorar su nivel de vida y poseer un patrimonio en donde sus hijos puedan vivir seguros. Doña R. tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa desde hace catorce años con diferentes dificultades económica a logrado mantenerlo, también de  llegar a ubicar locales por todo el sector de Managua con productos variados y de calidad. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar nuevo y variados productos como: Zapatos, ropa para dama, caballero y niño, perfumería, cosméticos y prendas de oro y platas, incrementando el volumen de ventas y generando mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Fátima is 31 years old and lives in Villa Reconciliación, a neighborhood of the capital Managua. She is married to a builder and they have two beautiful children ages 7 and 10, who both study at a school in the capital. She hopes her small family can better their way of life and become wealthy enough so that her children can live secure of a bright future. Mrs. R. has had a small business selling clothes for 14 years. Through different economic difficulties, she has been able to maintain the business. She has also been able to establish local business throughout all of the area of Managua with various products of different quality. Thanks to the loans from AFODENIC, she will be able to buy new varieties of products such as shoes, women’s clothing, men’s clothing, children's clothing, perfume, cosmetics, garments of gold and silver. She will also been able to increase her volume of sales and generate better business.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar ropa,zapatos y cosmeticos

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthy Seoun Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people who all live in Tep Archun village in Kandal province make up the village bank loan. Mrs. Chanthy S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Chhoeurn Sovann, are vegetable sellers in the local market. Aside from this business, they are farmers who grow corn on a small plot of land. In this farming, they now face a small problem because they do not have enough money to buy corn seeds to cultivate. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Chanthy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy corn seeds. She is 44 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a laborer, while the remaining two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy corn seeds for her purpose.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester V. sells a variety of goods in her village where she owns a small store. She started her business in 1990 with capital of 2,000 pesos. She is now 54 and has two children. Her previous work was basket making, weaving and making good quality baskets to sell in the market. Now, she focuses her attention on her store. She uses the profit from selling a variety of goods to feed her family, send her children to school and pay their daily expenses.

Ester is asking CEVI for a loan of 8,000 pesos. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her store. This is one way she can attract more customers to her business. She dreams of having a bigger store someday and the loan she will receive will help a lot with her business expansion.

By joining in the CEVI credit program, Ester has access to credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Farad

texts.en: Farad is the son of R. and lives in the 16th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single, but is the oldest of the family. He needs to cover all the necessities of his family and pay for all their expenses. He runs a car part shop for which he still needs some tools. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months and would like to make his business vast. He is confident that the loan will help him to increase his business.

loans.use: For buying more materials

loans.name: Gnon's Group

texts.en: K. is fifty-five years old, the leader of a group of three, and the mother of seven children. Four of them are married and live separately, one is employed as a local construction worker, and the other two are students. She is married to Heng, age fifty-two, who is a local farmer. K. is also a farmer which she has learned from her parents since 1979. She is a good manager and a responsible neighbor. Not only does she work at farming, she also wants to work at fishing. K. is asking for a loan to buy a small fishing boat for her fishing. The other members of the group are B., who is twenty-nine years old and a local construction foreman, and who is looking for a loan to buy a generator for his work, and also B., age twenty-eight, a local construction worker who wants a loan to buy groceries for his wife to sell. They all live in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To buy a small fishing boat for her fishing

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Lừng Nguyễn, 46, lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lừng works in a family member's business venture, running a general store in the retail sector. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Lừng has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2004, Lừng joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services, so that she can improve her living conditions and her ability to continue to engage in business activities. Lừng has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Lừng is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by this TYM Fund borrower. Lừng plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To improve and expand her grocery store business.

loans.name: Tort

texts.en: Mrs. Tort M., 26, lives in Pursat province, Cambodia where she owns a farmland that she inherited from her grandparents. The farmland is used to grow crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother of one lovely young child who is enrolled in school. She is married to Yeb, age 52, who sells wood-carvings that depends on wood from the forest. In order to help the family's physical labors in the farming work, M. is applying for a loan to buy a male buffalo so she can rent it out to other farmers to make additional income. (Mrs. M.'s husband, Yeb, is pictured.)

loans.use: To buy a male buffalo for farming use.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel M. R. reside en Ciudad Real en el departamento de Santa Ana, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas menores de edad las cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee un comedor y una venta de productos desechables como platos, tenedores, entre otros más. Reina solicita un préstamo a través de cual pueda incrementar los productos de su negocio, ya que ella desea comprar más granos básicos para los alimentos que comercializa, así como también servilletas, platos y otros más para su negocio de plásticos. Reina es una mujer muy responsable que se esfuerza por contribuir junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de esta manera poder seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel M. R. lives in Ciudad Real, in the Santa Ana department, alongside her spouse and her two children, who are young and in school. Reina has a small cafeteria and shop where she sells disposable goods, such as plates, forks, etc. Reina is asking for a loan in order to increase her inventory, as she would like to purchase more basic grains to sell, as well as napkins, plates, and other plastic products. Reina is very responsible, and works hard to contribute to contribute to her household's expenses in order to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase disposable and perishable products.

loans.name: Dira Group

texts.en:
Brank M., age 37, is single with one child aged nine. She has a fruit and vegetable business which she started a year ago. She works daily from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $106.

This will be Brank’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her stock and has repaid the loan successfully. She hopes for the second loan to again increase her stock.

Brank will share this loan with her loan group, Dira, which has eighteen members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Brank is first on the left in the front row.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en: Paulita B. is from the town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married and has six adult children. Paulita owns and operates a snack business, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Paulita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Paulita is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is a 24-year-old young lady. She is a married mother of one breastfeeding child, a boy. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment. She mostly depends on her husband for money and for other expenses. She complains that her husband is not able to give her enough money to take care of her business. She trades in fresh fish sales, a business she has done for four months now. She sells the fish through hawking. She has seen lots of improvement, but she is requesting for a loan to buy enough fish to upgrade her stock. She takes stock from the Kumasi central market, which is a nearby city. She believes the loan will boost her business to be able to include other food items frequently requested by her customers.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to sell and to upgrade her stock.

loans.name: Los Tres Barrios - Qoricancha Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “LOS TRES BARRIOS –QORICANCHA”,  son 13 miembros que residen en la comunidad de 
Qoricancha, situada en el distrito de Chincheros, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba, a 1 hora con 15 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, de bellos paisajes y dueños de 2 lagunas impresionantes.

Nuestros socios son gente muy trabajadora y muy ingeniosa, ellos se dedican principalmente a la ganadería,  ellos cuentan con bastos terrenos, su segunda actividad es la agricultura, y venden lo que sus tierras producen, según las fechas de siembra y  cosecha, los otros meses que ellos no están en sus tierras ellos se dedican al comercio, comprando y almacenando víveres para su futura venta, hacen el intercambio de productos con las otras comunidades que se dan cita cada 3 meses en este pueblo, muchos de nuestros socios, llevan a diferentes lugares del País su producción para su venta, otros llevan las crías de sus ganados y los derribados del mismo, siempre están haciendo algo provechoso y tratando de salir adelante pese a las inclemencias de clima y de otros factores. Los socios solicitan el préstamo para así seguir reinvirtiendo en sus diferentes actividades.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado, ya que en la comunidad de Qoricancha ellos, solo tienen este apoyo financiero.
texts.en:
The partners of the community bank “Los Tres Barrios – Qoricancha” consist of 13 members who live in the community of Qoricancha, which is located in the district of Chincheros in the Urubama province. With its beautiful landscapes and two impressive lagoons, Urubama is located an hour and 15 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Our partners own vast farmlands and are very hard working and resourceful. Their main business is cattle raising and their secondary business is agriculture. In the months when they are not working the fields, sowing and harvesting, they buy and store food for future sale. Every three months they exchange products with other communities that come to Qoricacha. Many of our partners sell their agricultural products throughout the country while some partners sell their calves and dairy products. They’re always doing something productive and trying to get ahead in spite of the harsh climate and other challenges. The partners are requesting the loan to continue to reinvest in their businesses.

Our partners are very appreciative and value this loan. In the community of Qoricancha, it is their only financial support.


Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Yolanda es casada, tiene 57 años y 3 hijos, Yolanda tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además los días viernes viaja a la feria.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, fideo y arroz.
Los sueños D. Yolanda son que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of Banco Comunal Retoño. Yolanda is married, is 57 years old and has three children. Yolanda has a stand in the Magdalena market where she sells groceries, an activity which she does everyday. In addition, on Fridays she travels to the fair. Yolanda needs a loan of 800 soles ($275), money which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, noodles, and rice. Yolanda's dream is that her children study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, noodles, and rice

loans.name: Ablavi Augustine

texts.fr: Cette femme est célibataire mais a un enfant à sa charge. Elle vend uniquement des tissus légers dans le marché de Hédzranamoé à Lomé ; elle exerce cette activité depuis 2003 et ceci lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Elle reçoit ses commandes au Ghana, le pays voisin. Elle revend ensuite ses tissus aux couturières qui la connaissent ainsi qu’à des vendeuses ambulantes de ces tissus. Actuellement elle est très sollicitée par de nombreux clients et a un réel besoin de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour  acheter 02 bals de tissus légers. Elle compte sur son dynamisme et sa maîtrise du marché pour vite rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is unmarried but with a child in her care.  She sells exclusively light-weight fabrics at the Hédzranamoé market in Lomé. She has been in this business since 2003, and it enables her to support herself.  She receives orders from Ghana, the neighboring country.  She then resells these fabrics to dressmakers who know her, as well as to door-to-door sellers of these fabrics.  Currently, she is much in demand by numerous customers and has a real need to renew her inventory.  For this reason, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy two bales of light-weight fabrics.  She's counting on her energy and her command of the market to repay the loan quickly.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy light-weight cloth

loans.name: Mr. Chamnab Kit Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en: A village bank loan which consists of seventeen people is located in Thmei village in Takeo province and all the members will use the loan in different purposes. Mr. Chamnab K. is the village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In his plantation, he needs pesticides to kill insects. In order to deal this problem, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and he would use the rest of loan to hire laborers to work on the field. His wife, Mrs. K. Seng Ly, is a weaver. Mr. Chamnab K. is 35 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan pesticides to kill insects and he would use the rest of loan to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly Q. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Jelly is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jelly owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as earrings, bracelets, and necklaces in the local community. Jelly is just starting this business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jelly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jelly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Jelly from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 45 años, se caracteriza por su perseverancia y sus deseos de superación, los cuales siempre la identificaron en la localidad donde reside desde hace 20 años junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos.

El don que ella tiene es la cocina, desde muy joven fue reconocida por su sabrosa sazón y sus amistades comenzaron a solicitar sus servicios para algunos eventos o celebraciones sociales. 
Desde entonces, inició su negocio de venta de comida y hace pocos meses pudo instalar un comedor popular donde albergara a gran cantidad de personas de su localidad y atiende con la ayuda de algunas vecinas. 
María considera rentable su trabajo debido al bajo costo que invierte en la preparación de los alimentos y a la demanda que hay en el lugar. Por ello, sus planes a futuro son de seguir implementando su comedor con algunos muebles necesarios para la comodidad de sus comensales, quienes cada día van en aumento.

Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ella sabe que la responsabilidad en sus cuotas respalda el trabajo que realiza y el compromiso que tiene con su banco comunal, al cual pertenece por más de 5 años. Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá invertir en la compra de mercadería (comestibles) que requiere para seguir preparando sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en:
María, 45 years old, is characterized by her perseverance and her strong desire for self-improvement. She is identified by these traits in the town where she has lived for the past 20 years with her husband and three children. María is a very gifted cook. Ever since she was very young, she has been known for her food's delicious flavors. Her friends began to ask for her services for social events and celebrations. Ever since then, she has run her business of cooking and selling food. A few months ago, she was able to open a popular diner where many members of the community go to eat; she serves them with the help of a few of her neighbors. María considers her business to be profitable because the cost of food supplies is low and the demand of her product is high. For these reasons, her future plans are to continue furnishing the diner with some additional tables and chairs for the comfort of her customers, whose number seems to grow every day. This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She knows that the responsibility of her payments supports the work that she does and the commitment that she has with her community bank, where she has been a member for more than 5 years. With the money she is asking for now, she would be able to invest in the purchase of merchandise (foodstuffs) that she needs in order to continue preparing her tasty dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of foodstuffs for the preparation of her dishes

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum S. is 30 years of age and currently lives in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Chum S. is a local professor who teaches classes for pupils, while her husband is a civil service officer who works in the Ministry of Interior. This couple has two young children. Chum S. finds it hard commuting to work because she has no vehicle for her traveling needs. Therefore, she asks for a loan to add to her saving to buy a used motor for riding to her workplace.

loans.use: To buy a used motor for riding to work

loans.name: 10 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Hà B. Thị (247) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Hà is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 10 Đông Sơn.

Hà is married and has three school-age children. To making a living, Hà owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling rice products in the local community. Hà has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  N. Thị Thương (246) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

2.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 32 years old and is married with six children between 5 and 12 years old. Daniel and his family live in Burera, a region of Ruhengeli situated in the northern province of Rwanda.  From here to Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda, it takes 2 hours drive.

Daniel has been a successful entrepreneur in the retail business for the past nine years and he employs two people from his community in his general store. Their hours of work are from 6:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. every weekday.

Daniel is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. With these funds, he plans to purchase more items to add to his offerings such as sugar, salt, soap, buckets, Vaseline, mineral water etc.

Additional products tend to attract more customers and boost his sales, especially near Christmas time. If his plans succeed, he will reinvest a portion of his revenues in his business and be able to save enough in order to pay school fees for his six children and better provide for his family’s future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for his store

loans.name: Kings Way Group

texts.en:
Rakia is 25 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Currently, all her children attend school. She sells smoked fish, which she started doing three years ago, in the community where she lives. Rakia prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish, and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She buys stocks of fishes from the fish mongers in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She has a high customer base, and the customers travel from the other part of the surrounding communities to buy her fish. She is requesting a loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She dreams of giving her children a quality education. So do the other members.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Kings Way’. She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are small traders, food vendors, and farmers respectively. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. They would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos García C., Labora como encargado de limpieza en el Mercado Israel Lewite  de Managua (Higienista), el tiene Cuatro hijos a su cargo, tres de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado ocho créditos con CEPRODEL durante seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 8 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Hierro y piedra la construcción de un baño.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos García C. is in charge of cleaning Managua's Israel Lewite Market. He is married and has four children under his care, three school age. He has received eight loans from Kiva partner CEPRODEL over six years and has invested the credit in improving his home. He has been an excellent client, and is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, iron and stones to build a bathroom and provide more security and a better quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements and expand his home

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean A. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old, is married, and has eight school-aged children. Mary Jean owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling ready-to-wear items like blouses, shirts and pants in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mary Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana loves her business and that is why she hopes to excel in her business. She sells dried fish at retail prices to her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell. She is married with 3 children, and her youngest child is 15 years old. Her children are exceling in school and this gives her joy. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel L. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 38 years old, is married and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Annabel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Annabel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Annabel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Annabel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Ruby S. is a married woman with two children. Her oldest child is 10 years old. She is involved in rice farming and helps her husband till their rice farm, which is what her family depends on for daily needs. She wants to grow her farm so she could also earn more. She said that it is hard to keep up with the increasing school fees, so she has to work hard for it. 

Ruby would like to request a loan amounting to 10,000 Philippine pesos. She will use it to buy seedlings, fertilizers and other farm inputs she needs.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta N., a rice grower from Trento Agusan Del Sur wishes to obtain a loan. She wants to increase her harvest by buying all the farm supplies she needs.

Loreta has seven children, her eldest being 19 years old. She is quite happy with the income she earns from her rice farm.

Loreta hopes to receive a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because, aside from the fact that it is providing the loan, it also enrolls all its clients in an insurance program.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Hemawathi

texts.en:
Hemawathi is 57 years old, married and living with her husband and 3 children.  They live in the town of Hikkaduwa in the Galle area of Sri Lanka, on the southern coast of the island. Her husband and eldest son run a small fishing business, which she provides support to.  Hemawathi wants to help them purchase a fishing net with this loan.  Her other children are educated.  Hemawathi and her family have a lot of experience in the fishing business.

Hemawathi has requested a 40,000 LKR loan for the fishing business from BRAC to help her husband and son.  She is grateful for BRAC because of the support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Mariah Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Rose is a 36-year-old widow who takes care of four children. Because of the minimal capital she makes out of her seven-year-old boutique business in Mukono, she has not been able to fully educate her children. She has been hardworking, however, as she currently makes close to 70,000 shillings.

Rose’s strong customer care skills have really played into her hands as customers keep on patronizing her boutique. With this loan, she is upbeat that she will be able to buy more stock for her business. She wants to buy new clothes for her boutique.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her boutique

loans.name: Angela Samaria

texts.es: Ángela Samaria tiene 39 años, su actividad es la venta de gaseosas y hot dog. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar de manera independiente. Ya que al tener 1 hijo a su cargo es una persona que tiene mucho interés en proporcionarle  lo más necesario. Además que todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano y ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante pues algunas veces esa era la manera más efectiva de vender. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como pan, salchichas, gaseosas, condimentos. Su deseo es tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Ángela Samaria is 39 years old and sells soft drinks and hot dogs. She has been in this line of work for more than five years and has always liked working independently. She has one child and wants to give him everything she can. She wakes up early every morning to go about touting her goods, since this often the best way to sell them. She is asking for money to buy stock, such as bread, hot dogs, drinks, and condiments. She would like to have her own shop one day.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stock purchases

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Narcisa;   ella tiene 48 años de edad, la socia es casada, tiene 4 hijos,  ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, Nuestra socia trabaja implementando y vendiendo ella misma en su propia tienda de abarrotes. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para implementar la tienda. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Narcisa belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank. She lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, Peru. Narcisa is 48 years old and is married with four children. She owns a small grocery store which she runs and operates herself. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for the store. Narcisa values and is grateful for the support offered by microlending, and she promises to repay the loan as agreed.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia M. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting assorted crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling her own harvested crops in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 31 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used for rice production. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Alicia from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Yawo Agbesi

texts.en: Monsieur Yawo Agbesi D. is 35 years old and sells phone cards to recharge credits for cell phone use in Togo. He is married to another merchant and they have one child together. He sells cards for the three different cell phone companies in Togo - Togocel, Moov, and Illico - which allows him to serve as many customers as possible. He has been selling these cards for the past 4 years. Now he is requesting his second microloan from WAGES of 200,000 CFA francs (the ISO code for this currency is XOF) to purchase 55 more cards. He hopes to increase his income to better care for his young family.

loans.use: To purchase phone cards

loans.name: Jacinta Atieno

texts.en:
Jacinta Atieno A. does farming as a business in Nyamasaria, Kisumu. She started this business in 2007 after quitting vegetable selling which was not earning her sufficient income. She purchases her stock monthly.

With a family of five children, Jacinta wants to expand her business to generate more income so as to be able to effectively support her husband in taking care of the family’s needs. She would like, therefore, to obtain a Ksh 30,000 loan to give her business a boost.

Jacinta is 30 years old and is married. She has a dream of being independent.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a grown daughter. She is a market entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk. Svetlana sells men’s outer wear in the central marketplace of her home town. She has been in business for 10 years. Currently, Svetlana has 70,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her income amounts to 20,000 Grivnyas.  

Svetlana is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase school uniforms for boys that always sell well in the end of summer before the start of a new school year. Increased sales will help Svetlana generate additional income to be re-invested in business development. The clothing sales business is the main source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Astrith Candela

texts.es: A Astrith mujer muy seria no la para nadie trabajando, ni siquiera un accidente de transito que le causó fracturas y por el,   tuvieron que reconstruirle sus pies. Ella es una mujer emprendedora, madre de tres hijos que ya están en las edades de 18 a  26 años y por los cuales ha venido esforzándose día a día, mediante un trabajo persistente en los diversos negocios que ha tenido a lo largo de su carrera y como mama jefe de hogar. Inició en el año 2004 vendiendo café y bebidas aromáticas puerta a puerta y en los centros comerciales, pero una vez sufrió el accidente mencionado, casi sin recuperarse totalmente  empezó a vender mercancía y en la actualidad tiene un negocio donde comercializa cosméticos por catálogos y que la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha venido apoyando hace 4 años; Hoy amerita su credikiva, con el comprará calzado y productos que están en descuento en su catalogo como perfumes, cremas, pinta uñas, delineadores, pestañina, bases y tratamientos de cabello  para continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, porque sueña con adquirir su viviendo en un buen sitio para allí mismo tener su miscelánea y caminar hacia la prosperidad.
texts.en:
Astrith is very serious about her work. Not even the traffic accident that caused her fractures and required reconstructive surgery on her feet caused her to stop working. She is a very entrepreneurial woman and the mother of three children, between the ages of 18 and 26, for whom she has made a great daily effort. She has earned her position as mother head of the household through the work she has done. She began selling coffee and aromatic drinks door to door and in shopping centers. After she had the accident mentioned earlier, she began selling again before she was completely recovered. Now she has a business where she sells cosmetics through catalogs and has been getting encouragement from “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo” for the past four years. She will use the money from this Kiva loan to buy shoes and other items that are being offered at a discount through her catalog; items such as perfumes, creams, nail polish, eyeliners, mascara, and hair treatments. This will allow her to increase her working capital because she hopes to be able to get a house in a good location so that she can run her store from there and move toward prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Kimdy

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimdy S., 50, has been selling vegetables for almost 20 years. She has six children -- four sons and two daughters. Three of them are garment factory workers and the other three are in school. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Kimdy wants to expand her business by buying dried and smoked fish to sell, but she does not have capital. So she is applying for her first loan of $600. She will also use part of her loan to expand her house where she raises cows.

loans.use: To purchase dried and smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Samuel Kivya

texts.en:
Samuel has operated his auto repair garage in Naivasha town since 2000.  He is 46 years old, married to Grace Nyiva and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan well and on time. He is planning to use this loan to buy a new toolbox with new tools for his garage.

loans.use: To buy a new toolbox and new tools for his garage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to sell during holiday season.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very supportive in nature and is always ready to help her family at difficult times. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a private entrepreneur and sells fertilizers & seeds. He has a good clientele base to serve. He also operates a business selling milk & yogurt as a part-time business. He operates his milk shop in the market where he sells his products to many customers.  He will use the loan money to purchase fertilizer & seeds. He is sure that by having these items in bulk quantity he can increase his sales and supply to different other dealers in the market.  

Rubina has four sons and a daughter. Her first two sons are tailors by profession. The younger ones are getting their education from a local school. 
Rubina is hopeful that her husband will be able to bring positive changes to his business after making an investment in it. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She is a responsible client and paid her duties responsibly in previous loan year.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Rubina”.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer & seeds for selling

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Borewala which is a small city in Punjab Province known for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. She lives there in a 2 room brick house in an area named Mujahid colony with her family.  She is a house wife and does her household work by staying at home. She is very supportive and caring in nature and fulfills her responsibilities as a mother and a wife very efficiently. She is the mother of a son and 2 daughters. All of them are studying in different classes. 

She is married to A. A. who is plumber by profession. He offers his services to his customers by repairing their water pipes and taps and also sells sanitary supplies to his customers.  Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will utilize the loan to purchase the water taps, water pipes, etc in bulk quantity for selling.  He has started selling sanitary supplies few years ago and Perveen is confident that after this investment her husband’s business will improve and make his income double in size.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself a responsible client by paying the installments on time.

loans.use: to purchase the water taps, water pipes, etc in bulk quantity for selling.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. She also buys and sells coconuts, fruits & vegetables. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional livestock and as working capital. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Evangelene

texts.en:
Evangelene J. is from the village of Punta, near Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 grown children. To make a living, Evangelene owns & operates a transportation service business. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Evangelene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be Evangelene’s second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Las Originales Group

texts.es:
Las Originales grupo conformado por tres mujeres esforzadas, emprendedoras y luchadoras una de ellas es la   señora Juana O. comerciante de calzado. Ella es la coordinadora del grupo e  inicio su negocio hace siete años junto con su esposo quien se encarga de la producción de zapatos mientras ella los distribuye en la zona franca.

O. desea ampliar su negocio en especial por las ventas de diciembre que son una de las más grandes del año. 
Las otras dos integrantes del grupo son Darling S. quien desde hace más de tres años vende cosméticos Avon, marca de gran prestigio en Nicaragua y Deyanira H. tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde invertirá en telas e hilos.
texts.en:
The group “Las Originales” (The Originals) consists of three industrious, enterprising, and determined women. One of them is Sra. Juana O., a shoe merchant. She is the group coordinator and started her business seven years ago with her husband, who is in charge of producing the shoes while she sells them in the free trade zone.

Sra. O. wants to expand her business, especially her sales for December since it is one of the busiest times of the year.

The other members of the group are Darling S., who has been selling Avon cosmetics for three years (a well-known brand in Nicaragua), and Deyanira H., who has a small sewing workshop and wants to invest in fabrics and thread.

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies for making shoes

loans.name: Paul Mwachongo

texts.en: Paul Mwachongo M. is 24 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom attend school. Paul has been selling timber for the last five years and his business is doing well. This is Paul's second loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase more timber. The anticipated profits will be used for his children’s education. His dream for his family is to improve their standard of living. Paul also hopes to own several other businesses in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran belongs to a small city in Punjab Pakistan called Kasur, which is known for its tanneries industry. She lives there with her family in a 3 room brick house. Sughran's husband’s name is B. A. and he works in a brick furnace for a low income. Sughran has given birth to 6 children: 3 sons and 3 daughters. Her elder son also works in a brick furnace while her elder daughter does embroidery by staying at home. Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.

Sughran operates a dairy business at her home to earn income for her family. For this purpose she has some buffaloes at her home. She gets milk from these buffaloes every day and sells to her local area clients. She is known in the region for her quality services and has been operating this business for 15 years.

Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her dairy business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo which will increase the production of milk and increase her sales. She is very confident that her business will grow further after the loan investment and believes she will easily be able to return the loan in installments.

She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit record behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandra; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de profesora en el distrito de Maras, la socia por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar e su trabajo como profesora estudiando y aprendiendo mas y de esta manera enseñar a sus alumnos. La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandra is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor Pasion”, which is located in the District of Yucay, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 37 years old, single, and has one child. Alejandra divides her time between her daily activities and her job as a teacher in the District of Maras. Through her work, her child has the chance to get ahead. Alejandra wants to improve in her job as a teacher by studying and learning more so that she can teach her students. She is requesting a loan for personal use.

Alejandra is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvin  M. tiene 28 años y vive en el barrio ciudadela 20 de Julio de la ciudad de Barranquilla, muy cerca al escenario deportivo de futbol más importantes de Colombia. Allí tiene su negocio de venta de productos electrónicos, como parlantes,, consolas, bafles y repuestos para equipos de sonidos, negocio que inició después de haber terminado su carrera como analista y programador de computadores en el año 2010 y que inició en sociedad con su hermana.  Sus clientes  son los propietarios de grandes equipos de sonidos, o pickup, familias que adicionan a sus computadores accesorios para ampliar sus posibilidades  de velocidad en su equipo  y peatones del sector que identifican  elementos que Marvin vende y que  son satisfactores de sus necesidades. El  gran propósito de Marvin es ampliar el inventario de mercancías, para hacer acorde sus  ofertas de productos,  con la actualización que sus clientes requieren en el tema de tecnología  moderna. 
Con su negocio Marvin obtiene una rentabilidad del diez y siete por ciento y desde este margen proyecta su crecimiento, para generar posibilidades exitosa a su  familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 5 años.  Este es su primer financiamiento  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y  su primer credikiva, con él  planea comprar parlantes, consolas, bases para parlantes, repuestos para equipos de sonidos, al por mayor y de contado, lo cual pronostica una inversión exitosa, en la medida en que con esta compra obtendrá descuentos que trasladará a sus clientes, porque la satisfacción del cliente es su máxima.
texts.en:
Marvin M., 28, lives in Barranquilla’s 20 de Julio neighborhood, very near Colombia’s most important football stadium.  He has his business there selling electronic products like speakers, consoles, loudspeakers and sound system replacement parts, a business he started, in partnership with his sister, when he graduated as a Computer Analyst and Programmer in 2010.

His customers are owners of large sound systems, or pickups; families that add on to their computers components to expand speed, and passersby in the area that notice what things Marvin has for sale and decide that they meet their needs.  Marvin’s main goal is to expand his inventory of merchandise so that he can meet customer demand for upgrades to more modern technology.

Marvin’s profit margin in the business is 17% and he calculates improving from this point in order to provide his family, which consists of his wife and two children, who are 3 and 5 years of age, with successful possibilities.

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and his first Kiva loan.  He plans to use it to buy speakers, consoles, speaker stands and sound system replacement parts at wholesale and paying cash.  He foresees a successful investment because he will be able to get discounts to pass on to his customers because customer satisfaction is his motto.

loans.use: To buy speakers, consoles, speaker stands, sound system replacement parts at wholesale and for cash.

loans.name: Mary Wanja

texts.en:
Mary W. has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years.  She is 36 years old, married to Joseph Waithaji, and they have three children. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings.

In the future, Mary hopes to buy more land and practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La Sra. Andrea pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”, del Distrito D. Tarapoto. Está Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre D. 02 hijos, uno D. los cuales todavía depenD. D. ella.

Motivada desD. muy pequeña por su gusto a la máquina D. coser, los hilos y las agujas, Andrea realizó estudios técnicos en Corte y Confección, con lo que emprendió su negocio D. Costura,  lleva aproximadamente 12 años dedicándose a este rubro, poco a poco fue haciéndose conocida y ahora cuenta con una fiel clientela a quienes atienD. con pedidos; nos cuenta que tiene bastante trabajo por la etapa escolar, también cose vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños, pantalones D. vestir y mucho más, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas al por mayor, D. diferentes especies y colores, tijeras, hilos en carretes granD. y D. variados colores, agujas D. coser y D. máquina, alfileres y botones.

Andrea se siente una mujer realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad todos sueños y está agradecida al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad D. salir adelante como mujer y empresaria.
texts.en:
Andrea belongs to the “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz” [Our Lady of Peace] community bank , of the district of Tarapoto. She is married, 56 years old, and has 2 children, one of whom still depends on her.  

She has been motivated by her love of the sewing machine, thread and needles since she was very young. Andrea studied at the Cutting and Tailoring school, and began her sewing business. She has been working in this area for approximately 12 years. Little by little, she became known and now she has faithful clientele whose orders she fills. She tells us that she has a lot of work because of the school year. She also sews suits for women, men and children, dress pants and much more. Her business is located in her own house.   

With this loan of S/. 2500.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy different types and  colors of fabric wholesale, different colored thread in large spools, sewing needles and sewing machine needles, pins and buttons.  

Andrea feels like an accomplished woman, eager to reach her dreams and make them reality. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving her the chance to get ahead as a woman and business owner.

loans.use: to buy different types and colors of fabrics wholesale, as well as scissors, different colored thread in large spools, sewing needles, pins and buttons.

loans.name: Juliet Natalaray Group

texts.en:
Juliet N. is from the village of Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of this three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.
Juliet is 23 years old, widowed and has one infant-aged child. She owns and operates a retail store, selling dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month.
In August 2010, Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new products to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods for her retail store

loans.name: Favian

texts.es: Favian de 41 Años de edad, está casado con Marcelina de 35 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 04 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa ubicados en la comunidad de Villa el Salvador Anexo del distrito de Kimbiri. La labor que realiza Favian es labrar la tierra, donde viene cultivando plantas de  café y plátano, en total cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno. Aprendió el trabajo del campo en las tierras de sus padres quienes le enseñaron a remover la tierra y creció con los anhelos de poseer su propia parcela. Ahora con sus ahorros acumulados pudo concretar sus ansias de contar con su propio terreno, es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo; donde viene trabajando 22 años y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y jornaleros. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano disfruta de la calidad de los frutos de su sembrío las cuales son muy cotizadas en los puntos de venta. Menciona además que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas, por lo cual Favian solicita el crédito para la  compra de insecticidas para combatir las plagas que asechan sus cultivos; en lo futuro comprara más tierras para aumentar su producción. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará insecticidas para fumigar la plaga que asechan sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Favian, 41 years old, is married to Marcelina, 35, and together they have 4 children. They live together in their own home located in the community of Villa el Salvador Anexo in the district of Kimbiri. 

Favian works the land where they grow coffee and plantains on a total of 3 hectares. He learned how to work in the field on his parents' land, who taught him how to remove the dirt. His desire to own his own parcel of land grew. Now with his accumulated savings he was able to fulfill this desire for his own land. He is familiar with hard work in the fields. He has been doing it for 22 years, and during harvest time he has help from his children and seasonal workers. He feels very committed to his work, since thanks to his daily efforts he is able to enjoy quality fruits from his plantings which are sought-after in the food stalls. 

He also mentions that the hardest part is guarding his crops from insects, which is why he is asking for a loan to buy insecticides to combat the plagues that stalk his crops. In the future he will buy more land to increase his production. This is his second loan with MFP. He has been very punctual with his payments and expects to continue to be so. With the 1000 nuevos soles that he has requested, he will buy insecticides to fumigate the insects that threaten his crops.

loans.use: to buy insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a married father of 10 children aged 5-26 years old. Johnson has other dependents and he is the only income earner in the family. Johnson works very hard to provide for his family of 13 people. He lives with them in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. 

His family's goal is to make sure that his children have a better life and get educated. For 15 years he has been running a produce business and he has no significant challenges in this business. He started by farming and then saved to start the business. He hopes his business will improve in the future. Johnson needs the loan to purchase maize for resale.

loans.use: To purchase maize for resale.

loans.name: Saltanat's Group

texts.en:
Saltanat is a young leader of this group. She is 24 and married to a barman. Together they bring up a newly born child. 

Two years ago, Saltanat’s husband received a livestock inheritance from his parents. In order to contribute additional money to the family budget, Saltanat breeds and resells livestock at the higher price. She started livestock breeding two years ago and during this period her business was successful. She earns 1500 soms per month. Saltanat decided to apply for the loan because she needs additional funds in order to increase her number of livestock. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase an additional four animals for breeding. In the future, this young woman wishes to purchase a house in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase four livestock animals.

loans.name: Sam On

texts.en:
Sam On, 53 years old, has been a primary teacher for about 10 years with $3 per day for the income. His wife stays home taking care of the children. They have five children, 25, 20, 18, 13, and 7 years old. Two of her children are studying and the other three are working in Thailand. All of them get $13 per day for their income. Because his son and daughter are staying in Thailand, he is in charge of taking good care of their children for everything. 
There are eight members in his household including his four grandsons. 

Every month, he has to spend $55 on food, $3 on electricity, $15 on school fees and $20 for other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy columns and wood to repair his house. He will keep his career as a teacher until he retires because he loves this career.

loans.use: To buy columns and wood to repair the house.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with five children, all of whom have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a hawking business, selling secondhand clothes and shoes to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of secondhand clothes and shoes. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of secondhand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana Isabel tiene 49 años, Es soltera vive con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Juana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es aumentar la produccion y tener su propio terreno.

Le gusta trabajar para tener dinero.
texts.en:
Juana Isabel, 49, is single and live with her children in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES , which is involved in growing corn and rice, is located in the Los Ángeles community which belongs to the Ventanas Canton.

Juana grows corn and rice, buying her supplies in Comercial Procan and selling her produce in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan to plant corn and rice, and to buy supplies and fertilizer.  With the help of the loan she will be able to meet her needs.  Her dream is to increase production and buy her own land.

She enjoys working to make money.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Mariatu J.l.

texts.en:
Mariatu, age 41, sells grocery items such as bagged rice, milk, butter, beverages, five-gallon containers of oil, batteries, cosmetics, and soaps. She established her business in 2003. She had left school and got married, and her husband urged her to start a business to help provide a livelihood for their family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month. 

Mariatu is requesting a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cartons of maggi, bags of rice, crates of eggs, containers of oil, and cartons of paste. She is confident that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to increase business by opening another shop, hiring workers, traveling to Guinea where she will serve as a supplier, and adding basic pharmacy items to her inventory. She plans to gain a larger number of customers, particularly for rice.  

Mariatu and her husband have two children, ages seven and 13. She has five additional dependents who live with her because they are relatives from both her own and her husband's sides of the family, and she and her husband support these dependents in their senior secondary schooling. 

Mariatu is a hard-working and reliable entrepreneur. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of maggi, bags of rice, crates of eggs, containers of oil, and cartons of paste to stock in her store

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Fatmata, a married mother of two children aged 14 and 16 years. In 2009, she established her hair product and beauty salon business in order to become self-reliant and because she had prior experience in hair dressing. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,100,000 every month.

Now requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy more hairdressing materials to improve her business, Fatmata hopes the loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 225,000. In the future, she plans to build a big salon and educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more hair products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda  has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.
