Son mari est chômeur (sans emploi) depuis 1996, c'est-à-dire depuis le début des événements des guerres en RD Congo.   
Tabu E. est entrepreneur d’un cafeteria (mini restaurant) installé dans le quartier Virunga, avenue coin du marché. Elle a commencé son entreprise de mini Restaurant  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari après l’éruption du 16-17 février 2002 du volcan Nyiragongo qui a complètement détruit la ville de Goma.  Madame Tabu E. s’est retrouvée aussi  victime de cette éruption volcanique, sinistrée, sans abris. Son capital initial était 100$ et un peu plus tard, elle fut informée de l’IMF Hekima qui donne des crédits aux pauvres sans aucune garantie a travers les groupes de crédit, delà, elle bénéficie son 1er crédit de renforcement.
Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, Tabu E. souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant des aliments : 1 sacs de haricots, 25 kilos de riz, 2 caisses de sucrés Fanta, 2 bidons d’huile végétale Rina, 20 kilos de pommes de terre, 3 régimes de bananes, 10 kilos de viandes, des poissons, legumes, etc.
Le grand défi de madame Tabu E. c’est que les gens n’achètent pas lors qu’il n’y a pas d’argent en circulation. Malgré tout cela Tabu E. y tire son maximum de bénéfice, car la nourriture est la priorité des priorités de tout homme. Madame Tabu E. est confortable avec son business.
Dans ses projets, elle souhaite construire une maison dans son ancienne parcelle où la coulée de lave de l’éruption du volcan nyiragongo ait traversé. En outre, elle tient à payer régulièrement les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
Madame Tabu E. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits permanents qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille dit- elle.  
Ce groupe Ahadi est  composé de 17 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Ms. Tabu E. is the president of the loan group Adhadi.  (In the photo, she is the one raising her hand).  She is 55 years old and has eight children, among whom four are appropriately studying and some are already adults.  Her husband has been unemployed since 1996, that is, since the start of hostilities in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.  Tabu is the entrepreneur of a cafeteria (mini-restaurant) set up in the Virunga district at a neighborhood market.  She started this mini-restaurant enterprise with her own funds received from her husband after the eruption of the Nyiragongo volcano February 16 and 17, 2002 which completely destroyed the city of Goma.  Stricken and homeless, she too found herself a victim of this volcanic eruption. Her initial capital was $100.  A little later, she was informed of the micro-finance institution Hekima, which lends to the poor, without any collateral, through loan groups.  From that, she is benefiting from her first reinforcement loan. With the loan from MFI Hekima, Tabu wishes to increase her sales by buying:  a sack of beans, 25 kilos of rice, two cases of Fanta soda, two containers of Rina vegetable oil, 20 kilos of potatoes, three bunches of bananas, 10 kilos of meat, some fish, vegetables, etc.  The big challenge of hers is that people do not buy when there is no money in circulation.  Despite all this, she is deriving as much profit as she can, since food is the priority of all priorities of anyone.  She is comfortable with her business. In her plans, she wishes to build a house on her former parcel of land where the flow of lava of the erupting Nyiragongo volcano crossed.  In addition, she is determined to cover the costs of her children's schooling on a regular basis.  Tabu thanks the MFI Hekima for the repeated loans she receives without any collateral at all because, given these loans, she says she is managing to provide for her family. The group Adhadi is composed of seventeen members, most of whom are women. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A sack of beans, 25 kilos of rice, two cases of Fanta soda, two containers of Rina vegetable oil, 20 kilos of potatoes, three bunches of bananas, 10 kilos of meat, some fish, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es: José Alberto A. S., tiene la edad de 48 años, está casado, y vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José Alberto también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
José Alberto A. S. is 48 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 6 children who are his biggest priority. He wants the loan to help his farm, specifically to grow coffee. The idea is to buy the manure and fertilizer. He wishes to care adequately for the coffee crop in order to get a better quality and to get the greatest possible income when it’s harvest time. It’s the first time he has applied for a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with how easy they made it for him. Mr. José Alberto has also worked for many years in farming. He hopes to offer his family a better quality of life in the future and more economic stability. And he hopes to be able to continue to grow as a person and a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Assistance for growing coffee

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es: La solicitante es casada, tiene su negocio de venta de comida frente a la ciudad universitaria su mayor afluencia de publico son los estudiantes de la UNICA. Su esposo trabaja por la sierra como ingeniero tiene 2 hijas como carga familiar. Su casa es de material noble. Solicita el credito pa incremento de capital y arreglo de su local.
texts.en:
This client is married and has her own food sales business in front of the university. Her greatest influx from the public is the students of UNICA (Universidad Nacional ‘San Luis Gonzaga’ de Ica). Her husband works in the mountains as an engineer. She has 2 daughters under her care and their house is made with solid materials. She is requesting the loan to increase capital and to make repairs to her place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital and maintenance work on business

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en:
H. Nasim is 37 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Nasim is running his own butcher shop. He has had a butcher shop and meat selling business for 12 years. He provides the markets with meat and his family with necessary food. Now, Nasim is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro entrepreneur and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan. Nasim is counting on your help. Your support will really help him. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Meat supply to expand his business.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es productora lechera y su esposo es Profesor Normalista quien trabaja en Achacachi. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Irama Belén de la Provincia Omasuyos Achacachi. 

El préstamo lo destinará para la refacción de su establo de vacas.

Es primer crédito con Impro a través de Kiva. Por la actividad económica que Manuela realiza y por el análisis socioeconómico, el crédito es viable.
texts.en:
Manuela is a dairy farmer and her husband is an elementary school teacher in Achacachi. They live in the community of Irama Belén in the province of Omasuyos Achacachi. The loan will be used to renovate the cows’ stable. This is Manuela’s first loan with Kiva partner Impro. Because of the job that she does, and after a socioeconomic analysis, we have determined that Manuela qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to renovate cows' stable

loans.name: Theodette

texts.en:
Theodette is 45 years old and is married with eight children who are between 8 and 23 years old.

Theodette is well-known in the business of selling different items, mainly building and electrical items. Her business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening. She has been in this business for about two years.

Theodette needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a in order to expand her business. With this loan, she will hopefully increase the number of her customers as well as her profits. With these profits, she will keep reinvesting in her business for better financial stability. This, in turn, will allow her to continue taking care of her family and save for the future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of electrical and building items

loans.name: Laura Lourdes

texts.es:
C. B. LAURA LOURDES

Hace seis años Laura emprende en el negocio de crianza de cuyes, es muy gracioso escucharla decir que estos animalitos no le gustaban de joven y que ahora es un sustento para su hogar.
Fue en el cumpleaños de su prima quien le regaló cuatro cuyes hembras para que empiece a criarlos, tuvo que comprar un macho para la reproducción, el alimento que les da a estos animalitos es alfalfa, harina de pescado y afrechin. El primer crédito que recibió lo invirtió para comprar medicamento de desparasitación lo cual lo hace dos veces al año.
Las hembras salieron preñadas; las crías los venden cuando tienen unos cuantos meses de crecido, a veces también lo utiliza para su propia alimentación. Actualmente tiene dieciocho cuyes y dos hembras quienes están preñadas. Estas ventas le ayudan en educar a sus hijos uno está estudiando en la universidad la especialidad de Físico-Matemática y los otros dos aún estudian en el colegio. El préstamo es para compra un macho y comprar alimento balanceado. Asimismo Laura cocina en una parroquia de Huarochiri donde percibe un ingreso mas para su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Laura Lourdes C. Briceño Laura began raising guinea pigs as a business 6 years ago. It's comical to hear her say that as a child she didn't like these little critters but how they now help support the household. It was on a cousin's birthday when she received 4 female guinea pigs so she could begin raising them; she had to purchase a male to begin reproduction. The animals are fed alfalfa, fishmeal, and bran. She invested her first loan in deworming medication which she applies twice a year. The females turned out pregnant and the offspring are later sold after a few months, she even sometimes uses them to feed herself. She currently has 18 guinea pigs, 2 of which are pregnant. The sales are helping her get her children through school, one is at the university specializing in physics-math and her other two children are still in school. The loans is for the purchase of balanced feed, and a male guinea pig. Laura also cooks at a parish in Huarochiri as another form of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn C. is from the village of Bacolod, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ginalyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Ginalyn has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3000 PHP when she sells her raised animal.

In 2010, Ginalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the 1st loan that Ginalyn has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mr. Yat S. and his wife, Mrs. Sarum Ket, have been married since 1979 and have six children--four sons and two daughters. Two of their sons are married and live outside the family home and the other two are construction workers. Both daughter are garment factory workers.

Yat is a fisherman. His wife sells the fish that her husband catches. He is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to purchase fishing nets for his fishing business. 

In the past, Mrs. Sarum Ket used to be a silk weaver, but she quit the business.

Photo: Yat’s wife.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets for his fishing business

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William O. is a 50-year-old married father of four children. William is a supplier of building materials in Shanzu Mombasa and has been supplying them to builders for four years. 

William is borrowing his second loan from KADET LTD, and with this loan, William plans to buy building bricks and cement for resale. 

William hopes to educate his children well and to become a leading supplier of construction materials in the future.

loans.use: To purchase building bricks and cement.

loans.name: Kisoboka Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: For the last 6 years, N. Mary, a 35-year-old mother of 3, has kept a level head in the face of financial challenges to keep her herbal natural medicine business afloat. Her business, located in Kisoga-Mukono, was started with support from her husband. Prior to that, Mary was involved in selling poultry. She earns up to 200,000 UGX in weekly profits. She attributes her success to her self-determination and relentless hard work. Mary says she will use this loan to purchase more containers to package her herbal medicines. Mary is affliated with Kisoboka Development Group-Mukono.

loans.use: to purchase more containers to package her herbal natural medicines

loans.name: Abudalahim

texts.en:
Abudalahim is 55 years old. He is married and has four children between the ages of 14 and 20. Two of his children go to school. Abudalahim is a tailor and his wife works as a knitter. He has had this business for 30 years. 

With this loan, he will buy more fabric to make various items of clothing, which he will sell. With the profit, he will renovate his house. He says that his business is successful because he knows how to tailor ladies' dresses well. In the future, he would like to export his tailored clothes to neighboring countries.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Safari

texts.en: Safari is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. He operates a green grocery business selling sukumawiki (green vegetables) and tomatoes on a retail basis to his neighbors and passersby. Safari faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the hot summer season, the supply of sukumawiki is low, hence not satisfying customer needs. He hopes to open a retail shop in the future. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase iron sheets, timber and labor charges to renovate his house. He decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets, timber and labor to renovate his house

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 61 years old. He is married and has two children, aged 25 and 23. Rogelio has been a farmer for more than a few years already. He enjoys spending time at the farm, keeping it free of weeds and pests. He aims to increase his harvest and earn a better income. 

Rogelio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen A. is a 21-year-old woman who has been working in a garment factory as a seamstress in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has done this work for over two years, and she always receives a salary every month. 

Sen A. has partnered with her father who is a silk seller in another province. They share the responsibility of supporting the family’s daily expenses. Presently, Sen A.’ father thinks that his business is very profitable for him and the family. That is the reason why Sen A. will use her loan to go toward purchasing extra silks for her father’s business.

loans.use: To purchase extra silks to sell

loans.name: Renovacion Las Aguilas 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Renovacion las Aguilas 3 (eagles renewal). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She says that her dream is to have her own house. 

Maria is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for amost 2 years, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different products like clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to sell. 

Maria began with us because she wants to progress and have a business. Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water—none of which is potable.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products to sell

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday T. is currently in the bussiness of selling aicohol and food stuffs.  She is requesting a loan from Brac Southern Sudan in order to stock more beer, soft drinks, etc. to sell.  She is 45 years old and is widowed.  Monday has 4 children and 1 goes to school.  She hopes to build a concrete shop in the future.

loans.use: To stock more beer, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin B. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Kevin has a business selling clothes, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Kevin has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Kevin hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to build a house. Kevin is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her more about family planning and how to protect against HIV/AIDS.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: Monsieur Kossivi  est marié et a 26 ans. Il fait le commerce  de produits d’alimentation générale. Il a commencé en 2006 cette activité et s’approvisionne au grand de Lomé. Il revend les produits dans un marché local de hedzranawoé  et  est dans son deuxième cycle de prêt. Il  demande un crédit  pour acheter 5 boites de tomates, 4 cartons de sucre et 10 sacs de riz.
texts.en: Mr. Kossivi is 26 years old and married. He is in business selling groceries. He has launched his business in 2006 and stocks up at the big [market] of Lomé. He resells his products at the local market of Hedzranawoé and is now on his second loan cycle. He is seeking a loan in order to buy five cartons of tomatoes, four cartons of sugar and 10 bags of rice.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina, de 37 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Manuel (35); que es obrero, y su pequeña hija; juntos buscan progresar cada día. 

Desde hace cinco  años esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca, y tiene clientes que le compran seguido, pues además de ofrecer con su catalogo,  también ofrece en su vitrina instalada en su casa. Le gusta mucho este negocio pues es tranquilo y puede cuidar a su hija sin problemas, además no solo recibe ganancias por sus ventas si no también por la cantidad de pedidos recibe incentivos de la compañía, pues la premian con electrodomésticos que puede utilizar o vender. Así transcurren los días de Dina que además prepara chupetes de hielo y chicha (refresco de maíz morado) durante la época veraniega, que vende en su casa. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y surtir otra vitrina. 

Dina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de variedad de mercadería en productos de belleza pues quiere surtir mejor su negocio para mejorar sus ganancias. 

Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Dina, 37, lives in her house with her husband, Manuel, 35, who is a laborer, and their small daughter; together they seek to make progress every day.

Five years ago this enterprising woman went into business selling beauty products of a well known brand.  She has customers that buy from her often because besides offering items via catalogue she also has a display case set up at home.  She likes the business very much because it’s calm and she can care for her daughter problem free.  Besides, she doesn’t just earn profits through sales but the firm also offers incentives depending on the number of orders she places; they reward her with home appliances that she can either use herself or sell.

Dina’s days go by this way although during the summer she also prepares “chupetes” which are made from ice and chicha (a beverage made from purple corn) that she sells from home.  Because she’s an enterprising woman she’s planning to expand her beauty products sales business in the future installing a second, stocked display case.

Dina plans to use the requested funds to buy a selection of beauty product merchandise to better stock her business to improve profits.

This is her ninth loan with MFP and she promises to pay her installments punctually because she does not want to disappoint the people who made the money, which will allow her to stay in business seeking progress, possible.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, who is currently in the business of selling bread and tomatoes, is 22 years old, married to a teacher, and the mother of three children, two of whom  go to school. She is requesting a loan to stock more bread and tomatoes to sell. In the future, Rose hopes to build a concrete house with the extra profits arising from her business.

loans.use: To stock more bread and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Bella Argelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Bella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 55 años y es madre de 02  hijos, ambos independientes.

Bella es una mujer eficiente y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en un pequeño ambiente muy bien acondicionado ubicado en su misma casa,  actualmente tiene como  clientes fijos a amigos y vecinos del barrio. Nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien en su negocio. 

Su puntualidad, orden y  optimismo le ayudó a crecer como mujer independiente y está muy orgullosa con lo logrado. Con su primer crédito de 250 Nuevos Soles se inició en la venta de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará  ropa  para surtir su stock como: camisas, pantalones y faldas  para la época escolar, shorts y blusas sport en todas las tallas y modelos y colores, polos y vestidos para adultos y niños. 

Se siente una mujer realizada  por lo que agradece que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos. También manifiesta su satisfacción porque ahora cuenta con un Seguro de Vida de muy bajo costo, tal como siempre lo ha esperado, este producto le da la tranquilidad a ella y a su familia ante cualquier situación que le pueda ocurrir.
texts.en:
Bella belongs to the communal bank “Santa Bárbara II” in the district of Tarapoto in the department of San Martín. She's 55 and lives with her partner. She has two children, both of whom are independent. 

Bella is an efficient and capable woman. She sells garments in a small, well-equipped area in her own home. She currently has customers among her friends and neighbors. The tell her that her business is going very well.

Her punctuality, orderliness, and optimism help her grow as an independent woman and she's very proud of what she's achieved. With her first loan of 250 Nuevos Soles she began selling clothing for women and men. 

With this loan of 1,700 Nuevos Soles ($625 USD) she will buy clothing to increase her stock: shirts, pants, and skirts for the school season; shorts and sport blouses in all sizes, models, and colors; and Polos and dresses for adults and children. 

She feels like a fully-realized woman, for which she thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement. She's also grateful for life security at a low cost, just as she's always hoped for. This product provides her and her family with tranquility in the face of anything that might occur.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, and skits for the school season; shorts, sport blouses , polos, and dresses for adults and children.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice, 33 years old and married with one child, has been selling clothes for four years, working hard in her business to support her family. Through business training offered by Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to manage her business and hopes to expand her business in order to become financially stable in the future.  Alice has requested 20,000 Kes to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Clemencia Beneranda

texts.es:
La Señora. Clemencia P. es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por la comunidad de La Gloria en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia tiene hermosos paisajes y una amplia gastronomía, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, son personas amables y de un corazón muy calido.

La Señora. Clemencia tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 12 años de edad y todos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en su taller de carpintería, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Clemencia tiene una sastrería en su casa, no tiene un horario fijo y trabaja de domingo a domingo. Ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia y ahora realiza todo tipo de costuras.

Está en el banco comunal hace 2 años y tiene una gran amistada con todas las socias, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir una parte para la compra de tela y también para la realización de la tesis de grado de su hijo.

Su meta es tener un taller mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Clemencia P. is a member of the "Siempre Amigas" ["Forever Friends"] communal bank. She lives in the community of La Gloria, in Del Valle parish. This parish has beautiful scenery and a varied cuisine. Its people are dedicated to trade, raising animals, and agriculture. They are friendly people with very warm hearts. 

Clemencia is 45 years old and married, with 3 children aged 17, 15 and 12, all of whom are studying at a school in the city. Her husband works in a carpentry workshop. With the work of both spouses, they have been able to build their own home. 

Clemencia has a tailoring shop in her home. She does not have fixed working hours, and she works every day from Sunday to Sunday. She learned how to cut and tailor clothing at an academy, and now she makes all types of garments.. 

She has been in the communal bank for 2 years, and she has a great friendship with all of the members. The funds from her loan will be invested in part in buying fabric, and also for the expenses related to her son's graduation thesis. 

Her goal is to have a much larger tailoring workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric and pay expenses for her son's graduation thesis.

loans.name: María Marisel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María,  tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 7 años los mismos que  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 años y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y se entretiene mucho en las reuniones.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual venden todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. También vende artículos para el hogar, para lo cual visita  a sus clientes dos veces por semana aunque también los vende en su local. Los productos de la tienda los recibe en su local y los artículos para el hogar los compra en Portoviejo en una distribuidora. Nos cuenta que lleva más de 10 años con su tienda y que ha crecido poco a poco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda con productos de primera necesidad y artículos para el hogar.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The 3 de Mayo (May 3) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo’s Picoaza Parish, a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feast day of Saints Peter and Paul and for the joy of its people.

We met María, 42, here.  She’s married and has two children who are 10 and 7 years of age and going to school.  Her husband is an Auto Mechanic.  She’s been in the communal bank for 6 years and likes it because her fellow members are very united and she entertains herself a lot in the meetings.

She has a home based grocery store where she sells all types of products like: rice, sugar, oil, detergents, among other things.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  She also sells items for the home.  For this she visits her customers twice a week although he also sells them in her store.  Merchandise for the store is delivered to her there and the articles for the home she buys in Portoviejo from a distributor.  She tells us that she’s had her store for over ten years and that it has gradually grown.

She is going to use this loan to better stock her store with basic use items and items for the home.  Her goals are to stay in business and that her store grows more each day.

loans.use: to buy basic need items and items for the home.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: Elvis, tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja Melida, de 30 años, y con su hijo Ángel de 2 años, en su casa propia, ubicado en la localidad de “Alto Yapaz”. La agricultura, es su actividad principal desde hace 6 años, por lo que cuenta con terrenos propios para cultivar y aplicar todas las técnicas agrícolas que le enseñó su padre, por eso de manera ordenada cuida sus cultivos de plátano, frutas cítricas, café y piña, permitiéndole a su cónyuge que le ayude a fertilizarlos cuando ya estén limpios, sin maleza alguna. Lo que más le gusta en su labor es cosechar y encajonar los frutos para embarcarlos directamente  a los mercados de la ciudad de “Huancayo” y “Lima”, sacando un aproximado de cuanto serán sus ganancias, sin embargo le incomoda pagar un precio exagerado por el traslado de sus cosechas. Por ello está pensado invertir en la compra de un camión con el que pueda trasladarse sin mayores inconvenientes. Pero como su actividad es muy rentable, En adelante, quiere comprar más terrenos que le generen mayor productividad, también quiere construir otra casa con mayores comodidades para su familia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los progresistas”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde cuenta que le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal, porque esta integrado por  personas solidarias, responsables y honestas. Elvis, comenzará la recolectar los granos maduros de café. Por ello con el crédito comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para que le ayuden a nivelar su producción.
texts.en:
Elvis, 29, lives with his partner, Melinda, 30, and with his two-year-old son, Ángel, in his own house located in Alto Yapaz.  His main occupation for the last six years has been farming.  He has fields of his own to farm and apply all the farming techniques he learned from his father.  He, therefore, cares for his banana, citrus, coffee and pineapple crops in an orderly way.  He lets his spouse help him fertilize them once they are completely free of weeds.  

What he likes best about his work is harvesting and crating the fruit to ship it directly to markets in the cities of Huancayo and Lima and calculating an approximate estimate of his profits.  However, it annoys him to have to pay exorbitant fees to transport his crops.  Because of this he’s planning to buy a truck so that he can transport without so many inconveniences.  However, because his activity is quite profitable, he wants to buy more land that will increase production and he also wants to buy another house with more comforts for his family.

He is a member of the “Los Progresistas” (The Progressive Ones) communal bank and this is the third loan with MFP.  He relates that he enjoys working with his communal bank because it’s composed of supportive, responsible and honest people. 

Elvis is about to start harvesting ripe coffee beans.  Because of this he will use the loan to buy several sacks of organic manure that will help him balance production.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Maksatbek

texts.en:
Maksatbek is 40, married and has three children. He dreamed to be a lawyer and entered university, but because of the death of his father and necessity of taking care of his mother and family, he had to return to his native village. Today Maksatbek is engaged in cattle breeding and land-cultivating businesses, which were started in 1996. Also he practices working at the local sawmill in order to find an additional means of subsistence. He works hard and has managed to raise his initial capital from 30.000 KGS to floating capital in the sum of 100.000 KGS. Today his farm, which has amounted to two cows and twenty sheep, still needs to be developed. Maksatbek has applied for a loan of 100.000 KGS for purchasing cattle. With the revenues, he plans further development of his farm.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is 67 years old and resides with her child, her grandchild and her husband at Siem Reap province, a place known for tourism.  She is a professional handicrafter, making and selling bamboo baskets at the local market. She has been doing this job since 1993 and is able to make about US $5 of profit each day. 

Her husband stays at home and helps her make and sell baskets. Her child is 26 years old, also making and selling bamboo baskets with an income of US $5 per day. 

Each month, she has to spend US $75 on food and US $20 on other expenses. 

Thy has asked for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase bamboo to make more baskets. In the future, she hopes she will attain a good living standard by selling baskets.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to make baskets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for making jars

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras se denomina el comité formado en la ciudad de Curuguaty. Se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Aida quien se mostró muy interesada en el programa.El grupo esta en el segundo ciclo y cuenta con once integrantes quienes han demostrado solidaridad y unión las unas con las otras.
Todas manifiestan que aprendieron a trabajar en equipo para una mejor calidad de vida por lo que hoy están mas fortalecidas en sus actividades actuales.
La Sra. Doraliz se dedica a la cría y venta de animales. Ella se dedica a esto hace ya unos años. Todos en el barrio la conocen, tiene un grupo de clientes que compran de ella los animales.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas animales, ademas de eso quiere comprar los balanceados para poder alimentarlos.
texts.en:
Mujeres Emprendedoras [Enterprising Women] as this committee is called, was formed in the city of Curuguaty because of the initiative of Señora Aida who was very interested in the program.  The group is in its second cycle and has eleven members who have shown unity and support for each other.  All express that they learned to work as a team for a better quality of life.  Today, they are more empowered in their current activities.   

Señora Doraliz has been raising and selling animals for several years.  Everyone in her neighborhood knows her and she has a group of customers that buy animals from her.  

She is requesting a loan to buy more animals and balanced feed.

loans.use: purchase more animals to raise and sell and to purchase balanced feed.

loans.name: Laarnie

texts.en: Laarnie, a 21-year-old married woman with an eight-month-old child, is a farmer who, along with her husband, has been growing rice for five years. Laarnie, who does her best to improve their income and save for the future, is requesting a loan to purchase four sacks of rice seeds and three sacks of fertilizers. She hopes to have a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of rice seeds and 3 sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Juan Evangelista

texts.es:
Juan de 41 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural de distrito de San Felipe que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera, artesana y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Juan es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra lima, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de la zona donde vive y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su hogar. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así tener mejoras económicas.  Juan es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que sus hijos tengan un futuro prometedor, lo que le va dar mucha alegría.
texts.en: Juan is 41 years old and lives with his family in his own house, which has only electricity. He lives in a rural area of the district of San Felipe in the province of Cajamarca. This area is known for agriculture, livestock, arts and crafts, and tourism. Juan’s business is agriculture, and he has his own land where he grows lime trees. He harvests his limes and sells them to different markets in the area in which he lives, thus making income to cover his household expenses. He is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 nuevos soles in order to buy fertilizer to improve his soil and his harvests, with the goal of offering a better price to his customers, thereby improving his income. He is a father who wants to make certain that his children have a promising future, which will bring him much happiness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve his soil and his harvests.

loans.name: Jene

texts.en:
Jene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a wood sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional wood to sell.

Jene has been in this business for four years. Jene earns more income from her general store.

Jene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 3 est un regroupement de membres qui des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution et tous les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et l’arachide  avec Madame SAFIATOU   premier debout à droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et la semence de riz  pour entretenir : 0,25 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village de LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 FCFA  en fin de  campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains
texts.en:
BENKADI 3 regroups married women with an average age of 37 and on average, six children, who  live in polygamous families in MAARO, a village situated about 45 km from the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. Their prior loans have been correctly reimbursed.

The crops cultivated are rice and peanuts, in the case of Madame SAFIATOU, standing first on the right. With her loan she intends to pay for plowing and buy inputs and rice seed to maintain 0.25 hectares. The produce is sold right in the village of LOUTANA and at the market of SIKASSO after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 20,000 F CFA at the end of the growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso so as to be able to cultivate an even larger area so as to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy inputs, pay for plowing, and buy rice seed.

loans.name: Dovdonnyam

texts.en:
Dovdonnyam, 46, lives with her two daughters in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) in Tosontsengel province. One of her daughters is an elementary school student. 

Dovdonnyam operates a grocery trading business. She started her retailing business in 2006 and now she wants to expand her business. 

Dovdonnyam is a hardworking woman who is taking care of her two daughters alone. She believes that one day she will be a successful and well experienced business woman. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Oscar Antonio tiene 51 años, su actividad es una pulpería en donde ofrece los productos de primera necesidad para sus clientes. Oscar siempre ha sido un padre responsable que le ha brindado a su familia los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su calidad de vida. Él solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, sopas y enlatados.
texts.en:
Oscar Antonio is 51 years old. He has a general grocery store where he offers basic essential goods for his customers. 

Oscar has always been a responsible father who has provided his family with the income needed to improve their quality of life. 

He is asking for this loan in order to buy basic grains, detergent, candy, and cans of soup.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergent, candy, and cans of soup.

loans.name: Kim Eng

texts.en: Kim Eng, 30, is a worker who earns $3 per day. Her husband is a motorbike repairer and earns $5 per day. They have five children, three of whom are studying, while the other two are too young for school. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $16 on school fees, and $12 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy wood to repair her house. This loan will help her family to have a better house to live in. Kim Eng wants to support her children to study in university.

loans.use: to buy wood for repairing her house.

loans.name: Tawananyasha Group

texts.en:
Loveness is 31 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 12 and 7 years, and they both attend school. Her husband is employed as a cobbler and they have his salary as additional income. She has another dependent who stays with them.

Loveness buys and sells clothes and travel bags and gets her products from across the border. She will use the loan to buy clothes and shoes for resale. Sometimes the business is low. With the profits from the business she will now be able to buy food and pay school fees for her children. She hopes to see herself prosperous in the near future.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair color and equipment for the salon.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been practicing dairy farming for the last eight years in the Magina area of Limuru town. She is 43 years old and married to Julius. They have been blessed with three children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend who is also a KADET client. She paid the other loans well and in good time. She intends to use the loan to boost her dairy farming by setting up a a milk distributing center. 

In the future, Margaret hopes to practice large-scale dairy farming, which will increase her income.

loans.use: to boost her dairy farming by setting up a milk distributing centre.

loans.name: Nouwagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NOUWAGNON est formé de vingt trois personnes qui résident dans le même hameau. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Antoinette est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Antoinette est âgée de 55 ans, et est une veuve. Antoinette est mère de quatre enfants, tous à sa charge. Aucun des enfants n'est scolarisés. Antoinette a très peu fréquenté l'école. Depuis une trentaine d'année, afin de subvenir à ses besoins et d'assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Antoinette produit de l'huile de palme (à base des noix de palme) qu'elle vend dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables, Antoinette vend de la banane. Antoinette achète ses produits dans un village du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Antoinette et les autres membres du groupement NOUWAGNON sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d’affaire, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The Nouwagnon Group is made up of 23 people who live in the same hamlet. The representative of this group is a woman named Antoinette, who has her hand raised in the photo.

Antoinette is 55 years old and is a widow. She is the mother of four children, all in her care. Antoinette attended very little school. For some thirty years, in order to meet her needs and provide for the needs of her children, Antoinette has been producing palm oil (made from palm nuts), which she sells in her area. In addition to this business that provides her with a not insignificant income, Antoinette sells bananas.

Antoinette purchases her wares in a village in Benin. This is the second time that Antoinette and the other members of the Nouwagnon Group have sought a loan from Alidé. This loan will allow them to strengthen their business and to increase their sales, in order to better respond to the needs of their customers.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts and bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Vuth

texts.en:
Vuth, aged 31, is a farmer married with two children.  He has been farming for seven years in a rural area of the Moung Russey district where rice farming is common.   He supplements his income by buying and selling cows.

This is Vuth's first loan with VisionFund.  He will use this loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and will use a part of the loan to buy a cow for sale. This loan will enable him to make more rice and earn more income, which helps him to save and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more computers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TINKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de adornos para la navidad, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia también trabaja en una empresa privada, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los adornos de navidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar adornos para navidad como luces navideñas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the TINKA communal bank in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.  She is 32 years old, married, and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling Christmas decorations.  She sells in an itinerant manner from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She also works for a private company.

Her dream is to have a place where she would be able to sell her Christmas decorations.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations like lights wholesale.

loans.name: Noresa

texts.en:
Noresa is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Noresa has a retail shop that sells bananas & vegetables like "baguio" beans & string beans. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of bananas & vegetables.

Noresa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Noresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas & vegetables.

loans.name: Ambar Liset

texts.es:
Ambar Liset tiene 26 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 3 y 8 años de edad en ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la VRC NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely grande, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.
Ambar Liset se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además tiene cerdos, pollos. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

 Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, líquido para plagas, insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito mejorara el trabajo.

Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas cómo la langosta y la variedad del clima. El sueño es comprar un terreno.
En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar de la casa y los animales.
texts.en:
Ambar Liset, age 26, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  She lives with her husband and two children, ages three and eight, in Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

She is a member of the “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) communal bank in the Cachely Grande precinct in the Ventanas canton.  This communal bank devotes itself to the agricultural work of growing short cycle corn, rice, and pigeon pea beans.

Ambar Liset grows corn, and she also has pigs and chickens.  She buys and sells her agricultural products in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and supplies.  With the support of the loan her work will improve.  She faces challenges like locusts and climate changes.

Her dream is to buy a piece of land.  She likes to spend her free time taking care of the house and the animals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and supplies.

loans.name: Savun's Group

texts.en: A mother of two children residing the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Savun is 34 years old. Her entire income counts from rice and cassava farming which she has involved for ages. It is the business that she earns income about 33,300 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one cycle and she has repaid her past loan. For this cycle, she is a leader of two. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for labor fees, transportation and  buying fertilizer for her field. She strong hopes that her family’s members will live in good health and she will able to send her kids to study through this loan.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees, transportation

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is a 49-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She does business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to resell.

Ma. Cecilia has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to continue

loans.use: to buy more livestock to resell.

loans.name: Ghina

texts.en: Ghina is a 41-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She work as a teacher in a school in her town and her husband owns a shop  where he sells car’s spare parts. Due to the hard financial situation, and the fact that the new school year is near, she is in need to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the school fess for her kids. She said that she is very happy and eager always to borrow additional loans to help her children continue their education suitably.

loans.use: to pay the school fess for her kids.

loans.name: Grace Ngima

texts.en:
This business is a member of Naretoi Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Grace is married with 6 dependants. She was educated up to college school level and an adult education teacher in Isinya. She is the current group treasurer and merry go round in the area. She is a member of Mothers Union where she is the treasurer.

Grace started her business of rearing steers in 1996. She received her first loan from WEEC of USD.450 in 2001. She added 6 more steers. In November 2001 she was given another loan of USD.600 which enabled her to buy 8 more steers. These replaced the six which were sold.

loans.use: She plans to maintain stock at a level of 10 steers to match with the demand in the area. This loan will be used to buy more steers.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. Rashad is 24 years old. He is the only sole support for his family. Rashad understands how important customers are and prides himself in providing the best customer service possible. He decided to apply for a loan of $300 in order to increase his retail trade. 
He currently has applied for a loan of $800 to open his own perfumery and to increase his inventory of goods.

loans.use: To open his own perfumery and to increase his inventory of goods

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Mrs. Kate A. is 46 years old and married with five children. She has been a LAPO client for over 5 years. She lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She wishes for a loan of USD400 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sales

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Ms. Em was born in 1946 and is single. She has to support her old father, who is 86 years old. She has a small tea shop at home. From the shop, she earns $11 per month. She hopes to get a loan of $75 so that she can stock her tea shop to support herself and her old father. Ms. Em will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to supply her tea shop

loans.name: Pogisa

texts.en:
Pogisa is married with 5 children. She lives in Aleipata (a group of islands off Eastern Samoa) with her elderly parents. She comes from a poor familly and faces a lot of problems looking after her family from day to day. She used to have a plantation which formed the main source of income for her family for some time. Her husband is unemployed but he has been very supportive of his wife.

Pogisa joined SPBD in May 2007. She bought two cattle to start a cattle farm with her first loan. Now she has almost ten cattle. She has two dairy cows whose milk she plans to sell to local shops in the village and the town area as another source of income for her and her family. She is seeking a $750 loan to help her with her cattle farm.

loans.use: To assist with her cattle farm.

loans.name: Idis Sonay

texts.en:
Idis Sonay H. R. has been selling clothes from her house for 5 years. She sells shirts, sport clothes, trousers, skirts, Wendish shoes, and other items. She has many good customers because she goes to offices to make sales and offers credit. Sales are very good during the Christmas season.

She is requesting this loan of $750 so she can purchase more clothes to sell, and make her dream of having a large store a reality. The income from her sales help her husband with family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase clothes, shirts, trousers, pajamas, skirts to sell

loans.name: Susana Mila

texts.en: Susana M. is 62 years old and married with seven children. She is a good tailor with a great reputation among her customers. She learned to sew from her parents, who are now retired, and thus she is looking to become financially independent. Susana applied for this loan in order to buy the materials and supplies she needs. She is very happy to participate in the loan program.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Wailes Mibulani A Group

texts.en:
Fatuma A. is married with 2 children (4 and 7 years old). Fatuma owns a clothes and shoes business which she started almost 3 years ago. Working from 10 am - 4 pm daily, she earns about $53 in profit a month from this business.

Fatuma is the leader of Subgroup A of Group Wailes-Mibulani , which totals 30 members. She will be sharing this loan with subgroup members Sunday A. and Naima O., who have businesses dealing in food and clothes sales.

Fatuma now hopes for a loan to purchase more clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
Born in 1959 in Havé Doumé in the Zio prefecture, Madam D. Ayawa quit her studies in primary school to launch herself in small business. Married and the mother of five (5) children, she provides the necessities for her family thanks to her produce farming and sales of smoked fish. Dynamic and serious, she understood well how to manage her first two loans, which were reimbursed without incident. At present she requests a loan of $850 that will allow her to purchase a larger quantity of fish and to improve her produce farming. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income in order to better contribute to the improvement of the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1959 à Havé Doumé dans la préfecture du Zio, Madame D. Ayawa a cessé les études au cours primaire pour se lancer dans le petit commerce. Mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants, elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce au maraîchage et à la vente de poissons fumés. Dynamique et sérieuse, elle a su bien gérer ses deux premiers crédits qui ont été remboursés sans incident. A présent elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui servira à l’achat en quantité suffisante de poissons et au renforcement de son activité de maraîchage. Par ce crédit, elle pense augmenter ses revenus pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase fish for drying and resale and to purchase supplies for produce farming.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cicilia M. is 40 years of age, married with 6 children, and lives in Shibiri, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells drinks, and acquired this business knowledge from her mother. She has been in business since 1988, and needs a loan in the amount of $450 to enable her to buy more drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Francisca Antonia

texts.en: Francisca Antonia sells fried vegetables, fried pork, chicken and natural juices in the Invicea community of San Cristobal.  She prepares the goods within her house, but for selling, she sets up a stall close to a public place and passers-by visit her to purchase her appetizing goods.  The entrepreneur wants to increase her stock so that she can augment her sales volume and her revenue.  This will improve her standard of life.

loans.use: To purchase materials to prepare fried foods.

loans.name: Felicita Gloria

texts.es:
Felicita is requesting a loan to invest in improvements to her home. For the past 4 years, Felicita has occupied herself as a preschool teacher at the Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell Schol. This woman counts on the help of her husband, who is an elementary school teacher. They have two children; the oldest, who is 15, is in his fifth year, and the other, who is 10, is in 6th grade.

Felicita is a woman of economic resources who has fought, with her husband's help, to gradually improve their home. Currently, they have a house made of wood, but her dream is to little by little construct a home made of concrete. With this loan she hope to build a wood kitchen that provide the conditions that her family needs. Her desire is that her children will study in order to make something of their lives and achieve the dreams that every mother has for her children -- that her children will become professionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Felicita esta solicitando su préstamo para invertirlo en mejoras de su vivienda. Felicita se desempeña desde hace 4 años como docente de pre escolar de la Escuela Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell. Esta señora cuenta con la ayuda de su marido quien es docente de educación primaria, tienen 2 hijos, la mayor de 15 años está cursando su quinto año y el otro de 10 años en 6to grado.

Doña Felicita es una mujer de escasos recursos económicos que ha luchado con su marido por ir mejorando su vivienda, actualmente tiene una casita de madera pero su sueño es construir poco a poco una vivienda de concreto, con este préstamo pretende construir una cocina de madera que cumpla con las condiciones que la familia necesita y su deseo es que sus hijos estudien para ser alguien en la vida y cumplir con sus sueños que toda madre anhela que sus hijos lleguen a ser unos profesionales en el futuro.

loans.use: To build a wood kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Ngô Thị Liên is 51, she joined TYM fund in 2006. She lives in Hưng Tây, Hưng Nguyên with her husband and their 2 children. Her first loan was used to buy ducks for laying eggs. But because of the bird flu scare, she has switched to raising cows. The money made from this business enables her to provide good education for her 2 children: they're attending university. Her monthly income is 220 USD. This time she is requesting a loan of 750 USD to buy calves.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Liên, 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Chị sống cùng chồng và 2 người con tại xã Hưng Tây, Hưng Nguyên. Vòng đầu tiên chị vay 200USD từ Quỹ để đầu tư nuôi vịt đẻ. Sau một thời gian khi có dịch cúm gia cầm chị Liên chuyển sang chăn nuôi trâu bò. Lãi thu được chị dùng mua sắm đồ đạc và đầu tư cho hai con đang học đại học. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của chị Liên hiện nay là 220USD. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 750USD mua trâu bò.

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Mavluda T. is 21, is not married, and lives with her parents. For 2 years she has been working and helping her family. She is engaged in tailoring of the national lady clothes. Having consulted her parents she has decided to receive a loan to purchase fabric. By buying fabric she will be able to provide for herself trouble-free work, which will help her earn more money. She plans to extinguish the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Тошева Мавлюда -21 год. Незамужем . Живет с родителями. Уже 2 года как она начала работать и помогать своим родителям. Занимается пошивом национальной женской одежды. Посоветовавшись с родителями решила получить кредит для закупки ткани. Закупив ткань она смошет обеспечить себе бесперебойную работу. Это поможет заработать больше. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr:
Ndeye G. is a young woman who was born in 1980. She lives in the Lamy district, in the city of Thies. Ndeye is a seamstress by profession and runs her business out of her home. With this loan she wants to buy a new sewing machine, so she can complete her orders on time and increase her income.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Ndeye G. est une jeune femme née en 1980. Elle vit au quartier cité lamy de thies. Elle est une couturière de profession et gère son activité chez elle. Avec ce pret elle veut acheter une nouvelle machine pour terminer ses commandes à temps et maximiser ses revenus.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Yerli

texts.es:
Mrs. Yerli belongs to the “El Arenal” Communal Bank located on Madre De Dios Street #402 in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 41 years old and has six children. Her husband works driving a moto-car. With the first loan of 300 soles ($125) that Yerli received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in food sales. Yerli wakes up very early to prepare different dishes and juices which she then sells. With this loan of 1,500 soles ($525), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy one bag of rice, one bag of sugar, 6 bottles of oil, cakes, soft drinks, and pastries. Yerli is very happy to belong to the Manuela Ramos Bank because thanks to the bank, she can better support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yerli, pertenece al Banco Comunal El Arenal, ubicado en el Jr. Madre De Dios # 402, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años es madre de 6 hijos. Su esposo trabaja en motokar. Yerli con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de comida. Yerli se levanta muy temprano a preparar los diferentes platos de comida y jugos para luego poder vender. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1/2 doc. de aceite, kekes, gaseosas, pasteles. Yerli se siente muy contenta de pertenecer al Banco Manuela Ramos porque gracias a ello puede dar un apoyo mas a su familia.

loans.use: Buy ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Chhung

texts.en: Mrs. Chhung N. is married with three children and works with her husband on their piece of farmland growing rice and various kinds of vegetables. She and her husband can make collectively about $5 each day from selling their produce to the people in the market. In order to reduce his expenses, this couple would like to request a loan to purchase a hand tractor to assist them in plowing. With the extra revenue from the tractor this would give his family a sufficient standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor to assist in plowing her rice field.

loans.name: Imani Yetu Group

texts.en:
Mayasa has been selling dresses in Zanzibar since 2006. She is now seeking a loan so that she can increase her monthly profit, which is currently approximately $100. She intends to use the loan to buy more dresses at bulk rates to stock in her shop and sell at retail prices.

Mayasa is 25 years old, single, and has no children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Sija and Asha. Sija keeps chickens and sells eggs, and Asha sells charcoal.

loans.use: To buy dresses for her shop.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet O. is a 44-year-old married woman. She and her husband have two children, both of whom have completed school. She started trading goods four years ago, and she truly enjoys selling goods. More specifically, she trades clothing materials, and she believes in hard work and dedication when it comes to her business. She explains that she has gained a great deal of marketing experience ever since she started her business, making her one of the most successful traders in the Ashaiman market.

Now, she is seeking a loan to increase her capital so that she can purchase more clothing materials and thereby better serve her customers.

Janet is a member of the group known as the "Knowledge" Trust Group. Members in this group not only provide support for one another as they repay their loans, but they also guarantee each others' loans to esnure that such loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was captured when she was at one of their group meeting.

loans.use: The increase her inventory of clothing materials

loans.name: Khvek Chiep Group

texts.en:
There are three borrowers in this group loan. They all live in the Battambang Province. Mr. Khvek C. is 62 years old and the leader of the group. Since 2000, he makes a living by carrying a paste-fish to charge the money as a work requirement. His wife, Mrs. Chheng Vorn, is 47 years old, is a local tailor and also sells fish. She has been doing this work long time ago. She is also the mother of six children. Five of the children are in school and one daughter helps her to sell fish. C. seeks $200 loans to buy more fishes for his wife to sell. Other two are: 

Mrs. Ros H. is a 37 year old tailor and is applying for a loan $100 to purchase a sewing machine. Mrs. Ros K. is a 33 year old domestic tailor. For another source income, she is requesting a loan of $100 to buy small ducks to raise.

loans.use: to buy more fishes for his wife to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La  señora Rita tiene 59 años, es separada sin hijos , hace 25 años  que trabaja en esta actividad, es una persona muy emprendedora , sueña con tener  algún día casa propia  y ampliar su taller y así convertirse en fuente de trabajos para madres solteras ya que este es el sector menos apoyado por la sociedad.
Su deseo es seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Rita is 59 years old, is separated from her husband and doesn't have any children. She has worked in this field for the past 25 years. She is a very hard-worker and dreams of one day owning her own home and expanding her workshop so she can offer employment to single mothers, the segment of the workforce least supported by society. Her goal is to continue to build a better life for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread, zippers, buttons etc. for her workshop

loans.name: Jema

texts.en: Jema A. is a Tanzanian micro entrepreneur. She runs a retail shop at Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam. Shop businesses are very common in Tanzania due to the nature of commodities sold to customers. A. sells a variety of commodities in her shop, including seal crop products. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 ($450) to grow her business.

loans.use: Purchase more stock

loans.name: Wachewaseme Group

texts.en: Sharifa is 30 years old, married, and has two children: ages 7 and 4. Sharifa is currently a clothes saleswoman who has been living in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125 and works a daily shift of 12 hours.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can purchase more clothes and restock her business, and she is hopping that with this loan she will increase her profit.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Fatma and Mwajuma. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Makhsud

texts.en:
The need to improve his income and provide education for his 4 dear children are the reasons Makhsud is courteously requesting this loan. He is a very responsible and hard-working father who for many years has been dedicated to the business of buying and selling shoes.

Makhsud has so far accessed loans from IMON International five times and has seen his business expand. With the income, he said he was able to educate his children as that is the most important for Maksud. Today he is requesting a loan of 850 USD to expand the business so that he can generate more income in order to be able to arrange the wedding of his son. Maksud is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new shoes for his inventory

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy V., 45 years old, is married to Felino, a farmer. They have one child who has finished his studies but doesn't have a stable job yet.

Nancy planned to have plenty of stock for her sari-sari store but she lacks capital. When she became a member of PMPC, she had already availed herself of her 1st cycle loan. Now she has applied for her 8th cycle loan amounting to PHP 20,000 for her to buy additional inventory. Her husband's income from gardening and rice field cultivation help her a lot to support the needs of their family. Her hope and aspiration is that her business will continue to progress and be stable in the future and that there will be a decent life for the family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Mrs. Joan L., 23 years old, is married and lives at Villaflor, Oroquieta City. Her source of income comes from her sand and gravel business. Her husband is very supportive of her; in fact, he’s the one who oversees the business from time to time. The couple desires to have a baby someday.

The business started when Joan became a member of Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative in September 2005. She thought that this business would be ideal for them because they are near the river bank. Financial Assistance was provided by the cooperative. She has obtained loans several times already.
