Today, Joan applies for PHP 20,000 to pay the daily wages of the workers. In the future, the couple dreams of becoming the supplier of sand and gravel to a big construction company.

loans.use: To pay the salary of her workers

loans.name: Geruzalem Group

texts.en:
At age 24, Judine P. has come a very long way. Being a single mother, a student, and a business owner can be very challenging, but very rewarding. When speaking about the rewards, Judine is open about how she struggled to feed herself and child daily prior to her 1S. loan. Going on her 3rd loan now, she proudly speaks about how her business profits now give her the ability to not only pay for her school, provide for daily meal for herself and child, but also give her the ability to contribute to her family.

She is not alone in her increased profits. The Geruzalem Group, of which she is a representative, is made up of 14 other male and female business owners. Many of the members recount how they were not working and dreamed of creating a business for themselves, but never had the funds to do so. The loan they received enabled them to do so.

Judine, who sells fruits, vegetables and live animals in the big city, looks forward to further growth in her business and her area. On behalf of Judine, Geruzalem, and Esperanza we thank you for you for your support.

loans.use: Fresh vegetables, livestock

loans.name: Miguel Etanislado

texts.es: El señor Miguel Álvarez Velásquez , tiene la edad de 54 años , habita en el barrio San Ignacio en la comunidad de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja como comerciante y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos , ya casados y le apoyan un poco con los gastos del los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y darle donde poder construir a sus hijos , el desde hace treinta años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los sueños de don Miguel es poder mejor las condiciones de sus tierras . Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Miguel Álvarez Velásquez, 54, lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood in the Ticuantepe community. He lives with his wife who works as a shopkeeper and helps with the household expenses. They have three children who are now married, and they help them a little with expenses. The family plans are to improve living conditions and to give their children a place to build. For thirty years he has been a farmer. The biggest difficulty he encounters is the lack of financing. He started his business with support from his parents. Miguel’s dream is to be able to improve the condition of his land. With the loan he will buy fertilizers and supplies to apply to his crops in order to be able to have a better production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers to apply to his crops

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
B. Margret is a 27-year-old businesswoman. She has four children and they are going to school.

Margret has a bar where she has been operating her business for over two years. She is requesting the loan to purchase bar items like wines, beer, water, sodas, etc. to earn more profit. Her aim is to educate her children in good schools and lay a foundation for their tuition at university level and also to renovate her rental houses for income generation.

loans.use: To purchase bar items like wines, beer, water, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Teresa es soltera, de 27 años de edad, trabaja como maestra popular, ademas realiza labores domesticas en casa de un amigo donde recibe remuneracion, esta solicitando su 1er credito el que utilizara para reforzar su negocio de venta de ropa nueva que realiza los fines de semana en puertos de montaña, tiene 4 años de servicio en MINED Santo Tomas como maestra popular.  Podemos decir que la delegada del MINED se ha comprometido con la retencion de su salario para el pago de sus cuotas y el resto de profesoras que es un grupo de 4 estaran pendientes del cumplimiento de pago del credito.  En el negocio a ella le va muy bien, pues cuenta con experiencia y clientela seleccionada que nunca le quedan mal.
texts.en:
Teresa is single, 27 years old, and works as a teacher. Additionally, she does housework at her friend’s house where she receives remuneration. She is asking for her first loan which she will use to strengthen her business by selling new clothing on mountain passes on the weekends. She has served 4 years as a teacher at MINED Santo Tomas. The representative of MINED has promised to withhold her salary for the payment of her dues, and the rest of the professors in her group of 4 will be waiting for her to complete her loan repayment. In business she does very well, relying on her experience and selected clientele that never let her down.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New clothing sales

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
  Гулчехра моладая девушка с малых лет помогала маме в торговле веников. Она торгует на рынке Панчшанбе города Худжанда. Товар она привозит из Бегобада который находится на границе Узбекистана. Из-за того что в Таджикистане существует  ограничение электроэнергии  спрос на веники большой, потому что нет возможности пользоваться пылесосом. Поэтому Гулчехра хочет на запрашиваемый займ закупить веники и благодарит КИВУ за поддержку в ее бизнесе.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a young woman, who has been helping her mother sell brooms since childhood years. She sells at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand. She brings the merchandise from Begobad, which is located on the border with Uzbekistan. Because there are limitations on energy use in Tajikistan, and it is impossible to use vacuum cleaners, demand for brooms is high. This is why Gulchehra wants to use this loan to buy more brooms, and she is grateful to Kiva for supporting her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brooms

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
Nancy M. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal  “Gaviotas” que es parte del Centro Focal “Juan Pablo” pertenece al grupo hace 4 años. Nancy en el pasado vendía aceite de auto, pero con el tiempo este negocio no generaba suficientes ingresos y decidió cambiar de negocio, ahora tiene una tienda de abarrotes vendiendo arroz, fideo, harina,  para lo cual necesita el préstamo y tener mayor mercadería.

Al igual que Nancy las demás integrantes de “Gaviotas” tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de ropa, peluches y comida y requieren el crédito para comprar mercadería (mantillas, ropa interior, arroz y fideo)
texts.en:
Nancy M. is a member of the Gaviotas Community Bank, which is part of the Juan Pablo Community Center. She has belonged to the group for four years. Nancy used to sell automobile oil, but with the passing of time this business did not generate enough income. She decided to change businesses. She now has a grocery store. She sells rice, noodles, and flour. She needs a loan to have more merchandise for her store. Like Nancy, the other members of Gaviotas have their own businesses like selling clothes, stuffed animals, and food. They need the loan to be able to buy merchandise (mantillas, underwear, rice, and noodles).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. is 52 years old and married with seven children. She is a tailor and also sells sarongs and other clothes. She hopes for the loan amount of 80000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and other second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Jiguiseme. Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Jiguiseme sont mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans  et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à Kaboïla  dans la commune  du même nom, 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur vingtième  prêt solidaire  tous les passés  se sont  bien dénoués. Elles font comme activité entre autres  la vente de tissus, du sounbala,  des layettes etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 emballages de tissus, 5 sacs de graine de néré pour en faire du sounbala et 10 bobines de laine pour faire des layettes. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages de la commune de kaboïla. Elles vendent à domicile, dans les différents quartiers de Sikasso au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 40.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres d’acheter un âne et une charrette pour le transport de leurs marchandises.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: This is Jocelyn T., 39 years old, who lives in Silang, Cavite. Her husband works as a driver. Both their two children are in grade school. Jocelyn manages her own general store. She opened it only last year but it has already grown rapidly. She also sells pre-paid electronic load credits for mobile phones because almost all her neighbors are now using mobile phones. Her store is located along a busy street so business is brisk and she makes close to P15,000 a month. She has saved much of her profits and recently was able to buy a brand-new motorized tricycle. Jocelyn became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007 and is now on her 6th loan. She applied for a new loan of P11,000 from the cooperative which she will use to open another store. It has been her dream to acquire a property in Tagaytay City, a tourist spot next to her town. Should her dream come true, sooner or later, she said she would also put a grocery store on it. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To fund the opening of another branch

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa L., 35 years old is a rice grower. She also raises pigs to be able to raise income for her family. The income she makes in her farm and piggery helps a lot to pay the daily costs in their home. She has three children. Her eldest is 30 years old and no longer live with them.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm. Some of the loan as well will be used to buy additional piglets and feeds.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy M. is from the village of Zone 2, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old. Mercy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products such as viand (tasty dishes) in the local community. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mercy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Mercy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Paryman Gull Group

texts.en:
This is Paryman Gull group. There are three members in this group. The group leader is parman Gull. She is married, has two daughters and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan.  She wants to take out a loan for her bakery as she needs stock for her business and would like to make her own shop. 

Nazera wants to take out a loan for her tailoring business as she needs three new machines in order to improve her business. Zar mena wants to take out a loan for her brother’s fruit business. He wants buy necessary materials for his business.

They have requested a group loan of 28,000 Afghani.
     
They are confident that with the money they receive can make a good profit and can run their businesses in a good way. They all are happy about the process of applying for a loan and want to say that it can support the entrepreneurs a lot.

loans.use: to expand their business

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en: Lonh S. is 65 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two of her children at the Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been selling fish at the local market. She typically makes about $5.00 of profit every day. Her husband is too old to continue works and is currently staying at home. This couple is aided by two of their children, who are garment factory workers. Lonh S. is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase sewing machines for her children to start a tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines.

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 21 years and he is single. He lives in Musanze, a region of Ruhengeri, in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

Fabien has been a proven entrepreneur in the business of selling household items such as saucepans, flasks, jags, stoves, etc. He has run his business for four successful years and employs two people from his community. He starts his work at 6 a.m. and works until 6 p.m. everyday except Saturday.

Fabien is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more household items in order to increase his sales. He hopes to earn more profits and better satisfy the growing demand for these items from his customers. He also plans to save a portion of the revenue earned in order to build a secure foundation for his business.

loans.use: To purchasing additional household items

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina is 27 years old. She is married and has one child who is in school. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Justina trades in crates of eggs. She supplies to retailers and other food vendors in her community. Justina buys crates of eggs from nearby towns. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs

loans.name: Leoniteria

texts.en: Leoniteria C.'s main source of income comes from selling soap, canned goods, and boost food in her community. She is 59 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. Leoniteria has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Leoniteria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leoniteria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase products to sell. Leoniteria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years of age, a single mother of four children aged 10 to 23 years. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a five-roomed house where she lives with six people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for children, and medication.

Mary sells vegetables in Kawempe growers' market and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. She serves about fifty customers a day. She has done this business for over twelve years. Her main challenges are transportation and the rainy season which disturbs her a lot because she works from a muddy place which hinders her customers from reaching out to her.

Besides this vegetable business, Mary also sells sweet and Irish potatoes She has been with MCDT for nine years, servicing her eighteenth loan, working all this long time with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of vegetables. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting going directly to farmers.

loans.use: To buy more  boxes of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Enoh

texts.en: Enoh O. is married with 2 children. Her eldest child is 4 years old while the youngest child is 2 years old. Her husband is a business man and he also supports the home. Enoh is a friendly and hard working woman. She sells engine oil at retail prices to her customers. She sells for long hours to enable her to meet the daily needs of her family. Enoh hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. She is a LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.  Enoh says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 42-year-old married woman with eight children aged between 15 and 25 years. Four of her children go to school. Aisha resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she lives with ten people. There is no electricity or piped water at home. She takes care of additional family members and the family gets one meal a day.

Aisha resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week. She sells cold drinks and receives thirty customers a day. She doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping.

The major challenges Aisha faces in her business are monthly rent, medication, thieves, feeding the family and the increasing prices of clothes.

Aisha has been in her business for five years and with MCDT for seven years. She is servicing her sixteenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to stock more drinks.

Aisha is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business structure.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, passion fruit and mineral water

loans.name: Sokhoeun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhoeun P., who lives in Choes Village in Takeo Province, is 36 years old. She is the group leader selected by a group of five people who will all use their loans for different purposes. She is a dessert seller in her local village and her husband, Mr. Sarou Chhuoy, is a farmer who owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice to support his family. Although they work hard with their businesses, they are not earning enough income. Thus, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Sokhoeun P. decided to ask for a loan to be used to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has two children who are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. sells baked bread and eggs at Jukwa. At the time of visit, she had not yet received her consignment from her egg supplier.

Abena has attained a junior high level of education. She is responsible for the general upkeep of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more crates of eggs and bread for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs and bread to sell

loans.name: Assétou

texts.fr:
Assétou Koné a  47 ans mariée et mère de trois enfants (1 garçon et 2 filles). Elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Assétou Koné,  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à  l’activité d’achat de stockage et commercialisation des céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho, arachide, riz, fonio, etc) il y a environ quatre ans. Elle dispose d’un magasin au grand marché de Sikasso où elle exerce son activité. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  Après 6 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Benkadi de Sanoubougou II), elle est actuellement à son troisième prêt individuel. Tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 8 sacs de riz, 7 sacs de sorgho, 10 sacs de maïs, 5 sacs d’arachide et 4 sacs de mil. 
Elle achète le riz à Niono (région de Ségou) et les autres céréales dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement de consommateurs.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 275 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Assétou Koné is 47 years old, married, and the mother of three children (one boy and two girls).  She resides with her husband and their children in Sanoubougou II, one of the working-class districts of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run several businesses without success, she was introduced to the business of stocking up and marketing of grains (corn, millet, sorghum, peanuts, rice, fonio, etc.) about four years ago.  She has a store at the big market of Sikasso were she operates this business. Concerned about further satisfying her customer base, which is growing more and more, Assétou decided to joint the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After six solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association in her district (Association Benkadi de Sanoubougou II), she is currently on her third individual loan.  The preceding loans have all been properly repaid.  Assétou intends to use this loan for buying eight sacks of rice, seven sacks of sorghum, ten of corn, five of peanuts, and four of millet.  She buys the rice in Niono (Ségou region); the other grains, from towns around Sikasso.  Then she sells the grains retail to a customer base composed generally of consumers.  With this loan, Assétou envisions making a monthly profit of 275,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially for increasing her capital, taking part in meeting family expenses, paying the loan interest, and investing the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose is into the printing of documents and text books. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She is a hard working woman. She hopes to grow and expand her business. She is 26 years old, Single without children. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more printing materials to boost her printing business.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more printing materials to boost her printing business

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es:
El señor Juan C. está casado con la señora Gladys Ferreira, tienen tres hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Don Juan anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en el interior del país.
 Como el 90% de su tiempo debido a su trabajo se encontraba fuera de su casa y por ende de su familia, decidió invertir su dinero en la compra de dos camionetas para así dedicarse al taxi flete y también de esa forma dedicarle más tiempo a su familia.
Fue así que recurrió a la Fundación Paraguaya para solicitar un crédito para invertir en compra de cubiertas y mantenimiento de sus vehículos.
En adelante Juan C. quiere seguir ampliando su flota de taxi fletes.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan C. and his wife, Gladys Ferreira, have three children, all grown. Don Juan used to make a living selling the kinds of products that everyone needs every day to people in the interior of the country. Since he had to be away from his family 90% of the time, he decided to use his savings to buy two small trucks for a taxi business, work that allows him to spend more time with his family. He approached Fundacion Paraguaya for a loan so that he can service his vehicles and buy "cubiertas" [coverings or a roofed structure, probably]. For the future, Don Juan wants to expand his taxi fleet.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and services for taxi business.

loans.name: Juan Zenon

texts.es:
Juan Zenón de 47 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Xiomara Amador, viven junto a sus hijos en la Comarca El Jicaro, jurisdiccion de Nueva Guinea, en donde junto a  su esposa e hijos desarrollan las actividades de su finca,  desde muy joven ha trabajado en las actividades agropecuarias y gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio tiene su pequeña finca en la que se dedica al establecimiento de cultivos de granos basicos, establecimeinto de musacea, ordeño y cuido de su inventario ganadero, de igual manera el mantenimiento de la finca, la que cuenta con buen manejo sanitario y nutricional, ademas por la venta de productos lacteos recibe ingresos adicionales para el sustento familiar.  

Esta solicitando su 1er credito para compra de ternero desarrollo, los que pretende cuidarlos y engordarlos para que cuando alcancen el peso que requiere el mercado nacional e internacional, pueda comercializarlos a un excelente precio que le permita obtener buenas ganancias que le ayudaran a darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.  

Sueña con poder darle a su familia buenas condiciones y fortalecer su inventario ganadero, ya que es el patrimonio que les dejara cuando falte.
texts.en:
Juan Zenón is 47 years old, married to Mrs. Xiomara Amador. They live with their children in the Comarca El Jicaro, jurisdiction of Nueva Guinea where he works his farm together with his wife and children. Since very young he has worked in farming and thanks to his effort and sacrifice he owns a small farm where he grows basic grains and musaceae, milks and takes care of his livestock as well as the maintainance of the farm which has good sanitary and nutritional conditions. He also receives extra income to support his family by selling dairy products .

He is requesting his first loan to buy calves, which he will look after and fatten, and when they reach the weight required by the national and international market he will sell them at an excellent price which will allow him to obtain good profit to improve the living conditions of his family.

It is his dream to give his family good conditions and increase his livestock as it represents the patrimony of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calves.

loans.name: Mweruphe

texts.en:
Mweruphe is a married woman with seven children,six of her children attend school and one is too young for school.She has been operating her business for the last five years of buying goats for rearing while they are still young and selling them after sometime at a profit.
Goat is important component in dry land farming system. Marginal or undulating lands unsuitable for other types of animals like cow or farming, goat is the best alternative.With very low investments goat rearing can be made into a profitable venture for small and marginal farmers.

She rears goats for milk and meat. Goat is a multi functional animal and plays a significant role in the economy and nutrition of landless, small and marginal farmers in the area.Goats can efficiently survive on available shrubs and trees in adverse harsh environment in low fertility lands where no other crop can be grown. 

The goats are normally taken out to the field in search of pastures very early in the morning at six o'clock,until noon they are returned back home.Mweruphe took us to the hut where she normally keeps the goats at night.Her spouse is a farmer and he helps in the running of the business and sells at the market place to her neighboring community.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase six goats. Previously she sold vegetables and paraffin to contribute to her other source of income.

Mweruphe faces the challenge of the high cost of transporting goats to the market place. She hopes to supply at wholesale someday. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To purchase six  livestock goats for rearing .

loans.name: La Buena Fe Group

texts.en:
Melida is the coordinator of her group. La Buena Fe 1 & 2 (The Good faith). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term-partner and a child. Melida is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying chickens, vegetables, and fruit to sell in her little fruit and vegetables stand. She will use the profits to invest in her business and in the future she wants to build a house. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to be with her baby.

Melinda's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural area of El Seibo, an agricultural area. Like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, it suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity .

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and chickens

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is married to a businessman, but has no children. She has been operating her retail shop for the last two years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She rents a house with electricity and piped water.

With the 15,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan she wants to purchase four bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, 50 kg of sugar, and 30 litres of cooking oil. Naomi faces the major challenge of high transport cost. She hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future. Her main aim of working with Yehu is to get financial assistance and improve her business. She cites food as her greatest monthly expense.

loans.use: To purchase maize and wheat flours, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
El señor Benedicto Solís López tiene 28 años convive con la Señora Emeteria Robles Urey mas de  12 años, tiene 4 hijos menores dependientes que estudia en nivel primaria en la escuela rural de la comunidad, la actividad principal es la agricultura produce papa en terreno que tiene 2 hectáreas sector Liquintaya, Benedicto y su familia son familia humilde de poco recursos pero muy trabajadores, están a 56 km de la ciudad para ellos  acudir a los banco para un préstamo de dinero es muy difícil.

El Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural. donde Don Benedicto Solís López necesitaba dinero para comprar abono orgánico para la siembra de esta campaña agrícola, Benedicto nos comenta que tiene poco superficie de terreno para sembrar, pero otras personas tienen tierras agrícolas grandes y a él ofertan para que trabajara en su terreno al partido y para ello  necesita capital para sembrar en los terrenos y producir más papa y tener ingreso económico mayor que  le permite ahorrar dinero para comprar terreno agrícola propio y hacer estudiar a su hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Benedicto Solís López is 28 years old and has been living with Mrs. Emeteria Robles Urey for more than 12 years. They have 4 dependent children who attend an elementary school in the rural community. The main activity here is agriculture. He grows potatoes on 2 hectares (20,000 square meters) in the Liquintaya area. They live 56 km from the city and to come all the way to the banks to request a loan is very difficult.

Field Partner Cidre took the initiative to go to rural areas. Mr. Benedicto Solís López needed money to buy organic fertilizer to sow in this agricultural countryside. Benedicto tells us he has little land to sow on but others have large amounts of land that they are offering him to work on. To be able to do that he needs materials to sow and grow more potatoes to make a highest possible profit which will allow him to save up money to buy his own land and let his children study.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of seeds and fertilizer to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann D. is from the village of San Juan, Alicia, Isabela. She is 28 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling home products in the local community. Mary Ann is just starting this business.

In 2010, Mary Ann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sagynbiubiu's Group

texts.en:
Sagynbiubiu D. is the leader of this group. She is forty-three and married. Her husband is an officer. Sagynbiubiu is a constructor. She wants to purchase chickens and start selling eggs. She has all necessary conditions at home for chicken farming but she doesn’t have sufficient funds to purchase chickens. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase chickens.  One of her latest achievements is construction of her house. In the future, she wants to expand her business. 

Group members:

Rahat S. K. is treasurer of the group. She is twenty-seven and married. She has a child and her child goes to kindergarten. Her husband is serviceman. She has her pavilion where she sells convenience goods. She started selling convenience goods three years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 soms. Now, she has been able to increase her profits to 18,000 soms.  She is applying for a loan in order to purchase goods to increase her turnover and purchase a cupboard for her pavilion. In the future, she is planning to save some money for the purchase of a car for her husband. 

Nurlan K. is thirty-eight and married. He has two children. His son goes to school and his daughter is at home. His wife is a seamstress. Nurlan is a builder but he also earns by reselling fruit. He started reselling fruit four years ago with initial investment of 8,000 soms. His monthly income is 6,000 soms. He is applying for a loan in order to expand his business through expansion of his turnover. In the near future, he is planning to purchase a house, car and everything for his house and family. 

Nurzhan A. is thirty-eight and married. She has two children and both of them go to school. Now, she helps her sister sell clothes. She started this business with her sister three years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 soms. Now, she earns 7,000 soms. She wants to start her own business and start selling clothes independent of her sister. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase clothes for resale purposes. In the near future, she is planning to reinvest all her profits in her business and purchase some day furniture for her house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Konul

texts.en: Konul O. is a 37 year old trader who keeps her own shop in Agsu city. She has run her business for the last four years. She sells tea, sugar, candies and other food products in her shop. Konul started her business with the help of an AqroInvest loan that she used for buying more goods for her shop. She has a successful loan history. Her monthly income is about 300-500 AZN and she would like to increase it. Konul applied for a 1000 AZN loan to increase inventory in her shop and to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her shop, to increase income.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.en:
Aristides is a 52-year-old pepper producer and father of six who lives with his family in the region of Upala in the Northern part of Costa Rica, minutes from the Nicaraguan border. Aristides is a dedicated father and producer. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvesting of Cayenne and Habanero peppers in an effort to improve his living conditions. He works in cooperation with his family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities.  In addition to his agricultural activity, Aristides feels it is important to be an active member of his community. As a result, he dedicates a significant portion of his time to community meetings, groups and events. The rural zone where Aristides and his family live is sparsely populated with infrequent bus service and a general lack of infrastructure. Aristides is working hard towards the sustenance of his family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labor. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Aristides and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Upala community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Cayenne and Habanero peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labor and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Aristides with the help of his family members in the region of Upala. The production cycle (from planting to harvest) for these types of peppers is roughly one year. Aristides planted his peppers four months ago and will expect to harvest in the next eight months. Typically, he dedicates the hours from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM everyday to his agricultural activities. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial (PROPICA) is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Upala, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The main obstacle Aristides and other producers in the Upala community face is a lack of access to working capital funds. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity for Aristides, his family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Aristides wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. He wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his home and neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals and nutrients.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is 30 years old, married and blessed with two children.  For two years, he has been earning a living by repairing bicycles and selling bicycle spare parts.  He was previously working on contract before he went into business.  He hopes to open another outlet of his business in the future.  He appreciates Faulu Kenya for supporting him financially because he has managed to add to his business inventory.  With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he will buy bicycle spare parts such as peddles, frames, forks, tubes and tires.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts such as peddles, frames, forks, tubes and tires.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina M. is from the village of Umayco, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Marina is single. 

To make a living, Marina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling viands like chicken and pork adobo, afritada & pancit bihon in the local community. She is also running her retail store. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. 

Marina is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Marina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda H. lives in Nangka, Das Village, Toledo City, Cebu. She is married and has eight children, four of whom attend school and three of whom are presently working.  She earns her living by operating two business ventures: furniture making and ready-to-wear clothes businesses. Her husband, Rolando H., who is 50 years old, works in the furniture business to earn his living.  He also helps in his wife's business activities.  Medarda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Medarda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 30,000 PHP, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  For her 11th  loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy lumber for her furniture business so that she could continue to save up for the future and for her children's education.  Medarda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal S. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Nha In, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1975 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. Mr. Nha In is a fisherman and a construction worker.

Sophal is a farmer and she also sells the fish that her husband catches to others living in their village. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle to carry the fish she sells.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to carry the fish she sells

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
el señor Esteban R. tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado y es padre de una hija, viven en la colonia Buena Vista desde hace 4 años, todos los dias se traslada al mercado viejo de San Lorenzo de lunes a sabado a realizar sus ventas. Esteban cuando las ventas estan malas se dedica a costurar zapatos usados.
El es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable. su esposa le ayuda a vender ropa cuando el anda haciendo trabajos de zapateria en otros lugares.
el credito lo utilzara para comprar ropa para vender en la epoca de navidad.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Esteban R. is 48 years old.  He is married and has one daughter.  He has been living in Buena Vista neighborhood for four years.  He travels to the 'Mercado Viejo' (Old Market) in San Lorenzo, from Monday to Saturday, to make his sales.  When sales are bad, Esteban sews used shoes.

Esteban is a very hard-working and responsible person.  His wife helps him to sell clothes when he goes off to do his shoe repair work in other places.

Esteban will use this loan to buy clothes to sell during the Christmas season.  He needs the profits from his business to cover his household expenses.

loans.use: To buy jeans, shirts, t-shirts, blouses and underwear

loans.name: Tseren

texts.en: Tseren J. is 57 years old  and lives with her husband and three daughters in Uvs province, Mongolia. She and her family live in an apartment which was purchased as an apartment leasing loan. All three daughters attend university. Her husband has operated a raw material trading business for many years and has built a stable operation over this time. Tseren is a trader, traveling between Russian and Mongolia to sell variety of goods between the countries. After years of hard work for both Tseren and her husband, they were able to increase their working capital for both of their businesses and their earnings have enabled them to buy a new mini truck and apartment for their family. Tseren is a modest woman and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing material for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing material

loans.name: Noureen's Group

texts.en:
Noureen comes from Jaranwala, a city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. Her house contains 3 rooms and is made of bricks. She has been living there with her family for the past 20 years. She is 40 years old, an active lady, and spends her time at home doing her household tasks. She is married to M. K. who has a business selling jewelry. He operates his shop in the market and sells costume jewelry to his customers.  

Noureen is the mother of four sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is an embroidery expert while the 2nd one sells fish. Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy jewelry such as rings, necklaces, and ear-rings for his business and improve his sales. 

Marriage season is near and Noureen is hopeful that timely investment will bring more profit for her husband and improve the financial condition of his business. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application. She hopes it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry for resale

loans.name: Formidables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORMIDABLES” iniciará su  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, será parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, es un grupo muy entusiasta.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes, 9 mujeres y 1 varón.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados, entre ellos tenemos: venta de péliculas en DVD`s, venta de juguetes, librería, tienda de abarrotes, venta de electrodomésticos,servicio de enfermería.

La asociación cuenta con una mesa directiva que esta compuesta por una presidenta la señora Lucia, una tesorera la señora Rosario y la señora María del Carmen como secretaria de actas. 

La señora Lucia, presidenta de la banca comunal, indica que vive con su pareja y que es  madre de tres hijos, su negocio es la venta de videos desde hace mas de seis anos.  Las ventas son realizadas en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, el Zona de Rio Seco y la Zona de 16 de Julio, cinco dias a la semana, trabaja de manera ambulante.

El crédito que ha solicitado la señora Lucía le permitirá comprar mercaderia.

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que es la oportunidad de compartir con su grupo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “FORMIDABLES” Communal Bank will begin its first round in Pro Mujer, it will be part of Focal de Los Andes Centre, and it is a very enthusiastic group. It is comprised of 9 women and 1 man. The businesses that they run are diverse, among them: movie DVD sales, toy sales, book sales, a grocery store, domestic electrical goods sales and a nursing service.

The Bank has a board of directors that is comprised of their President, Lucia, their Treasurer, Rosario and Sra María del Carmen as Secretary.

Lucia, the president of the communal bank, reports that she lives with her partner and is a mother to three children. For just over the last six months her business has involved selling videos. She sells her wares 5 days a week by peddling at fairs in El Alto city, Zona de Rio Seco and Zona de 16 de Julio,  

Lucia's requested loan will allow her to purchase merchandise.

When asked what it is that she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies the opportunity to share with her group and the savings.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hajra's Group

texts.en:
Hajra is 45 years old. Her husband’s name is N. A. and he has a construction supply sales business. He sells supplies to different construction companies and to the regular customers at a good profit.  

Hajra shares the financial burden with her husband by selling shawls (item of clothing, loosely worn over the shoulders). She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and completes their orders by providing them shawls of different qualities. She purchases these shawls from the city of Lahore where she visits once a month.  

She has three sons and four daughters. Her eldest son makes shoes. He learnt this art from a person in his community. He worked with him for three years and now he operates his own business. Her first two daughters help her in operating her shawl-selling business. Others are studying, attending a local school.  

Hajra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy leather, nails and shoe polish to make shoes in larger quantity. Hajra is very confident that her son’s 5 years of experience in his business will help him earn better profits after the loan investment and she will be able to save some of the profit to marry off her daughter in the near future.  She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be profitable experience for her.  

She lives in Kasur which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, famous for its leather industry. She lives there in a small home which contains two rooms, in the area of Jamatpura.

loans.use: To buy leather, nails and shoe polish for shoe-making business

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Mrs. Emerita E., 65, is widow and lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is a single parent with two children. She has experienced difficulty being a single parent, but it's not a hindrance for her to move on. She found ways to survive, and opened a “sari-sari” (general store) with a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Aside from sari-sari store, she is also engaged in coconut buy and sell, where she earns PHP 800/week.

Emerita was able to manage the business successfully; in fact, it covers her daily consumption needs and also her child's allowance. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store. She will be happy if she sees her child finish school.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.es:
La Sra. Joaquina es soltera, tiene dos hijos, ambos en edad escolar.
Ella tiene un taller de costura en Ciudad del Este, cuyas prendas al venderse dejan una ganancia muy satisfactoria, generándole un buen ingreso.
Con la ayuda de sus hijos está saliendo adelante, aunque esto signifique en muchos casos sacrificio y más esmero.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con buena cantidad de clientes, cantidad que va en ascenso, debido a su buen trato.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que solicita nuestro apoyo.
Desea obtener el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de telas para dar mayor variedad a sus clientes a la hora de pedir confecciones y modelos de prendas,al mismo tiempo que una mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Senora Joaquina is single and she has two children who are both in school 

She has a sewing shop in Cuidad del Este, where she sells clothes which provide a very satisfactory profit and generate a good income. With the help of her children she is getting ahead even if it means more of a sacrifice and more dedication. Today she is a successful microentrepreneur with a good number of clients, a number which continues increasing due to her good service. She has demonstrated that she is a reponsible person and is honest in her commitments to the loans she takes out. She would like to obtain a loan to invest in purchasing of a variety of good quality fabrics for her clients in a number of garments and of different styles.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 57-year-old man, married and father of one, who works in the transportation sector. He lives in Bint Jbeil and has 32 years of experience. He is very committed and hard-working. He transports  water and plows to cultivate land.

This is Adnan's fourth loan. He reports that the previous ones helped him increase his income. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a plowing machine. In the future, he wishes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a plowing machine.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This is Francisca C., 62, a resident of Phase 5-A, Bulihan, Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Pedro C., a carpenter, and is the mother of six children. Three of them are already settled with their own families and the other three are working.

Francisca operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP’s-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail piece rates. She earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her variety store, she is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Francisca prays that her children will grow deeper in their relationship with the Lord. She also dreams that her business will become bigger and eventually turn into a convenience store. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry S. is from the village of Sebasi Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 47 years old. Jerry is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jerry owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Jerry has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jerry joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC.  Jerry is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his fourth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Fredi Enrique

texts.es: Fredi Enrique tiene 68 años, el es viudo. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de hospedaje. En su propia casa está ubicado el local en donde ofrece 10 habitaciones, disponibles al público y lo que le brinda ventaja es que es un lugar muy transitado por clientes. El pretende realizar con la inversión es acondicionar dos cuartos, comprar colchones, materiales de construcción, pintura entre otros.  El cuenta con la experiencia y manejo de su negocio él quiere generar ganancias para mejorar su nivel de vida y seguir invirtiendo.
texts.en:
Fredi Enrique, 68, is a widower.  His occupation is providing lodgings.  He has a 10 bedroom unit located in his own house available for the public.  What gives him an edge is that it is a location with very heavy customer traffic.  

He intends to use the investment to furnish two rooms.  He will buy mattresses, building materials and paint, among others.  He has experience in running his business and wants to generate profits to improve his standard of living and to continue investing.

loans.use: to buy matresses, building materials and paint, among others.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 29 years old, a farmer from village Ruisi, East Georgia. He lives with his wife Lia and 12-year-old daughter. Gela and Lia have 1.5 ha pf land where cabbage and beets are grown. After the harvest season, vegetables are sold to retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 1600 Laris.

With the requested credit Gela will purchase fertilizers. After fertilizing, the quality and quantity of the harvest will increase, resulting in higher prices and thus higher income. 

Part of the income from sales will be reinvested in the business and the other part will be used for finishing off the family’s newly constructed house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the farm.

loans.name: Luân

texts.en:
Luân  is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong district - Băc Ninh province.  She is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Luân  operates a family member's business venture in the arts sector operating a manufacturing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members.  Luân  has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Luân  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Luân  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.944..000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.  Luân  is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional furniture products such as beds tables chairs.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Luân  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional furniture products

loans.name: Sokheoun

texts.en:
Sokheoun, 31 years old, is a laborer. His wife is a cook. Their income is $6 per day. They have four children. Three are studying. 

Every month, he has to spend around $45 on every expense in the family. 

He would like to request a loan of $700 to buy construction equipment to do construction. Without equipment to do construction this family won’t be able to earn money because most people will not hire him without equipment.

After buying that equipment, he expects to earn more income to support his family, and especially to send all of his children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled, from Madaba, Jordan, is a 30 year-old married man and a father of two children.  Khaled is a carpenter. and is requesting a loan of 400 JD to expand his business.  He also wants to benefit from the nonfinanciA. services provided by Tamweelcom, especially the marketing channel that is circulated through its bazaars and permanent showrooms.

An aspiration of Khaled is to open his own showroom for his products.

loans.use: with project expansion

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Bora and his wife, Soda, are teachers in the same village high school. They have been married since 1992 and have three daughters. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Bora is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorcycle for commuting and teaching. In this photo, Bora is standing next to the motorbike that he wants to buy from his neighbor. He does not yet have the money and is therefore asking for a loan to purchase the motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta is a 61-year-old widow living in Aurora, Zambo, del Sur, Philippines. She has one adult-aged child. Five years ago, Alberta started operating her own retail store at home. The business showed a good flow of operations and sustained her livelihood. Every month, she earns PHP 5,000. Earlier this year, Alberta joined GDMPC. Her loan of PHP 5,000 has been approved by the cooperative. The money will be used to purchase high-demand grocery items to sell. She plans to repair the store's native roof and expand the business area.

loans.use: To purchase high-demand grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Tavarali

texts.ru: Таварали проживает в районе Яван. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него 8 детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Уже восемь лет как он занимается животноводством. Он в основном занимается купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Целью получения кредита является закуп скота в дальнейшем для продажи.
texts.en: Tavarali live in Yavan. He is 43 years old, married, and has eight children. He has a high school education. He has been a herdsman for eight years.  He mainly works buying and selling livestock.  He is taking out a loan to buy livestock for resale.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 43 years old, married and blessed with five children.  She runs a retail shop and a grocery shop to earn a living.  She has five years of experience in operating the business.  She was previously employed before she went into business.  

Through Faulu Kenya, Mary has managed to grow her business. She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mahudjro Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJRO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Florence Viviane, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Florence Viviane est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à Kadafia, un enseignant. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont les leurs. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Florence Viviane a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Florence Viviane vend depuis cinq ans, des  produits divers (condiments de sauce, œufs frais, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) dans son quartier. Florence Viviane s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin . Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle, Florence Viviane et les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO sollicitent auprès de ALIDé pour une deuxième fois son aide financier. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group MAHUDJRO is comprised of three persons who live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative is Florence Viviane, who is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 31 years old and married to Kadafia, a teacher. They have three children to support. Two of the children are their own, and all of them are in school and living together with their parents. The couple jointly ensure that the various family expenses are covered. 

Florence Viviane dropped out of middle school. To support herself and her children, she has been selling various products for five years (sauce condiments, fresh eggs, pasta, etc.) in her district. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

With the goal of boosting their business and responding better to the demands of their customers. Florence Viviane and the other members of the group MAHUDJRO are requesting financial aid from ALIDé for the second time. This loan will serve to bolster their business in order to respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy various goods (sauce condiments, trays of fresh eggs, and pasta)

loans.name: Nuvia Monserrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Amigas Por Siempre. Este lugar es conocido por su gran vegetación pero sobre todo por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por turistas locales y de otras ciudades.

La señora Nuvia tiene 40 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, dos mayores de edad y tres menores que estudian en colegio. Su marido trabaja en el extranjero.

Ella es un ama de casa que para sacar a su familia adelante ha tenido que trabajar muy duro. Nuestra amiga se dedica a la cría y venta de animales para lo cual cuenta con una pequeña granja en su casa, allí por temporadas mete hasta 200 pollos  los mismos que los tiene por tres meses y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa o entrega a tiendas de la localidad.  Además de esto por las noches  tiene una carreta en la cual sale a vender comidas rápidas como hot dog, hamburguesas, jugos y batidos de fruta, trabaja todos los días sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio de comidas rápidas, tiene 8 años que se dedica a estas actividades y le va bien.

Este crédito lo quiere emplear para comprar pollos, alimento para los mismos y víveres para preparar los alimentos.  Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
The Amigas Por Siempre communal bank meets every 15 days in Ayacucho parish, in Santa Ana canton. The area is known for its lush vegetation, but above all for its beautiful fresh water spas, which are much frequented by locals and by tourists from other cities.

Sra. Nuvia is 40, married and has 5 children, two adults and three minors who are in secondary school. Her husband works abroad.

She is a housewife who has had to work very hard to help her family get ahead. She raises and sells animals for which she has a small poultry farm at her house. She takes in up to 200 chickens every season for three months and then sells them to merchants who come to her home or she delivers them to stores in the region. Besides this, she has a nighttime business selling fast food such as hot dogs, hamburgers, juices and fruit smoothies. She works every day. Her children help her in the fast food business. She has had these businesses for 8 years and is doing well.

She will use this loan to buy chickens, chicken feed and supplies to prepare her fast food. She is founder of the communal bank and she likes it because of the benefits she receives from it.

Her dream is to continue getting ahead, in her life and in her businesses.

loans.use: to buy chickens, chicken feed and food supplies.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia belongs to a poor family. She is 53 and a housewife who spends most of her time at home doing her household responsibilities. She is still very active and performs her duties with dedication. Her husband is 55 and doesn’t work.

Asia is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Both of her sons are rickshaw drivers. Her daughter is 24 and helps Asia in her routine daily tasks. Asia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder son who wants to pay off the remaining installments of his rickshaw. By doing this, the rickshaw will become his property and he will be able to run his business better and without any problems.

loans.use: to pay off the remaining installments of her son's rickshaw.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is applying for another loan to expand her current business. She will use this loan of KES 40,000 to purchase flour, soap and other essential goods. In the future, Purity aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Purity has been able to improve her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase flour, soap and other essential goods

loans.name: Balmore

texts.es: Balmore de cuarenta y uno años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. El posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues su trabajo es de excelente calidad y a un buen precio; Balmore es un hombre trabajador  siempre está muy activo y es constante en su labor, piensa que el éxito se alcanza convirtiendo cada paso en una meta y cada meta en un paso es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar metal y otras herramientas que le permitan realizar al máximo su trabajo. Balmore tiene fe que con su esfuerzo y dedicación lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Balmore, 41, lives with his life’s companion and their children in his own house.  He has a metal shop and has acquired many customers because his work is of excellent quality and is well priced.  Balmore is a hardworking man who is always very active and constant in his work.  He thinks that success is achieved turning each step into a goal and every goal into a step and this is why he’s asking Integral for a loan to buy metal and other tools that will allow him to optimize his work.  Balmore trusts that with his effort and dedication he will bring economic security to his home and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metal at wholesale and other tools.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en: Ephantus is a hardworking business man aged 30. He is married and blessed with two children and one of them is in school. He has been running a butcher shop for the last six years to support his family. He also operates a van transport business to increase his income. He has been able to retain his business because of a good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Since Ephantus joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow to slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow to slaughter.

loans.name: Luz Aydee

texts.es: La señora Luz Aydee a sus 36 años de edad y madre de dos hijos de 17 y 9 años de edad, se dedica a la producción de alimentos como dulces y snakcs  desde su casa y los vende en diferentes colegios de la ciudad. Hoy día, la señora Luz Aydee desea comprar un carro de comidas rápidas con el fin de diversificar su negocio de los dulces, adicionando la venta de comidas rápidas los fines de semana en las afueras de su casa. Lo anterior le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y así sus ingresos y de esta manera brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El sueño de la señora Aydee es terminar de construir su propia casa en un terreno que su madre le regalo.
texts.en: Luz Aydee is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are 17 and 9 years old. She makes a living making food like sweets and snacks from her home, and she sells them in different secondary schools in the city. Nowadays Luz Aydee hopes to buy a fast food cart with the aim of diversifying her sweets business, adding fast food sales on the weekends in the outskirts of her home. This will allow her to increase her sales and earnings. In this way she will provide a better quality of life to her family. Aydee's dream is to finish constructing her own home on a plot of land her mother gave her.

loans.use: to buy a food cart to prepare assorted fast food.

loans.name: Shargiya

texts.ru: Shargiya 46 let. Ona uje 9 let zanimayetsya skotovodstavom i razvodit korov. Shargiya xochet kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota a takje molochnogo produkta i poetomu ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN.
