Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. Shargiya zamujem i imeyet 4 detey. U nix bolshaya semya i im nado uvelichit mesachniye doxodi. Ona delayet razniye molochniye kachestvenniye produkti i prodayot ix v magazini.
texts.en: Shargiya is 46 years old. She has been running a livestock business by breeding cows for nine years. Shargiya wants to buy cows to increase the headcount of cattle and also the amount of milk products and this is why she needs 2000 AZN. She is an internally displaced person relocated from the town of Fuzuli and now living in the Fuzuli region together with her friendly family. Shargiya is married and has four children. They have a big family and they need to increase their monthly income. She makes different types of quality milk products and sells them to the stores.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Tanuvasa

texts.en:
Tanuvasa is 52 years of age and is married, with four children.

Tanuvasa owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Tanuvasa needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2010, Tanuvasa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tanuvasa's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked goods for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Vilma runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, milk, sugar, spices, noodles, etc.  

Vilma requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is 35 years old and married. She lives in Madaba, Jordan and is a mother of four children.

Hanan is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to expand her project in eggs sales. She will buy more food and needed materials to expand her project and increase the quantites of eggs she produces. Her husband is unable to help her because of his physical disability, so she runs the business on her own.

loans.use: to buy food and other materials for her egg-producing business

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en: A mother of four children, Horn is 37 years old and lives in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support her family, she grows rice and her husband drives taxi to supplement the family’s income. It is the business that she has had for ages. Now, she is in need of working capital. Therefore, she forms a group of three to get a new loan. As the leaders, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her crop. Horn hopes this loan can help her family and her income more than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Aye Fele Group

texts.fr: AYE FELE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies d'enfance. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Barikissou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 38 ans. Barikissou ne vit plus avec son mari. Barikissou  a un enfant, scolarisé et à la charge de Barikissou et son mari. Barikissou  vit seule avec son enfant. Pour cette raison, Barikissou vend des biscuits, des conserves et du lait depuis treize ans. De façon secondaire, Barikissou  vend aussi de la farine de manioc et des liqueurs ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de son enfant et à son éducation. Barikissou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Barikissou  sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe AYE FELE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des paquets de biscuits, des sardines, du lait et des liqueurs.

loans.name: Mirzoboy

texts.en: Mirzoboy is a capable boy he is a student. In his summer vocation he helps to his parents in farming. Mirzoboy dreams to become a management in her childhood and help the people. He reached to his goal. He is studying at the Tajik state University of law, business and politics (TSU LBP) the second year student. He couldn’t pay the tuition of University. He decided to get a loan. He needs to money. He is asking for a loan of 4000 with this aim. He awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To pay for the university tuition

loans.name: Rebecca Tarayia

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Naretoi Women Group group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Rebecca is married with 6 children .She doubles as church secretary and merry go round.

Rebecca received her first loan of USD.300 from WEEC in 2001. She bought her first 2 steers paid well and in 2003 she was given another loan of USD.450 which enabled her to buy 3 more steers. To date Rebecca has a total of 13 steers. This business enables her to educate her children in good schools and provide for the rest of the family.

loans.use: She intends to restock such that she utilizes the rains which have just started after along period of drought. She will be assured of high income after a few months of grazing.

loans.name: Aholoussi

texts.en:
Mrs Aholoussi K. is currently responsible for eight (8) people. Married to a sculptor, she went into business early on in the sale of corn to help her husband meet the needs of the household. When corn is abundant, she stores it in order to resell it later on. Despite her low level of education, she manages her affairs well and managed to pay back her first loan without difficulty. This season, she hopes to increase her storage capacity and is looking for a loan of $800 in order to do this. She possesses a lot of experience in the field and could bring this project to fruition for the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Aholoussi a à sa charge aujourd’hui un total de huit (8) personnes. Mariée à un sculpteur, elle s’est lancée très tôt dans la vente du maïs pour accompagner son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins du ménage. En période d’abondance de maïs, elle fait le stockage pour le revendre en période de soudure. Malgré son niveau d’instruction très bas, elle a une bonne gestion de ses affaires et a su rembourser son premier crédit sans difficulté. A cette saison, elle a l’ambition d’augmenter sa capacité de stockage et sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $800. Elle dispose d’une grande expérience dans le domaine et pourra mener à bien cette activité pour le bien-être de sa famille

loans.use: Storage and sale of corn

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She sells maize to her customers. She is seeking a loan of US$700.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam has been engaged in business for over 10 years. He is married and has two children. He has a university degree and is a geography teacher. But the salary of a teacher was not enough to support his family and he decided to trade womens' clothes. In 1997 Rustam rented a little place for his activity. He started his business from $100USD and step-by-step he was able to increase the turnover of his goods to $100USD. Today he has many constant clients. His wife helps him in his activity. She sells his goods when he goes on the trip to purchase the next batch of goods. In the future he plans to rent one more place for his wife and of course he wants to expand his assortment to attract new clients.

loans.use: Rustam is an ex-geography teacher who would like to expand his womens' clothing store.

loans.name: Ogiebulu

texts.en: Mr. Ogiebulu A. is 40 years old. He is married, with children. He is a farmer and specializes in the production of yam, maize and tomatoes, among other crops. He sells his farm produce to people living in his community. He is requesting the above loan to enable him to cultivate more crops to sell.

loans.use: To support my farm (Clearing, Planting & Harvesting)

loans.name: Rosita Misksy

texts.es:
Srta. Rosita belongs to "Las Doncellas" (The Damsels) community bank in Ucayali, a region or "departamento" of Peru. She is 29 years old and the mother of 2 small children. Her partner is a security guard at a retail store but his salary doesn't cover all of the household expenses so Rosita began looking for ideas for businesses that she could start at home where she cares for her two young children. With her first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or approximately US$94) from Manuela Ramos, she decided to set up a small home-based grocery business, the only one in a 6-block area.

With a recently-granted loan of S/.700 (approximately US$233) from Manuela Ramos, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy a range of products for the business, e.g., charcoal, platanos, salt, rice, sugar and soft drinks.

In order to make time for other household chores, Rosita gets up at 4am every morning so that she can bring the merchandise she needs from a market that is 8 kilometers (5 miles) away. She's very pleased that she can operate the business in her own house, something that also allows her to take care of her family at home.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosita pertenece al Banco Comunal "Las Doncellas", del A.H. Primavera 2da. Etapa MZ 30 Lt. 15 del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años de edad y es madre de 2 pequeños hijos, su pareja es vigilante de una tienda comercial, su sueldo no alcanza para cubrir las necesidades de la casa, por ello Rosita buscó emprender algún negocio dado que también tiene que atender a sus hijos, fue entonces que, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300.00 soles decidió poner una bodega en su casa, dado que la más cercana esta a 6 cuadras.

Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 700.00 (US$ 233 aprox.) pagadero en 4 cuotas, comprará variados productos como 1 saco de carbón, 1 racimo de plátano verde, media bolsa de sal, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar y 3 cajas de gaseosas.

Rosita, para no descuidar los quehaceres de la casa, se levanta a las 4:00 de la mañana y trae productos en cantidad del mercado mas cercano que esta a 8 km del lugar. Se siente muy contenta de tener el negocio en su misma casa, ya que le permite, también, atender los quehaceres de la casa.

loans.use: Buy grocery products for resell.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun V. was married in 1983 and has four children: one son and three daughters. Currently, she plants and sells vegetables in front of her house. In addition to the vegetables she grows, she buys some vegetables from the market and some from a neighboring village for reselling. She began to farm and resell vegetables in 1990. Her husband is a soldier. One of her children is helping her sell vegetables, and the other three are studying.

She has borrowed $200 from MAXIMA before. She will use this loan to purchase vegetables to resell in front of her house.

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables for reselling in front of her house.

loans.name: Carol's Group

texts.en:
Carol N. makes clothes and crafts. She wants to purchase materials in order to make more crafts as well as to buy crafts from others. She plans to supply the big shops in Kampala. She looks after 2 children.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To become a wholesale crafts supplier

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis, age 23, is married with 2 children (ages 8 and 3). She has a business selling sarongs which she began 6 years ago. Her business is open from 8am to 6pm daily.

Mwanahamis took out 2 previous loans with Tujijenge Tanzania to buy land and build a small house. She now hopes for a new loan to increase her sarong business.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Kyebando Central B(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Agnes N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock. Agnes is 32 years old and married. She has 4 children ranging from age 1 to 9 and her children go to school. Each week, Agnes makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save it and add to her business.

Agnes is joined in her small group by Safina N., Cissy N., Rose N., and Mariam N.. Safina N. has a business selling fish and wants to expand her business. Cissy N. is currently operating a business running a grocery store and wants a loan to increase her inventory. Rose N. operates a tailoring business and wants to purchase a sewing machine and more cloth fabrics. Mariam N. is currently in the business of operating a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more food and utensils.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items and expand business

loans.name: Bibirikiya

texts.ru:
Bibirikiya O. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 47 years old, married and has 6 children. She finished high school. Bibirikiya obtains a stable income from breeding and taking care of farm animals. She has a small farm business with goats and young cows. Bibirikiya would like to purchase one milk cow in order to produce fresh milk. During spring and summer it is easy to sustain large farm animals, because there is no problem feeding the animals. However, the client does not have the money. This is why she plans to receive a loan, which will help her reach the goal. Besides, she would be able to sell this milk, thereby receiving additional income for her family. The client has 6 children and she needs to raise her income. Bibirikiya plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

. Одинаева Бибирикия Абдуллоевна проживает в городе Яван. Ей 47 лет , она замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Образование среднее. Стабильный заработок имеет путем разведения крупно и мелко рогатого скота. Имеет клиентка небольшое хозяйство в котором имеет козочек и телят. Но Одинаева Бибирикия хочет купить одну дойную корову , для того чтобы получать свежее молоко. Весной и летом содержать крупно-рогатый скот просто , так как нет проблем с кормами. Но для этого у клиентки нет денег. Поэтому она запланировала получить кредит , который поможет ей реализовать свои планы. Кроме того получаемое ею молоко она сможет продавать и получать дополнительный доход для своей семьи , так как у нее 6 детей и клиентке просто необходимо увеличивать свои доходы. А погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Ibrohimova

texts.ru:
N. is 27 years old, married but has no children. She lives in a remote village in Utkonsoy of Gafurov region. He husband is working in Almaty. N. enjoys taking care of farm animals, and she makes wool from goat hair. Then she sells the wool for good money. Now, N. has 20 goats and 9 rams. She would like to apply for a loan in order to purchase more animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Назокат женщина в возросте 27 лет замужем но детей не имеет. Она проживает в отдаленом поселке Утконсой гафуровском районе. Ее муж в отъезде на заработках в Алма-ате. Сама Назокат любит ухаживать за скотом, и прядет с козьей шерсти пряжу потом продает ее за хорошие деньги. Сейчас у нее 20 коз и 9 баранов. Она обратилась к нам получить кредит для увеличения коз и барашков.

loans.use: To rear and resell farm animals

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda, is a loving and responsible mother of four little children, a few months ago she separated from her husband. Her desire is to keep her children united and without deprivation, nowadays they are suffering because of the absence of their father. She is straining and is ready to give more of herself so that her family can grow, it is because of this and with a lot of diligence that she dedicates herself to the selling things, additionally a few months ago she began the purchase and sale of cardboard, thanks to her desire to prosper her efforts are becoming worthwhile.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Amanda, es una amorosa y responsable madre de cuatro menores niños, hace algunos meses se separó de su esposo. Su deseo es mantener unidos y sin privaciones a sus hijos quienes actualmente vienen sufriendo por la ausencia de su padre.Ella viene esforzándose y está dispuesta a dar lo mejor de sí para que su familia siga adelante, es por ello que con mucha diligencia se dedica al comercio de artículos por campañas, adicionalmente a esta labor hace algunos meses inició la compra y venta de cartones, gracias a su entusiasmo por prosperar afortunadamente las cosas le van resultando rentable

loans.use: To increase her capital to strengthen her activities.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
Albertine A., 28, is married and the mother of three children. She works as a seamstress in Adéta, a village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Albertine wants to use this loan to purchase a sewing machine, cloth, and some lengths of wax print fabric so that she will be able to expand her business activity. The profit that her business will make will allow her to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Albertine A. est âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle exerce l’activité de couture à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Albertine désire, avec ce crédit, acheter une machine à coudre, des tissus et des pagnes pour accroître la capacité de son métier. Les profits qu’engendrera son activité lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase a sewing machine, cloth, and lengths of wax print fabric

Acheter une machine à coudre, des tissus et des pagnes

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 65-year-old Zena M., who is married and has four children aged between 20 and 40. In 1998, Zena established her fish business. Working seven days a week, 10 hours a day, and assisted by her children, she earns about $100 every month. Zena now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of fish. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro started working in this job since a very young age. With a great deal of hard work and with the help of his wife they managed to gather a small capital that they invested in the hammock business. This business grants them an income that covers their family's expenses.

He needs a loan in the amount of $400 that will be repaid in a term of 5 months. These funds will be invested in the purchase of strings and ropes to have more material with which they can make more hammocks. With your support Pedro will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro desde muy temprana edad se dedica al comercio, y a base de mucho esfuerzo, y con la ayuda de su esposa, logro juntar un pequeño capital el cual puso a trabajar en la elaboración y venta de hamacas, lo cual le permite tener un ingreso para cubrir los gastos familiares.

El necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar hilos y asi tener más material para elaborar sus hamacas. Con tu apoyo Pedro saldra adelante.

loans.use: To purchase string and rope.

loans.name: Thay

texts.en:
Mrs. Thay T. is a farmer and pig breeder in Tumpoar Village in the Kampong Cham Province. Her husband, Mr. Eak Thuok, is a farmer and he also helps with his wife's business. Mrs. Thay T. is 34-years-old and the mother of three children who are all attending school.

She currently has only three pigs but they are very healthy. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand and is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and buy more pig food to feed them. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding and to buy more pig food to feed the pigs.

loans.name: Massanvi

texts.fr:
Agée de 70 ans, Madame T. Massanvi est née à KPINNOU et réside actuellement à Aného. Veuve, elle a deux personnes à charge.

Son activité principale étant le maraîchage, elle sollicite un crédit  afin de promouvoir son activité. Sans doute, cela lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Ms. Massanvi T., age 70, was born in KPINNOU and currently resides in Aného. She is a widow and has the responsibility of caring for two people. Her main work being in market gardening, she is requesting a loan to advance her business. Without doubt, this will enable her to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Market gardening (truck farming)

loans.name: Godson

texts.en: Godson Degaulle is forty-eight years old. He is married with two kids. Godson has been a taxi driver for the past ten years. This has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He drives passengers from the local lorry station to nearby towns at a  fare of 30 pesewas per person. However, his business has been in crisis of late because his car has broken down and he needs money for repairs. With the loan, Godson wants undertake effective repair works on his car to enable him to resume his business and get his kids back to school. He is a member of a borrowing group called Ultimate Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: The purchase of spare parts to repair his taxi cab.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloth to produce window curtains and tablecloths

loans.name: Ajmal

texts.en:
Ajmal lives in distract 10, in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 32 years old, single and has a small internet cafe. He would like to make a loan to increase the size of his business which he uses to support his family.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 afghan for a term of 12 months. He wants to expand his business and install new high speed internet connections in his shop. He also wants to buy two or three new computers and other building materials that he needs for his shop.

He is very happy with this new loan process available in Afghanistan. Now, every entrepreneur has it available to improve their businesses. He wants to thank lenders from all around the world.

loans.use: To buy computers and high speed internet connections

loans.name: Ebere

texts.en: Ebere O. sells second-hand clothes. The demand for her second-hand clothes is high. Ebere is 31 years old and married with 5 children. Ebere is a LAPO client. Ebere needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is a determined mother of 3 children and a compassionate wife to a sick husband. She never loses hopes and works hard to support her family. She manages a variety store and twice a week has to wake-up as early as 3 o'clock in the morning to buy inventory for her variety store as the market is 67 kms. from her home. Starting with a small capital of PHP 5000 obtained from a loan with HSPFI, Sally was able to expand her variety store. She hopes to  buy inventory in large quantity for her variety store so that she won't need to frequently go to the market  to purchase supplies.. Therefore she is requesting a loan for additional capital amounting to PHP 11,000.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her general store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đặng Thị N. năm nay 27 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ đầu năm 2008. Hiện hai vợ chồng chị đều đang kinh doanh điện thoại, đồng hồ và kính mắt tại thị trấn Gia Lộc tỉnh Hải Dương. Bên cạnh kinh doanh các mặt hàng trên chồng chị còn làm thêm nghề sửa chữa điện thoại nên hàng tháng cho thu nhập rất ổn định( 4.000.000đ/ tháng)
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dang Thi N. is 27 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2008. She and her husband has a telephone, watch and eye glass business. In addition to selling those merchandises, her husband also fixes telephones so her family's income is at stable 4,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in her family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Marcelina C., 62 years old, is married to Rudy, a fisherman. They have five children and all of them are married.

Mrs. C. has been a member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP microfinance program since 2004. She has religiously paid all her loan obligations. She was encouraged to be a member of Paglaum in order to obtain a loan for her project and to support their cost of living.

Now, Mrs. C. has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase a fishing net and other fishing accessories. Her project is still in progress and she hopes to have another fishing net for them to gain from and to support the day-to-day needs of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and other fishing accessories

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Adolia

texts.en: Adolia B. is 54 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children who are now working. Her husband is a tailor. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since August 2007. She wants a loan for capital to expand her "carenderia" (restaurant) business. She deeply wishes for a good return on her business and to save for their old age.

loans.use: As capital to expand her carenderia

loans.name: Vallecito Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “VALLECITO”; son un total D. 11 miembros, ellos son D. diferentes provincias D. la ciudad, y actualmente son vecinos del distrito D. San Sebastián, ubicado a 25 minutos D. la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios vienen trabajando con la institución 3 años consecutivos, muchos D. ellos lograron terminar D. construir sus viviendas con estos dineros, por lo que siguen apostando en la sociedad D. su banquito; ellos tienen diferentes negocios como, tiendas abarrotes, venta D. verduras y frutas,  artesanía, carpintería, movilidad particular.

Por lo que los socios solicitan el préstamo cómo capital D. trabajo y D. este modo seguir reinvirtiendo en sus diferentes negocios, para así poder traer más prosperidad a sus vidas.

Todos los socios agradecen el esfuerzo emitido mediante este medio y valorando el préstamo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en los plazos programados.
texts.en:
There are a total of 11 members of the "Vallecito" community bank. They come from different provinces of the city and are currently residents of the San Sebastian district, located 25 minutes away from Cuzco. The group members have been working with our institution for the past three years. With this money a lot of them have been able to finish construction of their homes. They have been able to continue to count on the support of the community bank. They have various businesses such as general stores, fruit and vegetable sales, artisan products, carpentry and private transport. Our members are requesting this loan to be used as business capital. They will be able to reinvest in their businesses, bringing further prosperity to their lives. All of the group members appreciate the strength brought by these means and value this loan. They pledge to repay their loan within the scheduled repayment term.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Morris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Run their businesses

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es: Noemí es una joven que a sus 23 años tiene un hijo, por quien trata de ser padre y madre, ya que su pareja la abandonó; encontrando en sus padres el apoyo necesario para salir adelante junto a su hijo. Desde que se repuso del abandono de su pareja decidió trabajar para solventar los gastos de su pequeño hijo, por lo que sus padres le brindaron un espacio en su casa para iniciar un negocio. Ahora tiene una pequeña librería que viene funcionando desde hace 1 año, y en este corto tiempo le ha generado los ingresos necesarios para vivir, y sobre todo le está dando la posibilidad de ampliar y mejorar su local, en el cual están puestas todas sus esperanzas para progresar. Pero para lograr esto tuvo que pasar por muchos días de sacrificio y necesidades con su hijo, ya que las ganancias que tenían las invertía en la compra de nueva mercadería, y no les quedaba mucho para ellos. Pero ahora, Noemí está ambicionando tener una bazar, pero para ello tendrá que ambientar su local y construir su propia casa. Ella es nueva en MFP, este es su primer préstamo, y tiene muchas ganas de trabajar responsablemente junto a las señoras que conforman su grupo. Los 1000 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de mercadería para su librería y mejorar la apariencia de su local.
texts.en:
Noemí, a 23 year old young woman, has a son. She tries to be both mother and father to him because his father abandoned her. Her parents helped her and her son get ahead. Once she got over the abandonment, she decided to work to cover her small son’s expenses. Her parents offered her a space in their house to start a business. She now has a small bookstore. In the short time she has had the store, one year; she has generated enough income to live on. Above all, it has given her the possibility of expanding and improving her store. She has put all of her hopes for progressing in the store. She and her son had to sacrifice a lot. She used her earnings to buy new merchandise, and there was not much income left for them. Now, Noemí wants to have a variety store. To do so she will have to adapt her location and build her own house. She is new in MFP, and this is her first loan. She really wants to work responsibly with the women who form her group. The 1,000 PEN is to buy merchandise for her bookstore and to improve its appearance.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and fix up her store

loans.name: Musabe

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мусабе – женщина , которая продаёт детскую одежду и обувь. Она  за товаром ездит в Бишкек два раза в месяц.  Для завоза летнего ассортимента хочет получить повторно кредит.
Планирует привезти летние трусики, маячки , футболочки. Она благодарна организации за финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
Musabe sells children’s clothing and shoes. She travels to Bishkek for her merchandise twice per month. She would like to obtain another loan in order to acquire a summer goods assortment. She plans to bring in summer shorts, tank tops and t-shirts. Musabe is grateful to our organization for the financing and support. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer goods assortment

loans.name: Nuumasaga

texts.en: Nuumasaga V., 39, is married with four children.  She has one year of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the public and village people five days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala.  SPBD loans are Nuumasaga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knapsack sprayer, chemicals, knives, spade, wheel barrow, and seeds

loans.name: Ismatilla

texts.en:
U. Ismatilla is 42 years old and lives with his wife and four children, to whom he is a devoted father. He makes the most of every opportunity, such as when he started selling candies in the food market at Dushanbe. He gives his business constant attention all day long every day, and in this way he has attracted customers. His income enables him to contribute to the home finances. This is an activity Ismatilla enjoys because he can rest from his hard labor in the countryside. He is motivated in his work by the need to support the family finances and take care of his children's education in school. Ismatilla is requesting a loan with which he will invest in merchandise for his shop. He wishes to stock it with more products and offer the best products every day.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase candies to enlarge his range of goods

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda C. is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Linda is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Linda owns and operates a business in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Linda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Linda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Linda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles, threads, etc. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Linda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles, threads, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Chapakazi borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 48 years old woman,she is single and a mother of 6 children.Her children are aged 30,28,26,21,15,11 years.

Elizabeth started her own business selling charcoal 3 years ago,she works 4 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 280,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is elizabeth`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Elizabeth hopes to save more money,pay school fess,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
SABALI est un regroupement de six femmes, toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans  et  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à KAMELEN SIRAKORO  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dont le but  est de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  condiments,  de chaussures,  de  poisson fumé,  de pomme de terre etc.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 paniers de condiments alimentaires ,35 paires de chaussures, 12 cartons de poissons fumés et 10 sacs de 50 kg de pomme de terre.  Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages voisins. 
Les marchandises sont vendues  en détail au marché et de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et généralement au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000 FCFA dont une partie sera investie dans les activités et l’autre partie en épargne.
texts.en:
Sabali is a group of 6 women, all married, with an average age of 33 and on average, 4 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Kamelen Sirakoro, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their 9th loan, working together with Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the intention of satisfying their customers’ needs.

They have various businesses among others, selling condiments, shoes, smoked fish, potatoes, etc. With this new loan, they intend to buy 20 baskets of condiments, 35 pairs of shoes, 12 cartons of smoked fish, and 10 sacks of 50 kg of potatoes. They do their buying in the big market of Sikasso town and in the surrounding villages. The goods are sold retail in the markets and on foot around the area, to a clientele composed of women, men, and generally for cash.

They each expect to make a average monthly profit of 22,000 F CFA, of which a part will be invested back into their businesses and the rest put into savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 49 married with six children aged between 18 and 30 years. Three of her children go to school and the rest finished school and got married.  She takes care of additional family members. Margaret resides and owns a five roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Ndeeba Najjannkumbi Kizito Zone. Margaret works seven days a week.  Margaret owns shop selling second hand clothes in Margaret. She buys her merchandise from Owino one of the busiest markets in Kampala city and uses public transport to and from shopping Margaret doesn’t pay rent for her business premises as she works from her home.  She sells to all categories of people and on both retail and whole sale and besides selling second hand clothes she does tailoring when need arisesMargaret has been in this business for fifteen years and with MCDT for seven years servicing her third loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand clothing and clothes materials for tailoring Margaret  is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning whole sale shop

loans.use: to buy more used clothing and clothing materials

loans.name: Chhoem's Group

texts.en: Pictured here are three low-income people who have decided to seek a loan for different purposes. One of these people, Mrs. Chhoem S., 42, has been chosen to be the leader of this loan group by the other members. Chhoem S. is a widow and has three children, one of whom is married while the others are single. One of her daughters works in a garment factory. To earn a living, Chhoem S. plants a rice crop on the land in the village. She needs a loan in order to buy fertilizer to grow a rice crop during the approaching rice season. The other two borrowers are Suos S., a farmer, who is asking for a loan to buy more fertilizer for her business, and Mel Y, a palm climber, who is requesting a loan to build a ladder for climbing palm trees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow a rice crop during the approaching rice season

loans.name: Horencia

texts.es:
Horencia es una atenta mujer de 56 años, vive con sus 3 hijos: Fátima de 19, Esteban de 16 y Ricardo de 14 años. Ella se esfuerza cada día para entregar lo mejor de sí, no solo a su familia, sino también a sus clientes.

Pues desde hace 8 años esta simpática dama tiene un negocio de imprenta en su casa, ofrece los servicios de impresión de diferentes tipos de boletas, facturas y todo lo que se refiere al rubro a bajos precios. El negocio lo atiende con sus hijos, quienes la ayudan cuando terminan sus quehaceres estudiantiles. Horencia no se detiene y quiere lograr ampliar su negocio, ofrecer un mejor servicio y adquirir modernos implementos para su imprenta, pues como ella dice “es más cómodo mandar a imprimir por acá que por el centro, y el servicio es igual”; además sabe que algún día este negocio será la mejor herencia para sus hijos. 
Los días tranquilos de esta apacible mujer transcurren entre pedidos, conversaciones con los clientes, y un aroma a papel, sabe que su imprenta será más grande y casi lo puede imaginar, sólo necesita dar lo mejor de sí para lograrlo.

Ella ya tiene tiempo trabajando con MFP, este es su noveno préstamo, el cual una vez más lo invertirá para bien en la mejora de su negocio. Pero también piensa invertir en la compra de golosinas para la venta, pues el servicio de imprenta no es muy activo, y ella siempre piensa como negociante.
texts.en:
Horencia is a very polite woman of 56 who lives with her 3 children: Fátima, age 19; Esteban, age 16; and Ricardo, age 14. She works hard every day to give the best of herself, not only to her family, but also to her customers. For the past eight years, this amiable lady has operated a printing business in her home, offering printing services for various types of tickets, receipts, and all other related items at low prices. She operates the business with her children, who help her when they finish their schoolwork. Horencia is not stopping here, however; she wants to expand her business, offering better service and acquiring modern equipment for her print shop, since, as she says, "it is more convenient to have something printed here than downtown, and the service is the same." She also knows that someday her business will be the best legacy she can leave her children. The tranquil days of this serene woman are filled with printing orders, conversations with customers, and the smell of paper. She knows that her print shop will someday be bigger, and she can almost visualize it; she only needs to give the best of herself in order to achieve it. Horencia has already worked with MFP for some time; this is her ninth loan, which once again will be put to good use as an investment in improving her business. However, she is also thinking about investing in the purchase of some snacks to sell in her shop, since the printing business is not constantly active, and she is always thinking like an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in expanding her business

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina I. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables, beans, and fish, and is requesting a loan to stock cowpeas and maize flour to sell.  Lina is 41 years old and is married to a primary school teacher. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a big retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock cowpeas and maize flour to sell

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa V. D. F.  D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Cojutepeque, junto a un hijo el cual se dedica  a estudiar  y dos nietos. María teresa posee un comedor desD. hace cuatro años, el cual le ha permitido solventar todos los gastos D. su hogar, a pesar que ella recibe remesas D. una hija la cual resiD. en Los Estados Unidos, esto no le da a basto ya que lo invierte en los gastos D. sus nietos. Es por esto que María Teresa Solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio, comprando mesas y sillas nuevas y así mismo comprando materia primar para la elaboración D. la comida.
texts.en:
María Teresa V. D. F. is 42 years-old and lives in Cojutepeque, with her son, who is a student, and her two grandchildren. María Teresa has a cafeteria she has operated for four years, a business that has allowed her to take care of the household costs. Although she receives remittances from her daughter who lives in the United States, that money is not enough for all the costs, as it is invested in the expenses of the grandchildren. For this reason María Teresa is asking for this loan in order to improve her business by buying new tables and chairs, and also by purchasing more raw material for the preparation of the food.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a faithful LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. She used LAPO loan as the capital base of her business. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. 

Veronica lives in Agbor, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells crates of drinks at retail prices to her customers. She is 46 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a policeman and he also supports the home. Veronica hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She hopes to own a drink factory in the future. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is sixty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to eight children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Efua works hard to be able to provide for the family. She is a trader. She trades maize. Efua supplies the maize to food vendors in her community. She also treks to nearby towns to supply food vendors there. Efua buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthol K. is 52 years old, and a village bank president. She has been selected as president by the group members, who will use the loan for different purposes. This village bank loan group consists of 21 members who all live in Damnak Sangkae Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Chanthol K. is a farmer who owns a plot of land for growing rice. Her husband, Mr. Sem Som, owns three trucks for transporting soil to resell. However hard this family tries to earn money with their business, they still earn less income than is needed to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Chanthol K. decided to request a loan to start a new career in buying piglets for breeding. This couple has four children who are studying at a local public school. All the members are shown in the picture but some of tH. are blocked.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Marebelle

texts.en: Marebelle L., 29 years old, is a food vendor. She desires to be able to earn a bigger income so that she can help her husband buy their family food and other basic necesities. She has three children and she is doing the very best she can to be able to augment their harvest to support their education. Marebelle wanted to venture into another business aside from having a farm. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy food ingredients to add to the dishes in her eatery business.

loans.use: Buy additional ingredients for eatery dishes

loans.name: Organized And Active Women Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Organizadas y Activas (MOA)” se formó con la unión varias vecinas del Barrio S. de la    ciudad de  Ñemby  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las venta de Ropas, de Bijouteries, Helados, Artesanias, etc.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la económía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable y con vistas a un crecimiento constante, con la ayuda de una asistencia financiera permanente.



      Hablaremos de la Señora Graciela Concepción M. Cáceres, es                casada, tiene 2 hijos una nena y un varón de profesión Policia y Docente. 
Ella vive en la casa de las calles Pte. Franco c/ Dr. Eusebio Ayala del Barrio S. (Centro) de la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
La sra Graciela es una mujer muy activa y multifacética, hace 12 años que se desempeña como Policia en la ciudad de Ñemby, integro la comisión que durante años solicitaron las refacciones de la infraestructuras de la comisaria de la sitada localidad.
La Sra M. es Sub-Oficial Mayor de la Policial Nacional, hizo cursos sobre prevención de adicciones, Hoy dia se desempeña como encargada de el Programa de Prevención de Adicciones de la Comisaria 7º de Ñemby. 
Ademàs se desempeña como docente en varios colegios de su comunidad en la Catedra de Ética y ciudadania y otra clase adicional sobre prevención de adicciones como el Alcohol y las drogas.
Y para ello durante el 2008 y 2009 se puso en campaña para publicar un libro dirigido a niños y jóvenes de su querida ciudad de Ñemby a fin de implementar en los Centros Educativos de la zona. 
        Su esfuerzo tuvo sus frutos público varios ejemplares con la ayuda de la comisaria local y de algunos colegios, que lo pusieron en práctica como material de apoyo para la juventud estudiosa, y de esa manera aprenden jugando, pintando, un poco de autoestima, buenos modales, convivencia intrafamiliar y sobre todo a prevenir el consumo de drogas. 
Es un material muy didáctico que llego a ser muy elogiado por sus camaradas policias como por sus colegas docente.Tanto fue asi que el año pasado en el dia del  Agente de Policia,  recibió una medalla de oro, y una mención de honor por al merito de ser la primera mujer policia en públicar un libro titulado “Soy Libre” que trata sobre la prevención de adipciones.
   Su idea es relizar más publicaciones de su libro para otras instituciones educativas interesadas en el material.
         Graciela es una mujer que colabora ayuda a su comunidad, es muy solidadaria, formo parte de varias comisiones vecinales tales como pro-calle, pro-plaza, pro-comisaria de Ñemby, fueron años de tramites solicitando ayuda del gobierno  y gracias a ello este año se han comenzado las refacciones para el nuevo local policial de tan importante localidad.
texts.en:
The Organized and Active Women Committee was formed from the union of several neighbors in the Barrio S. zone of the city of Ñemby. All the members of the committee have developed independent occupations such as selling clothes, jewelry, ice cream, crafts etc. All the members of the committee are mothers who participate with the end goal of strengthening their household economy. They hope to develop their entrepreneurship in a sustainable way, with a vision of constant growth with the help of a permanent financial assistance. We spoke with Mrs. Graciela Concepción M. Cáceres. She is married with 2 children, a baby and a boy. She is a teacher and works with the police. She lives in a house in the central part of Barrio S. in the city of Villa Elisa. Mrs. Graciela is a very active and multi-talented lady. For the past 12 years, she has worked as a policewoman in the city of Ñemby and she made up the delegation that for years solicited the refurbishment of the infrastructure of the precinct. Mrs. M. is the Deputy Major of the National Police. She runs classes on the prevention of addictions. These days she is in charge of a program to prevent addictions in the 7th precinct of Ñemby. In addition, she acts as a teacher in the department of ethics and citizenship in various colleges in her community. She also teaches a class on the prevention of addictions such as alcohol and drugs. In 2008 and 2009, she worked to create a book aimed for the children and young people of her beloved city of Ñemby. Her efforts bore fruit and she published several samples with the help of local commissions and some colleges who used the material for their students. In this way they learned of gambling, self-esteem, role models, family living, and above all to how to prevent drug use. It is great teaching material and has been highly praised by her fellow police officers and by her fellow teachers. Last year, on the Day of the Police, she received a gold medal and a honorable mention for being the first woman police officer to publish a book. The book titled “I’m Free” is about the prevention of addictions. Her goal is to print more copied of her book for other educational institutions interested in the material. Graciela is a woman who helps her community. She is very good at unifying groups. She forms part of various neighborhood groups such as Pro-Calle, Pro-Plaza, Pro-comisaria de Ñemby and has done years of work to solicit the help of the government. Thanks to her efforts, this year they have begun the refurbishment of the new police station which is so important to this community.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy books such as a Spanish - Guarani Dictionary

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been married to Arcelito for thirty years now. She is 53 years old and has five children, her oldest being 27 years old. She is involved in rice farming and she helps her husband till their 1.5 hectares (3.75 acres) of rice field.

The needs in Elizabeth’s family are growing so she works hard to help provide for them. One of the challenges she currently faces is her children’s education. The rates of school fees get higher every year so she makes sure to have income from her farm.

Elizabeth requested a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). She told CEVI that she would use the loan to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Cristina's Group

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina S. is from the village of Salay, Angadanan, Isabela Province. She is 45 years old. Ma. Cristina is the group leader for a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ma. Cristina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising and fattening pigs for sale. Ma. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP every four months for this kind of activity.

In 2008, Ma. Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Luisa Yesika

texts.es: La Sra. S. tiene experiencia en crédito ella tuvo un crédito anterior para sus estudios y prepararse profesionalmente en la elaboración de pasteles y actualmente solicito un crédito para comprar una máquina para elaborar pasteles ya que es profesional en pastelia, y tiene mucha demanda ya que en este pueblo es la única pastelería que hay.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. has loan experience. She had a previous loan for her education and to prepare herself professionally to make cakes. She has currently asked for a loan to buy a machine for making cakes. She is a professional pastry chef, and there is a lot of demand. Hers is the only pastry shop in this town.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a machine for making cakes

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a wife of M. S. and lives in the city of Multan, Pakistan, famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. She is an enthusiastic lady who stays at home to manage the household work, but also runs her own business sewing clothes for her neighbors in order to generate income.
Shahnaz is a mother of five children – one son and four daughters. All of her children are receiving an education from the local school. Her husband has an animal-selling business. He purchases animals from the animal markets and sells them on to customers. His customer base is mostly butchers in need of good animals who approach him because he has good knowledge of animal breeds. He has 25 years of experience in this business. Currently, the family has one cow at their home.
Shahnaz has successfully repaid her first loan to Kiva partner, Asasah (a microfinance institution in Pakistan). Now she has applied for a new loan to buy animals (a cow and goats) to expand her husband’s animal-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase animals to resell

loans.name: El Alba Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Alba” esta representado por la señora Gardenia y conformada por 11 miembros muy trabajadores y entusiastas ellos van cumpliendo su tercer ciclo con la institución por lo que han demostrado ser socios muy responsables y honestos. La señora Gardenia ha crecido mucho con los anteriores ciclos los cuales uso para su mercadería ahora ella desea poder ampliar su puesto de venta de ropa y para ello requiere del un nuevo financiamiento que le permite darle a su hija un sustento ella no es casada pero tiene su pareja con la que convive y la apoya en sus proyectos ella vive en la casa de su madre pero desea poder independizarse y poder tener un hogar propio algún día. El resto de las socias se dedican a la venta de abarrotes, venta de empanadas, venta de ropa, venta de refrigerios, venta y producción de plátano, venta comida, venta de cosméticos, panadería y transporte público en moto taxis. En algunos negocios hay mas competencia que en otros,  la mayoría de las socias del grupo se dedica a la venta de abarrotes ya que tienen un puesto de venta en el mercado Campesino y otros ambulan por las calles para vender sus productos por lo que tienen que esforzarse para poder obtener el ingreso diario que es el sustento de sus familias y su posibilidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.  El crédito esta destinado a la compra de mercadería, insumos, mejoramiento de sus herramientas de trabajo, reparación de sus vehículos y la construcción y remodelación de casetas y viviendas. En Agrocapital están en su tercer ciclo, sus antecedentes crediticios son regulares ya que algunas socias en ciclos anteriores han incumplido al plan de pagos y el grupo tubo que reformarse con las socias que si cumplieron con sus pagos y son responsables algunos miembros son nuevos pero cuentan con experiencia gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital
texts.en:
Gardenia represents the El Alba group. It is comprised of 11 very hard-working and enthusiastic members. They are completing their third cycle with the institution, and they have demonstrated themselves to be very responsible and honest members. Gardenia has grown a lot with the previous loan, which she used for merchandise. She now wishes to be able to expand her stall where she sells clothes. To do so she needs a new loan, which will allow her to support her daughter. She is not married, but she lives with her life partner. He supports her in her projects. She lives in her mother’s house, but she wants to be able to be independent and have her own home some day. The rest of the members sell groceries, empanadas, clothes, or refreshments. Some produce and sell bananas, sell food, sell cosmetics, have bakeries, or provide public transportation in “mototaxis” (three wheeled motorized vehicles). There is more competition in some businesses than others. Most of the members of the group sell groceries. They have a stall in the Mercado Campesino (country market). Other members sell their products as street vendors. They need to put forth a lot of effort to be able to get their daily income. This income supports their families and is their chance to improve their quality of life. The loan is to buy merchandise and supplies. It is to improve their work tools, to repair their vehicles, and to remodel their houses. They are in their third cycle in AgroCapital. Their previous loans were passable. In previous cycles some members did not make their payments. The group had to change itself so that the members make their payments and are responsible. Some members are new, but they have experience thanks to loans in other institutions that are similar to the Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
Americo forma parte del banco comunal “La Unión de Ollantaytambo”, tiene 40 años y tiene cuatro hijos (dos varones  y dos mujeres), es natural de Quillbamba del distrito de Santa Teresa. Su actividad económica principal es elaborar y vender panes, él tiene un horno que está ubicado en su domicilio. Ya son tres años que se dedica a negocio y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Americo es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, él requiere el préstamo para comprar dos sacos de harina que lo va comprar cada uno a 150 soles. El anhelo del socio es ampliar su horno y vender panes en cantidades mayores. 

El socio es fundador del banco comunal y tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, el socio manifiesta, que se encuentra contento y satisfecho con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación. 
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Americo is a member of the Communal Bank “La Unión de Ollantaytambo”. He is 40 years old and has four children (two sons and two daughters). Americo is originally from Quillbamba in the District of Santa Teresa.

He earns a living by making and selling bread. Americo has an oven in his home that he uses in his work. He has been in business for three years and has done very well as a result of the effort he puts into his job. Americo is a hardworking and enterprising person who looks at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead and build a better future for his children.

He is requesting a loan to buy two sacks of flour that cost 150 PEN each. Americo hopes to acquire a larger oven so that he can sell bread in larger quantities. He is a founding member of his Communal Bank and has participated in ten loan cycles. Americo says that he is happy and satisfied with the loan services, savings, and training classes.

He is grateful for this opportunity that has been provided to him and promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two sacks of flour

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen O., 46, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Felix O., a construction worker/coal businessman, they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been selling coal for fuel to her neighbors.

Helen has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her fuel business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying coal in bulk that she will retail to her customers.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy coal in bulk

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa L. is from the village of  Manolo Fortich Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Elisa is married and has 2 adult children. Elisa owns & operates a business, buying and selling coconut. Elisa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elisa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for resale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tiessiri 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI 3 est constitué de femmes mariées du village de N’TION dans la préfecture de SAN, région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 51  ans, au moins  9 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  premier prêt  de campagne.
AWA D. compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide   des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de TENE. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de TENE,  MOPTI et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle généralement des revendeurs venant des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe  comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 29000à 36000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri 3 group consists of married women from the village of N'tion in the prefecture of San, Segou region (Mali's Fourth Administrative District). They live in traditional families. On average, each is 51 and has at least nine children. They are peanut farmers. Hoping to make more profit from farming, the group decided to sign up with Soro Yiriwaso this year, and are receiving their first operational loan. Awa D. plans to use her loan to buy seed peanuts, small tools, and fertilizer at the big market in Tene. After the rains end, the harvest is stored long enough to increase in value and be sold in the big market of Tene, Mopti and in nearby markets at retail (often, wholesale) to customers who mostly come from large towns. Each member of the group is counting on making a profit of between 29,000 and 36,000 FCFA after their produce is sold. They will use the money to pay loan interest and day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seed and small tools

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en:
Yudaya is widowed with six children and all her children go to school.  She also takes acre of additional family members (grand-children). She owns a stall in Bwaise market selling bananas.  She has been in this banana business for a very long time and buys bunches of bananas from delivery vans which get them from villages. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work.  

Yudaya wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas.  Her customers are the nearby community.  She works in a semi-urban area and works seven days a week.   Her business challenges include the rainy season and thieves. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and starting going directly to farmers. She decided to work with MCDT because of low interest charged.  She resides in and owns a house but the family has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her monthly expenses include food, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials like cement to repair his home and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. is a married woman who lives in Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures, a pig fattening and a motorcycle business. Her husband, Vicente A., is 35 years old and works as a driver. They have four children aged 6 to 14 years. Veronica joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. 

With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Veronica has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her to earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, thus raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing 12,000 PHP to buy more piglets so that she can continue to save for the future and send her children to school. Veronica A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join their team.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married, with four children, to a hotel supplier.  All the children attend school.  For the last two years, she has been operating her business of supplying detergents. She sells from door to door to her neighbours and also to passers-by.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of detergents.  Her other source of income comes from her husband’s salary. 

Her major challenge in the business is high transportation costs as she travels from door to door. Her major goal is to get enough money to raise her family. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to get a loan to boost her business.

Rose owns a home with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of detergents.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 48 years old and is married with five children who are between 10 and 22 years old.

Silas is a lawyer and he has been in this profession for about eleven years. His office is open from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day.

Silas needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy some equipment to be used in his business. With this loan, he will also try to renovate the place from which he operates his service.

If successful, Silas hopes that he will improve the quality of his services and, in addition to that, he really hopes that his clients will increase as well as his profits. Through operating his business, he hopes for a better future for his family.

loans.use: To buy some equipment and to renovate his office

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 20 años, es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a su familia, convive con Ángel de 28 años, producto de su amor tuvieron a Ruth de 3 añitos, los tres viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Chiras.
