Ella se dedica 8 años a la agricultura, le gusta mucho cuidar la tierra y poder cultivarla, como también pasar el tiempo con su esposo, que le ayuda a cuidar y arar la tierra. Los productos que siembra son papa y arveja, los que después comercializa en el mercado central de su ciudad. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Irma, también cría vacas y toros; es por ello que más adelante desea abrir una estancia, donde podrá criar ganados de calidad y obtendrá la mejor leche y queso de la región, de la misma manera quiere construir su casa propia donde podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Es el primer crédito con MFP y está feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde está segura podrá crecer más. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará remedios para su cultivo de papa; asimismo invertirá para contratar operarios que le ayudarán a cosechará su sembrío.
texts.en: Irma, who is 20, is a hard-working woman who is dedicated to her family. She lives with Ángel, who is 28 years old. As a product of their love, they had Ruth who is 3 years old. The three of them live in a rented house located in the Chiras area. She has been dedicated for 8 years to farming. She likes to care for the land and be able to cultivate it, as well as spend time with her husband, who helps her care for and plow the land. The products that they sow are potatoes and peas, which they later sell in the central market in their city. But this is not all. Irma also raises cattle and bulls, a result of which Irma wishes to open a ranch in the future where she would be able to raise quality cattle and produce the best milk and cheese in the region. She also wishes to construct her own house where she could give a better quality of life to her family. This is her first loan with MFP and she is happy to belong to her community bank where she is sure she'll be able to grow more. With the loan that she will obtain, she will buy remedies for her potato crop. Additionally, she will invest in hiring workers who will help harvest her crop.

loans.use: Buy remedies to take care of her potato crop as well as hire workers to help her with the harvest.

loans.name: 020304-Bac Son-Hoang Phu Group

texts.en:
Thu M. T. is a 39 year-old female living in the town of Hoang Hoa.  Thu is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 020304-Bac Son-Hoang Phu.

Thu is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, Thu operates a family member's fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Thu has been engaged in this business for over 19 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2008, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by Thu from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Hoa T. M. is a 43 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.

2. Nga N. T. is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


3. Thuy T. T. is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

4. Nhi N. T. is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

5. Thuy P. T. is a 32 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Hezekina

texts.en:
Hezekina is 36 years old and married to Francis Wairegi. They have three dependent children and her husband contributes to the family income. She has been running the business for four years with an income of Kshs 7000 a month.

She is taking her fourth loan with KADET to buy stock of sugar, flour, rice to increase food production for sale. She hopes to improve the living standards of the family and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy stock of sugar, flour, rice to increase production

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie B. is from the village of Malinao, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 49 years old. Rosie is separated from her spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rosie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling green and sweet bananas, and also selling junk foods & canned goods, retailing charcoal per kilogram & fruit such as mangoes & guavas in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en:
Mr. Sophon L., 49 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Kong Soeung, 45 years old, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have seven children - three sons and four daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers; one is a construction worker, and the others attend school.

Sophon is a construction worker, while his wife is a weaver. The couple also grows rice. Sophon is now requesting his first loan of $1,000 to use for farming and to buy a cow to raise.

loans.use: To use for farming and to buy a cow

loans.name: Las Chicas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Chicas está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Jaqueline A. Reyes de 29 años se dedica al comercio de ropa (camisas, pantalones, jeans, blusas, vestido, camisetas, faldas…etc.) este negocio lo inicio con poco y con forme al tiempo, su ardua labor y los prestamos ha ido creciendo. 
 Ella invertirá en mercadería para surtir su negocio y aprovechar esta temporada.
Las otras integrantes son Karla E. quien vende ropa y Marlene M. quien comercializa ropa y calzado. Ellas desean salir adelante y crecer.
texts.en:
The Las Chicas group is composed of three hard working, dedicated, enterprising people.  One of them is Jaqueline A. Reyes, 29, who sells clothes (shirts, pants, jeans, blouses, dresses, undershirts, skirts, etc.).  She started the business with very little but as time has gone by, with her hard work and loans, it has been growing.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her business and take advantage of this season.

The other members are: Karla E. who sells clothes, and Marlene M. who sells clothes and shoes.  They want to get ahead and grow.

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Lilian Syokwia

texts.en: Lilian Syokwia C. is 28 years old, married, and has three children. Lilian sells second-hand clothes in the Bamburi open air market which is very busy and she has many customers. She also sells water and eggs. She has been in this business for the last two years and earns a good income. This is her second loan from KADET. She plans to renovate her business premises and add more clothes to her inventory. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of her business. Her dream is to own many kiosks.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises and add more clothes for sale

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina belongs to Jaranwala, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for 15 years.
 
To financially assist her husband, she weaves carpets. She receives orders from different carpet sellers and earns a good profit after completing them. She has just started doing this business but she is getting a good reputation among her clients due to her quality of work.
 
Besides her work, she also manages the household work efficiently and takes care of her family. She has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Three of them are getting their education while the youngest one is only 4 years old.
 
Her husband operates a business of selling motorbike spare parts. His shop is located in the market where he fulfills the requirements of his customers to earn a good profit.
 
Samina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy motorbikes spare parts to put into his shop for selling.  

He has been doing this business for 10 years and Samina is confident that, through the loan investment, her husband will be able to make more sales and will generate more income. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She is a responsible client and has a good credit record. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Samina.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts for selling

loans.name: C 5601 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking 62 years old woman with four children aged between 14 and 34. She is pictured above on the right wearing the blue and green dress. For six years she has owned a small shop which sells various products such as rice, sugar, cosmetics, and so on. Her business is open from 6am until 8pm every day. 

Josephine and her business are well known in the region, which is the reason why she is the leader of the group called “Tuzamurane” in the local language. She and her group, which consists of four women and two men, have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products for their businesses. Josephine especially needs this loan in order to expand her product offering and satisfy the demands of her customers.  If this satisfaction is reached, Josephine and the other group members hope to earn more profits. With these profits she expects to save money for her future and to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her shop and expand her business

loans.name: Rosas Del Pedregal Group

texts.es: Rosas del Pedregal es un banco D. emprendimiento conformada por 8 socias que viven en la zona del pedregal, al sur D. la ciudad,  Es una zona que aun no esta urbanizada por lo que no cuentan con muchos servicios básicos como el agua. Aunque para los habitantes D. esta zona esto no representa dificultad, La  presidenta del banco es la Sra. Alicia que se dedica a la confección y arreglo D. prendas D. vestir y también trabaja como cocinera en una pensión D. la ciudad. Ella vive con sus tres hijos aun en la etapa escolar. Y su esposo que se dedica al trabajo D. transportista.  La Sra. comprara maquinas D. costura con el préstamo,  para D. esta manera incrementar su capital D. trabajo, es una persona trabajadora  Y agradece la colaboración que se le otorga, todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos sacan a su familias adelante, están agradecidas con a institución por el apoyo brindado.ojo en la foto una D. las socias esta acompañado D. su esposo.
texts.en:
"Rosas D. Pedregal" is an entrepreneurial bank group comprised of 8 women who live in the Pedregal area in the southern part of the city.  This area is still underdeveloped and does not have many basic utilities such as running water.  But this does not represent difficulties for the population living in this area.  

The president of the bank, Mrs. Alicia, is a seamstress and also works as a cook in a hostel in the city.  She lives with her three school-aged children.  Her husband works in the transportation sector.  Alicia plans to use the loan to increase her working capital and buy a sewing machine.  She is a very hard-working person and grateful for the support she has received.  

All of the members are dependable, hard-working women who in many cases are the ones responsible for their families getting ahead.  They are grateful to the institution for the support received.  N.B.  One of the members is accompanied by her husand in the photo.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 48 years old and she is married with four children between 18 and 25 years old. Christine owns a business selling Irish potatoes. Her business is open from 8 am to 6 pm. She has seven years of experience in this business and Christine works every day each week except on the weekend.

Christine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing her business by purchasing more Irish potatoes to sell. The increased business will help her to earn more profits which will allow her to be more stable financially.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
Ceferino tiene 56 años y nació en la comunidad de Yanahuara de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del   Cusco,  Perú. El socio Ceferino es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, Ceferino vive en la comunidad donde nació. Su actividad económica de Ceferino es la venta y compra de ganado y en esta oportunidad el socio requiere el préstamo para comprar chanchos y ovejas. 
  
Ceferino pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Marcelo Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa Cusco y se encuentra muy contento por los servicios que le ofrece la Asociación.
texts.en: Ceferino is 56 years old and was born in the community of Yanahuara in the Urubamba province of the department of Cusco, Peru.  He is married and has 4 children.  Ceferino currently lives in the community where he was born.  Ceferino has a business buying and selling livestock, and on this occasion he needs a loan to buy pigs and sheep.  Ceferino belongs to the communal bank “Villa Marcelo Virgen del Carmen," which is part of the Asociación Arariwa in Cusco.  He is very pleased with the services that the Asociación offers.

loans.use: to buy pigs and sheep

loans.name: Wisdom Group

texts.en:
Fortunate P. is the group leader of Wisdom Group. She is a young lady aged 29 and can be identified in the group picture in a pink blouse. She is a widow with two children aged 8 and 4. She also has one dependant that she cares for. She has three years experience of home decor and kitchenware sales.  

She sells her kitchenware to local individuals and companies. She also runs a poultry business that supplements her income. The challenge she faces in her business is losses emanating from breakages, as most of her kitchenware is  breakable. 

With the loan, she intends to increase her stocks to enable her to deliver her orders on time. The profits from the business will cover her family’s general upkeep and assist on school fees for her children.  Her dream is to diversify her business by opening up a salon.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of kitchenware for resale

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella M. is from the village of Lacas, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Estrella is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Estrella owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, candies, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Estrella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a soft drinks business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Helen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  buy more stock of soft drinks to sell.
Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Acok Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ACOK est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent au même groupe d’artisan et mènent toutes la même activité, précisément la coiffure. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Anne Abakè, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Anne Abakè est née le 26 Juin 1975 et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Vincent. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont les leurs. Anne Abakè vit ensemble avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Anne Abakè a arrêté très tôt l’école au profit de la coiffure qu’elle a appris et qu’elle exerce depuis seize ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Anne Abakè vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier. Anne Abakè  achète ses produits à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin et aussi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Anne Abakè et son groupe sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The ACOK group is made up of three persons who belong to the same trade and work in the same business, namely hairdressing. The representative of this group, Anne Abakè, is raising her hand in the photo. 

Anne Abakè was born on June 26, 1975 and is married to a carpenter named Vincent. The couple is raising three children, all enrolled in school, of whom two are their biological children. 

Anne Abakè lives together with her family. The couple share in supporting their family. Anne Abakè stopped attending school early on to learn haridressing which she has been involved in for 16 years. At the same time, she sells hair extensions and cosmetics in her beauty shop. 

Anne Abakè  buys her products in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Bénin and also in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. This is the second time that she and her group are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to expand their businesses so that they can better serve their clientele.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Edenilson Alexander

texts.es:
Edenilson, es casado, tiene dos hijos de 3 y un año de edad, él tiene un taller de mecánica, tiene cuatro años de tener el negocio y lo aprendió desde joven.
Actualmente necesita invertir en el taller, comprando llaves y otras herramientas que le hacen falta para las reparaciones de los vehículos, al comprar estas herramientas estará brindando un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener un taller bien establecido, mejorar su trabajo y realizarlo con la mayor delicadeza, manteniendo satisfechos a los clientes y al mismo tiempo mejorando su condición en el hogar.
texts.en:
Edenilson is married and has two children aged 3 and 1.  He has an auto repair shop and has owned his business for four years.  He learned the trade when he was young.

Edenilson currently needs to invest in his auto repair shop, buying wrenches and other tools that he needs to repair vehicles.  By purchasing these tools, he will be able to provide a better service to his customers.

Edenilson's aspirations are to have a well-established business, to improve his work and carry it out with the greatest attention to detail, and to keep his customers satisfied.  At the same time, he hopes to improve the condition of his home.

loans.use: to buy wrenches

loans.name: Mimosa

texts.en:
Mimosa works hard to support her family. Mimosa is married and has a Carinderia (local eatery) business in the Philippines. Mimosa has been in this business for six years.

Mimosa requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy meat, fish, vegetables and other ingredients for her local eatery.

In the future, Mimosa would like to save money to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, vegetables and other ingredients for her local eatery.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia  lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. Olivia has a business of bakery. She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Olivia has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more bags of baking flour, cooking oil and baking powder.  She also generates additional income through selling airtime. The main business challenges for Olivia  include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked kiosk and also to sell wholesale only. Olivia lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and  piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of baking flour, cooking oil and baking powder.

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
La Sra. Gladys tiene 52 años, está casada y con dos hijos, ellos viven en la ciudad D. villa Elisa.
Gladys es una conocida peluquera D. su barrio y la mayoria D. los vecinos son sus clientes. Se dedica al rubro dese hace 25 años, brindando a sus clientes un excelente servicio.
Ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y solidaria con los demás. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por el bien D. sus hijos, para que puedan estudiar una carrera universitaria y convertirse en personas D. bien. Desea brindarle la educación a la que ella no tuvo acceso, como así también un nivel D. vida modesto, pero sin necesidades.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra D. colorantes, tintes, shampoo, enjuagues y otros productos que utiliza en su salón D. belleza.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys is 52 years old, married, and has two children. They live in the city of Villa Elisa.

Gladys is a recognized stylist in her neighborhood and most of her neighbors are her customers. She has been in this line of work for 25 years and provides her customers with excellent service. Gladys is considered to be a hardworking woman who is supportive of others. She says that everything she does is for the sake of her children, who are studying for university degrees so that they can become successful people. Gladys wants to proviD. them the education that she was not able to achieve as well as a modest standard of a living that does not lack the basic necessities.

She is requesting a loan to buy colorings, dyes, shampoos, conditioners, and other products used in her beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase colorings, dyes, shampoos, conditioners, and other products.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 46 years old and is a married man with four children. The oldest child is 19 years old and the youngest is 9. 

Jose is a farmer who works a property in Trinidad, Bohol. He has been growing and selling rice for 20 years now. Jose earns about 6000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month from farming. Jose works hard to improve his family's living conditions. 

Jose is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. He hopes to have his children finish college and be successful in their own fields.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 42 years old, married, and lives in the province of Isabela with her children. She always perseveres and has a fighting spirit.

Rose Marie is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feed and piglets and to raise. 

Rose Marie has always worked hard by caring for animals and does very well from it. This loan will improve her family's living conditions and help her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy feed and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Prossy’s group is comprised of two hard working women. Prossy is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala district of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. She is in the business of selling charcoal, which she has been doing for 5 years.  She also sells food as a secondary business.  

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and pay her own school fees.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.  She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a businessman aged 39, married and blessed with four children. For the last 15 years, he has been operating a business selling second-hand clothes to earn a living. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 to buy clothes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to operate his business through his previous loan.

loans.use: To buy used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with seven children. Three attend school while four are still too young for school. She lives in a house that she owns which does not have electricity or running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Saumu operates a dry fish sales business. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Saumu dreams of expanding her business and also establishing a motorcycle business to provide transportation. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 52 años, es viuda y tiene una hija a su cargo. Juntas residen en la localidad de Samugari, ubicada en la selva tropical Ayacuchana donde tiene su propia casa construida a base material rústico como adobe y techo de calamina. Ella proviene de una familia cuya tradición es la agricultura, y hoy es toda una experta en el tema agrícola. Ante la perdida de su amado esposo, le fue muy difícil sobresalir, y solo tuvo que mirar hacia delante y trabajar por su querida hija. Es así que siembra cacao, café y árboles maderables, productos que le han brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y cubrir los gastos de educación de su hija. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los carros de carga son muy escasos por esta parte de la zona. Este será su 17avo crédito con MFP y es una socia muy cumplidora con sus anteriores cuotas, por lo que espera seguir así. Con los 2, 000 soles que solicita, adquirirá sacos de abono y fertilizantes naturales para mejorar sus plantas y así sacar buen provecho en cuanto a sus frutos.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 52, a widow, and has a daughter in her care. They live together in the the village of Samugari, located in the tropical forests of Ayacucho. Here she has her own house, constructed with simple materials such as adobe and tin roofing. She comes from a family whose tradition is farming, and today she is quite an expert on farming.  

Faced with the loss of her beloved husband, it was very difficult time for her to get through, as on her own she had to look ahead, and work for the sake of her dear daughter.  That's why she grows cacao, coffee, and trees for lumber. These products have provided her with the income necessary to maintain herself, and pay for her daughter's school expenses.

What she most likes about her work is planting her land, and she does it with great care. She has been doing this work for ten years and what she considers the hardest part is transporting her crops, since transport trucks are very scarce in that part of the region.

This will be her 17th loan with MFP. She is a very reliable member with regard to her previous payments, so she expects to continue in this way. With the 2,000 soles she is applying for, she will buy bags of natural and other fertilizers in order to improve her plants and obtain a good yield from her crops.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Danize

texts.en:
Danize is a 35-year-old married woman with nine children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the produce business for four years and with the income generated, she has been able to pay school fees for her children.

Her hardship is high commodity prices and her vision is having a bigger business plus educating her children.

Danize needs the loan to buy rice and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old, married, and has eight children who are all in school.

She has a business of selling fish in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for nine years.

Elizabeth requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more fish for sale. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо умная и активная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она занимается купле- продажей хозяйственными товарами. В основном она продает шампунь, порошок, мыло, парфюмерия и т.д. Жители, которые живут там, часто посещают ее магазин, и она с радостью принимает их. Она всегда привозит хорошие высококачественные товары, чтобы товары понравились клиентам. Мархабо хотела бы получить займ для покупки товаров с целью увлечения товарооборота и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Marhabo is a smart and active woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of three children.  She is involved in buying and selling household goods.  Marhabo primarily sells shampoo, laundry detergent, soap, perfumes and the like.  Resident, who live in the area, often come to her store, and happily welcomes them.  She always brings in good, high-quality merchandise, so that her customers like the merchandise.  Marhabo wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of merchandise in order to increase goods turnover and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise
